1614 ImGuiMod_Shortcut = ImGuiMod_Ctrl, // Removed in 1.90.7, you can now simply use ImGuiMod_Ctrl
1615 ImGuiKey_ModCtrl = ImGuiMod_Ctrl, ImGuiKey_ModShift = ImGuiMod_Shift, ImGuiKey_ModAlt = ImGuiMod_Alt, ImGuiKey_ModSuper = ImGuiMod_Super, // Renamed in 1.89
1616 //ImGuiKey_KeyPadEnter = ImGuiKey_KeypadEnter, // Renamed in 1.87
1617#endif
1618};
1619
1620// Flags for Shortcut(), SetNextItemShortcut(),
1621// (and for upcoming extended versions of IsKeyPressed(), IsMouseClicked(), Shortcut(), SetKeyOwner(), SetItemKeyOwner() that are still in imgui_internal.h)
1622// Don't mistake with ImGuiInputTextFlags! (which is for ImGui::InputText() function)
1623enum ImGuiInputFlags_
1624{
1625 ImGuiInputFlags_None = 0,
1626 ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat = 1 << 0, // Enable repeat. Return true on successive repeats. Default for legacy IsKeyPressed(). NOT Default for legacy IsMouseClicked(). MUST BE == 1.
1627
1628 // Flags for Shortcut(), SetNextItemShortcut()
1629 // - Routing policies: RouteGlobal+OverActive >> RouteActive or RouteFocused (if owner is active item) >> RouteGlobal+OverFocused >> RouteFocused (if in focused window stack) >> RouteGlobal.
1630 // - Default policy is RouteFocused. Can select only 1 policy among all available.
1631 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteActive = 1 << 10, // Route to active item only.
1632 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFocused = 1 << 11, // Route to windows in the focus stack (DEFAULT). Deep-most focused window takes inputs. Active item takes inputs over deep-most focused window.
1633 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteGlobal = 1 << 12, // Global route (unless a focused window or active item registered the route).
1634 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteAlways = 1 << 13, // Do not register route, poll keys directly.
1635 // - Routing options
1636 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteOverFocused = 1 << 14, // Option: global route: higher priority than focused route (unless active item in focused route).
1637 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteOverActive = 1 << 15, // Option: global route: higher priority than active item. Unlikely you need to use that: will interfere with every active items, e.g. CTRL+A registered by InputText will be overridden by this. May not be fully honored as user/internal code is likely to always assume they can access keys when active.
1638 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteUnlessBgFocused = 1 << 16, // Option: global route: will not be applied if underlying background/void is focused (== no Dear ImGui windows are focused). Useful for overlay applications.
1639 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFromRootWindow = 1 << 17, // Option: route evaluated from the point of view of root window rather than current window.
1640
1641 // Flags for SetNextItemShortcut()
1642 ImGuiInputFlags_Tooltip = 1 << 18, // Automatically display a tooltip when hovering item [BETA] Unsure of right api (opt-in/opt-out)
1643};
1644
1645// Configuration flags stored in io.ConfigFlags. Set by user/application.
1646enum ImGuiConfigFlags_
1647{
1648 ImGuiConfigFlags_None = 0,
1649 ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard = 1 << 0, // Master keyboard navigation enable flag. Enable full Tabbing + directional arrows + space/enter to activate.
1650 ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad = 1 << 1, // Master gamepad navigation enable flag. Backend also needs to set ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad.
1651 ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouse = 1 << 4, // Instruct dear imgui to disable mouse inputs and interactions.
1652 ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouseCursorChange = 1 << 5, // Instruct backend to not alter mouse cursor shape and visibility. Use if the backend cursor changes are interfering with yours and you don't want to use SetMouseCursor() to change mouse cursor. You may want to honor requests from imgui by reading GetMouseCursor() yourself instead.
1653 ImGuiConfigFlags_NoKeyboard = 1 << 6, // Instruct dear imgui to disable keyboard inputs and interactions. This is done by ignoring keyboard events and clearing existing states.
1654
1655 // [BETA] Docking
1656 ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable = 1 << 7, // Docking enable flags.
1657
1658 // [BETA] Viewports
1659 // When using viewports it is recommended that your default value for ImGuiCol_WindowBg is opaque (Alpha=1.0) so transition to a viewport won't be noticeable.
1660 ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable = 1 << 10, // Viewport enable flags (require both ImGuiBackendFlags_PlatformHasViewports + ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasViewports set by the respective backends)
1661 ImGuiConfigFlags_DpiEnableScaleViewports= 1 << 14, // [BETA: Don't use] FIXME-DPI: Reposition and resize imgui windows when the DpiScale of a viewport changed (mostly useful for the main viewport hosting other window). Note that resizing the main window itself is up to your application.
1662 ImGuiConfigFlags_DpiEnableScaleFonts = 1 << 15, // [BETA: Don't use] FIXME-DPI: Request bitmap-scaled fonts to match DpiScale. This is a very low-quality workaround. The correct way to handle DPI is _currently_ to replace the atlas and/or fonts in the Platform_OnChangedViewport callback, but this is all early work in progress.
1663
1664 // User storage (to allow your backend/engine to communicate to code that may be shared between multiple projects. Those flags are NOT used by core Dear ImGui)
1665 ImGuiConfigFlags_IsSRGB = 1 << 20, // Application is SRGB-aware.
1666 ImGuiConfigFlags_IsTouchScreen = 1 << 21, // Application is using a touch screen instead of a mouse.
1667
1668#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
1669 ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos = 1 << 2, // [moved/renamed in 1.91.4] -> use bool io.ConfigNavMoveSetMousePos
1670 ImGuiConfigFlags_NavNoCaptureKeyboard = 1 << 3, // [moved/renamed in 1.91.4] -> use bool io.ConfigNavCaptureKeyboard
1671#endif
1672};
1673
1674// Backend capabilities flags stored in io.BackendFlags. Set by imgui_impl_xxx or custom backend.
1675enum ImGuiBackendFlags_
1676{
1677 ImGuiBackendFlags_None = 0,
1678 ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad = 1 << 0, // Backend Platform supports gamepad and currently has one connected.
1679 ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors = 1 << 1, // Backend Platform supports honoring GetMouseCursor() value to change the OS cursor shape.
1680 ImGuiBackendFlags_HasSetMousePos = 1 << 2, // Backend Platform supports io.WantSetMousePos requests to reposition the OS mouse position (only used if io.ConfigNavMoveSetMousePos is set).
1681 ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset = 1 << 3, // Backend Renderer supports ImDrawCmd::VtxOffset. This enables output of large meshes (64K+ vertices) while still using 16-bit indices.
1682
1683 // [BETA] Viewports
1684 ImGuiBackendFlags_PlatformHasViewports = 1 << 10, // Backend Platform supports multiple viewports.
1685 ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseHoveredViewport=1 << 11, // Backend Platform supports calling io.AddMouseViewportEvent() with the viewport under the mouse. IF POSSIBLE, ignore viewports with the ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs flag (Win32 backend, GLFW 3.30+ backend can do this, SDL backend cannot). If this cannot be done, Dear ImGui needs to use a flawed heuristic to find the viewport under.
1686 ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasViewports = 1 << 12, // Backend Renderer supports multiple viewports.
1687};
1688
1689// Enumeration for PushStyleColor() / PopStyleColor()
1690enum ImGuiCol_
1691{
1692 ImGuiCol_Text,
1693 ImGuiCol_TextDisabled,
1694 ImGuiCol_WindowBg, // Background of normal windows
1695 ImGuiCol_ChildBg, // Background of child windows
1696 ImGuiCol_PopupBg, // Background of popups, menus, tooltips windows
1697 ImGuiCol_Border,
1698 ImGuiCol_BorderShadow,
1699 ImGuiCol_FrameBg, // Background of checkbox, radio button, plot, slider, text input
1700 ImGuiCol_FrameBgHovered,
1701 ImGuiCol_FrameBgActive,
1702 ImGuiCol_TitleBg, // Title bar
1703 ImGuiCol_TitleBgActive, // Title bar when focused
1704 ImGuiCol_TitleBgCollapsed, // Title bar when collapsed
1705 ImGuiCol_MenuBarBg,
1706 ImGuiCol_ScrollbarBg,
1707 ImGuiCol_ScrollbarGrab,
1708 ImGuiCol_ScrollbarGrabHovered,
1709 ImGuiCol_ScrollbarGrabActive,
1710 ImGuiCol_CheckMark, // Checkbox tick and RadioButton circle
1711 ImGuiCol_SliderGrab,
1712 ImGuiCol_SliderGrabActive,
1713 ImGuiCol_Button,
1714 ImGuiCol_ButtonHovered,
1715 ImGuiCol_ButtonActive,
1716 ImGuiCol_Header, // Header* colors are used for CollapsingHeader, TreeNode, Selectable, MenuItem
1717 ImGuiCol_HeaderHovered,
1718 ImGuiCol_HeaderActive,
1719 ImGuiCol_Separator,
1720 ImGuiCol_SeparatorHovered,
1721 ImGuiCol_SeparatorActive,
1722 ImGuiCol_ResizeGrip, // Resize grip in lower-right and lower-left corners of windows.
1723 ImGuiCol_ResizeGripHovered,
1724 ImGuiCol_ResizeGripActive,
1725 ImGuiCol_InputTextCursor, // InputText cursor/caret
1726 ImGuiCol_TabHovered, // Tab background, when hovered
1727 ImGuiCol_Tab, // Tab background, when tab-bar is focused & tab is unselected
1728 ImGuiCol_TabSelected, // Tab background, when tab-bar is focused & tab is selected
1729 ImGuiCol_TabSelectedOverline, // Tab horizontal overline, when tab-bar is focused & tab is selected
1730 ImGuiCol_TabDimmed, // Tab background, when tab-bar is unfocused & tab is unselected
1731 ImGuiCol_TabDimmedSelected, // Tab background, when tab-bar is unfocused & tab is selected
1732 ImGuiCol_TabDimmedSelectedOverline,//..horizontal overline, when tab-bar is unfocused & tab is selected
1733 ImGuiCol_DockingPreview, // Preview overlay color when about to docking something
1734 ImGuiCol_DockingEmptyBg, // Background color for empty node (e.g. CentralNode with no window docked into it)
1735 ImGuiCol_PlotLines,
1736 ImGuiCol_PlotLinesHovered,
1737 ImGuiCol_PlotHistogram,
1738 ImGuiCol_PlotHistogramHovered,
1739 ImGuiCol_TableHeaderBg, // Table header background
1740 ImGuiCol_TableBorderStrong, // Table outer and header borders (prefer using Alpha=1.0 here)
1741 ImGuiCol_TableBorderLight, // Table inner borders (prefer using Alpha=1.0 here)
1742 ImGuiCol_TableRowBg, // Table row background (even rows)
1743 ImGuiCol_TableRowBgAlt, // Table row background (odd rows)
1744 ImGuiCol_TextLink, // Hyperlink color
1745 ImGuiCol_TextSelectedBg,
1746 ImGuiCol_DragDropTarget, // Rectangle highlighting a drop target
1747 ImGuiCol_NavCursor, // Color of keyboard/gamepad navigation cursor/rectangle, when visible
1748 ImGuiCol_NavWindowingHighlight, // Highlight window when using CTRL+TAB
1749 ImGuiCol_NavWindowingDimBg, // Darken/colorize entire screen behind the CTRL+TAB window list, when active
1750 ImGuiCol_ModalWindowDimBg, // Darken/colorize entire screen behind a modal window, when one is active
1751 ImGuiCol_COUNT,
1752
1753#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
1754 ImGuiCol_TabActive = ImGuiCol_TabSelected, // [renamed in 1.90.9]
1755 ImGuiCol_TabUnfocused = ImGuiCol_TabDimmed, // [renamed in 1.90.9]
1756 ImGuiCol_TabUnfocusedActive = ImGuiCol_TabDimmedSelected, // [renamed in 1.90.9]
1757 ImGuiCol_NavHighlight = ImGuiCol_NavCursor, // [renamed in 1.91.4]
1758#endif
1759};
1760
1761// Enumeration for PushStyleVar() / PopStyleVar() to temporarily modify the ImGuiStyle structure.
1762// - The enum only refers to fields of ImGuiStyle which makes sense to be pushed/popped inside UI code.
1763// During initialization or between frames, feel free to just poke into ImGuiStyle directly.
1764// - Tip: Use your programming IDE navigation facilities on the names in the _second column_ below to find the actual members and their description.
1765// - In Visual Studio: CTRL+comma ("Edit.GoToAll") can follow symbols inside comments, whereas CTRL+F12 ("Edit.GoToImplementation") cannot.
1766// - In Visual Studio w/ Visual Assist installed: ALT+G ("VAssistX.GoToImplementation") can also follow symbols inside comments.
1767// - In VS Code, CLion, etc.: CTRL+click can follow symbols inside comments.
1768// - When changing this enum, you need to update the associated internal table GStyleVarInfo[] accordingly. This is where we link enum values to members offset/type.
1769enum ImGuiStyleVar_
1770{
1771 // Enum name -------------------------- // Member in ImGuiStyle structure (see ImGuiStyle for descriptions)
1772 ImGuiStyleVar_Alpha, // float Alpha
1773 ImGuiStyleVar_DisabledAlpha, // float DisabledAlpha
1774 ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, // ImVec2 WindowPadding
1775 ImGuiStyleVar_WindowRounding, // float WindowRounding
1776 ImGuiStyleVar_WindowBorderSize, // float WindowBorderSize
1777 ImGuiStyleVar_WindowMinSize, // ImVec2 WindowMinSize
1778 ImGuiStyleVar_WindowTitleAlign, // ImVec2 WindowTitleAlign
1779 ImGuiStyleVar_ChildRounding, // float ChildRounding
1780 ImGuiStyleVar_ChildBorderSize, // float ChildBorderSize
1781 ImGuiStyleVar_PopupRounding, // float PopupRounding
1782 ImGuiStyleVar_PopupBorderSize, // float PopupBorderSize
1783 ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, // ImVec2 FramePadding
1784 ImGuiStyleVar_FrameRounding, // float FrameRounding
1785 ImGuiStyleVar_FrameBorderSize, // float FrameBorderSize
1786 ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, // ImVec2 ItemSpacing
1787 ImGuiStyleVar_ItemInnerSpacing, // ImVec2 ItemInnerSpacing
1788 ImGuiStyleVar_IndentSpacing, // float IndentSpacing
1789 ImGuiStyleVar_CellPadding, // ImVec2 CellPadding
1790 ImGuiStyleVar_ScrollbarSize, // float ScrollbarSize
1791 ImGuiStyleVar_ScrollbarRounding, // float ScrollbarRounding
1792 ImGuiStyleVar_GrabMinSize, // float GrabMinSize
1793 ImGuiStyleVar_GrabRounding, // float GrabRounding
1794 ImGuiStyleVar_ImageBorderSize, // float ImageBorderSize
1795 ImGuiStyleVar_TabRounding, // float TabRounding
1796 ImGuiStyleVar_TabBorderSize, // float TabBorderSize
1797 ImGuiStyleVar_TabBarBorderSize, // float TabBarBorderSize
1798 ImGuiStyleVar_TabBarOverlineSize, // float TabBarOverlineSize
1799 ImGuiStyleVar_TableAngledHeadersAngle, // float TableAngledHeadersAngle
1800 ImGuiStyleVar_TableAngledHeadersTextAlign,// ImVec2 TableAngledHeadersTextAlign
1801 ImGuiStyleVar_ButtonTextAlign, // ImVec2 ButtonTextAlign
1802 ImGuiStyleVar_SelectableTextAlign, // ImVec2 SelectableTextAlign
1803 ImGuiStyleVar_SeparatorTextBorderSize, // float SeparatorTextBorderSize
1804 ImGuiStyleVar_SeparatorTextAlign, // ImVec2 SeparatorTextAlign
1805 ImGuiStyleVar_SeparatorTextPadding, // ImVec2 SeparatorTextPadding
1806 ImGuiStyleVar_DockingSeparatorSize, // float DockingSeparatorSize
1807 ImGuiStyleVar_COUNT
1808};
1809
1810// Flags for InvisibleButton() [extended in imgui_internal.h]
1811enum ImGuiButtonFlags_
1812{
1813 ImGuiButtonFlags_None = 0,
1814 ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonLeft = 1 << 0, // React on left mouse button (default)
1815 ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonRight = 1 << 1, // React on right mouse button
1816 ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonMiddle = 1 << 2, // React on center mouse button
1817 ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonMask_ = ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonLeft | ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonRight | ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonMiddle, // [Internal]
1818 ImGuiButtonFlags_EnableNav = 1 << 3, // InvisibleButton(): do not disable navigation/tabbing. Otherwise disabled by default.
1819};
1820
1821// Flags for ColorEdit3() / ColorEdit4() / ColorPicker3() / ColorPicker4() / ColorButton()
1822enum ImGuiColorEditFlags_
1823{
1824 ImGuiColorEditFlags_None = 0,
1825 ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha = 1 << 1, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: ignore Alpha component (will only read 3 components from the input pointer).
1826 ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoPicker = 1 << 2, // // ColorEdit: disable picker when clicking on color square.
1827 ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions = 1 << 3, // // ColorEdit: disable toggling options menu when right-clicking on inputs/small preview.
1828 ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSmallPreview = 1 << 4, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: disable color square preview next to the inputs. (e.g. to show only the inputs)
1829 ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs = 1 << 5, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: disable inputs sliders/text widgets (e.g. to show only the small preview color square).
1830 ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip = 1 << 6, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: disable tooltip when hovering the preview.
1831 ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel = 1 << 7, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: disable display of inline text label (the label is still forwarded to the tooltip and picker).
1832 ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview = 1 << 8, // // ColorPicker: disable bigger color preview on right side of the picker, use small color square preview instead.
1833 ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop = 1 << 9, // // ColorEdit: disable drag and drop target. ColorButton: disable drag and drop source.
1834 ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoBorder = 1 << 10, // // ColorButton: disable border (which is enforced by default)
1835
1836 // Alpha preview
1837 // - Prior to 1.91.8 (2025/01/21): alpha was made opaque in the preview by default using old name ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreview.
1838 // - We now display the preview as transparent by default. You can use ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaOpaque to use old behavior.
1839 // - The new flags may be combined better and allow finer controls.
1840 ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaOpaque = 1 << 11, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: disable alpha in the preview,. Contrary to _NoAlpha it may still be edited when calling ColorEdit4()/ColorPicker4(). For ColorButton() this does the same as _NoAlpha.
1841 ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaNoBg = 1 << 12, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: disable rendering a checkerboard background behind transparent color.
1842 ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf= 1 << 13, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: display half opaque / half transparent preview.
1843
1844 // User Options (right-click on widget to change some of them).
1845 ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar = 1 << 16, // // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: show vertical alpha bar/gradient in picker.
1846 ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR = 1 << 19, // // (WIP) ColorEdit: Currently only disable 0.0f..1.0f limits in RGBA edition (note: you probably want to use ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float flag as well).
1847 ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB = 1 << 20, // [Display] // ColorEdit: override _display_ type among RGB/HSV/Hex. ColorPicker: select any combination using one or more of RGB/HSV/Hex.
1848 ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV = 1 << 21, // [Display] // "
1849 ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex = 1 << 22, // [Display] // "
1850 ImGuiColorEditFlags_Uint8 = 1 << 23, // [DataType] // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: _display_ values formatted as 0..255.
1851 ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float = 1 << 24, // [DataType] // ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton: _display_ values formatted as 0.0f..1.0f floats instead of 0..255 integers. No round-trip of value via integers.
1852 ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar = 1 << 25, // [Picker] // ColorPicker: bar for Hue, rectangle for Sat/Value.
1853 ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel = 1 << 26, // [Picker] // ColorPicker: wheel for Hue, triangle for Sat/Value.
1854 ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB = 1 << 27, // [Input] // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: input and output data in RGB format.
1855 ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV = 1 << 28, // [Input] // ColorEdit, ColorPicker: input and output data in HSV format.
1856
1857 // Defaults Options. You can set application defaults using SetColorEditOptions(). The intent is that you probably don't want to
1858 // override them in most of your calls. Let the user choose via the option menu and/or call SetColorEditOptions() once during startup.
1859 ImGuiColorEditFlags_DefaultOptions_ = ImGuiColorEditFlags_Uint8 | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB | ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB | ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar,
1860
1861 // [Internal] Masks
1862 ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaMask_ = ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaOpaque | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaNoBg | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf,
1863 ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_ = ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex,
1864 ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_ = ImGuiColorEditFlags_Uint8 | ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float,
1865 ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_ = ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel | ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar,
1866 ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_ = ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB | ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV,
1867
1868 // Obsolete names
1869#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
1870 ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreview = 0, // [Removed in 1.91.8] This is the default now. Will display a checkerboard unless ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaNoBg is set.
1871#endif
1872 //ImGuiColorEditFlags_RGB = ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB, ImGuiColorEditFlags_HSV = ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV, ImGuiColorEditFlags_HEX = ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex // [renamed in 1.69]
1873};
1874
1875// Flags for DragFloat(), DragInt(), SliderFloat(), SliderInt() etc.
1876// We use the same sets of flags for DragXXX() and SliderXXX() functions as the features are the same and it makes it easier to swap them.
1877// (Those are per-item flags. There is shared behavior flag too: ImGuiIO: io.ConfigDragClickToInputText)
1878enum ImGuiSliderFlags_
1879{
1880 ImGuiSliderFlags_None = 0,
1881 ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic = 1 << 5, // Make the widget logarithmic (linear otherwise). Consider using ImGuiSliderFlags_NoRoundToFormat with this if using a format-string with small amount of digits.
1882 ImGuiSliderFlags_NoRoundToFormat = 1 << 6, // Disable rounding underlying value to match precision of the display format string (e.g. %.3f values are rounded to those 3 digits).
1883 ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput = 1 << 7, // Disable CTRL+Click or Enter key allowing to input text directly into the widget.
1884 ImGuiSliderFlags_WrapAround = 1 << 8, // Enable wrapping around from max to min and from min to max. Only supported by DragXXX() functions for now.
1885 ImGuiSliderFlags_ClampOnInput = 1 << 9, // Clamp value to min/max bounds when input manually with CTRL+Click. By default CTRL+Click allows going out of bounds.
1886 ImGuiSliderFlags_ClampZeroRange = 1 << 10, // Clamp even if min==max==0.0f. Otherwise due to legacy reason DragXXX functions don't clamp with those values. When your clamping limits are dynamic you almost always want to use it.
1887 ImGuiSliderFlags_NoSpeedTweaks = 1 << 11, // Disable keyboard modifiers altering tweak speed. Useful if you want to alter tweak speed yourself based on your own logic.
1888 ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp = ImGuiSliderFlags_ClampOnInput | ImGuiSliderFlags_ClampZeroRange,
1889 ImGuiSliderFlags_InvalidMask_ = 0x7000000F, // [Internal] We treat using those bits as being potentially a 'float power' argument from the previous API that has got miscast to this enum, and will trigger an assert if needed.
1890};
1891
1892// Identify a mouse button.
1893// Those values are guaranteed to be stable and we frequently use 0/1 directly. Named enums provided for convenience.
1894enum ImGuiMouseButton_
1895{
1896 ImGuiMouseButton_Left = 0,
1897 ImGuiMouseButton_Right = 1,
1898 ImGuiMouseButton_Middle = 2,
1899 ImGuiMouseButton_COUNT = 5
1900};
1901
1902// Enumeration for GetMouseCursor()
1903// User code may request backend to display given cursor by calling SetMouseCursor(), which is why we have some cursors that are marked unused here
1904enum ImGuiMouseCursor_
1905{
1906 ImGuiMouseCursor_None = -1,
1907 ImGuiMouseCursor_Arrow = 0,
1908 ImGuiMouseCursor_TextInput, // When hovering over InputText, etc.
1909 ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeAll, // (Unused by Dear ImGui functions)
1910 ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNS, // When hovering over a horizontal border
1911 ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeEW, // When hovering over a vertical border or a column
1912 ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNESW, // When hovering over the bottom-left corner of a window
1913 ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNWSE, // When hovering over the bottom-right corner of a window
1914 ImGuiMouseCursor_Hand, // (Unused by Dear ImGui functions. Use for e.g. hyperlinks)
1915 ImGuiMouseCursor_Wait, // When waiting for something to process/load.
1916 ImGuiMouseCursor_Progress, // When waiting for something to process/load, but application is still interactive.
1917 ImGuiMouseCursor_NotAllowed, // When hovering something with disallowed interaction. Usually a crossed circle.
1918 ImGuiMouseCursor_COUNT
1919};
1920
1921// Enumeration for AddMouseSourceEvent() actual source of Mouse Input data.
1922// Historically we use "Mouse" terminology everywhere to indicate pointer data, e.g. MousePos, IsMousePressed(), io.AddMousePosEvent()
1923// But that "Mouse" data can come from different source which occasionally may be useful for application to know about.
1924// You can submit a change of pointer type using io.AddMouseSourceEvent().
1925enum ImGuiMouseSource : int
1926{
1927 ImGuiMouseSource_Mouse = 0, // Input is coming from an actual mouse.
1928 ImGuiMouseSource_TouchScreen, // Input is coming from a touch screen (no hovering prior to initial press, less precise initial press aiming, dual-axis wheeling possible).
1929 ImGuiMouseSource_Pen, // Input is coming from a pressure/magnetic pen (often used in conjunction with high-sampling rates).
1930 ImGuiMouseSource_COUNT
1931};
1932
1933// Enumeration for ImGui::SetNextWindow***(), SetWindow***(), SetNextItem***() functions
1934// Represent a condition.
1935// Important: Treat as a regular enum! Do NOT combine multiple values using binary operators! All the functions above treat 0 as a shortcut to ImGuiCond_Always.
1936enum ImGuiCond_
1937{
1938 ImGuiCond_None = 0, // No condition (always set the variable), same as _Always
1939 ImGuiCond_Always = 1 << 0, // No condition (always set the variable), same as _None
1940 ImGuiCond_Once = 1 << 1, // Set the variable once per runtime session (only the first call will succeed)
1941 ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver = 1 << 2, // Set the variable if the object/window has no persistently saved data (no entry in .ini file)
1942 ImGuiCond_Appearing = 1 << 3, // Set the variable if the object/window is appearing after being hidden/inactive (or the first time)
1943};
1944
1945//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1946// [SECTION] Tables API flags and structures (ImGuiTableFlags, ImGuiTableColumnFlags, ImGuiTableRowFlags, ImGuiTableBgTarget, ImGuiTableSortSpecs, ImGuiTableColumnSortSpecs)
1947//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1948
1949// Flags for ImGui::BeginTable()
1950// - Important! Sizing policies have complex and subtle side effects, much more so than you would expect.
1951// Read comments/demos carefully + experiment with live demos to get acquainted with them.
1952// - The DEFAULT sizing policies are:
1953// - Default to ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit if ScrollX is on, or if host window has ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize.
1954// - Default to ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame if ScrollX is off.
1955// - When ScrollX is off:
1956// - Table defaults to ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame -> all Columns defaults to ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch with same weight.
1957// - Columns sizing policy allowed: Stretch (default), Fixed/Auto.
1958// - Fixed Columns (if any) will generally obtain their requested width (unless the table cannot fit them all).
1959// - Stretch Columns will share the remaining width according to their respective weight.
1960// - Mixed Fixed/Stretch columns is possible but has various side-effects on resizing behaviors.
1961// The typical use of mixing sizing policies is: any number of LEADING Fixed columns, followed by one or two TRAILING Stretch columns.
1962// (this is because the visible order of columns have subtle but necessary effects on how they react to manual resizing).
1963// - When ScrollX is on:
1964// - Table defaults to ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit -> all Columns defaults to ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed
1965// - Columns sizing policy allowed: Fixed/Auto mostly.
1966// - Fixed Columns can be enlarged as needed. Table will show a horizontal scrollbar if needed.
1967// - When using auto-resizing (non-resizable) fixed columns, querying the content width to use item right-alignment e.g. SetNextItemWidth(-FLT_MIN) doesn't make sense, would create a feedback loop.
1968// - Using Stretch columns OFTEN DOES NOT MAKE SENSE if ScrollX is on, UNLESS you have specified a value for 'inner_width' in BeginTable().
1969// If you specify a value for 'inner_width' then effectively the scrolling space is known and Stretch or mixed Fixed/Stretch columns become meaningful again.
1970// - Read on documentation at the top of imgui_tables.cpp for details.
1971enum ImGuiTableFlags_
1972{
1973 // Features
1974 ImGuiTableFlags_None = 0,
1975 ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable = 1 << 0, // Enable resizing columns.
1976 ImGuiTableFlags_Reorderable = 1 << 1, // Enable reordering columns in header row (need calling TableSetupColumn() + TableHeadersRow() to display headers)
1977 ImGuiTableFlags_Hideable = 1 << 2, // Enable hiding/disabling columns in context menu.
1978 ImGuiTableFlags_Sortable = 1 << 3, // Enable sorting. Call TableGetSortSpecs() to obtain sort specs. Also see ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti and ImGuiTableFlags_SortTristate.
1979 ImGuiTableFlags_NoSavedSettings = 1 << 4, // Disable persisting columns order, width and sort settings in the .ini file.
1980 ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody = 1 << 5, // Right-click on columns body/contents will display table context menu. By default it is available in TableHeadersRow().
1981 // Decorations
1982 ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg = 1 << 6, // Set each RowBg color with ImGuiCol_TableRowBg or ImGuiCol_TableRowBgAlt (equivalent of calling TableSetBgColor with ImGuiTableBgFlags_RowBg0 on each row manually)
1983 ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerH = 1 << 7, // Draw horizontal borders between rows.
1984 ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH = 1 << 8, // Draw horizontal borders at the top and bottom.
1985 ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV = 1 << 9, // Draw vertical borders between columns.
1986 ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV = 1 << 10, // Draw vertical borders on the left and right sides.
1987 ImGuiTableFlags_BordersH = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerH | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH, // Draw horizontal borders.
1988 ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV, // Draw vertical borders.
1989 ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInner = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerH, // Draw inner borders.
1990 ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH, // Draw outer borders.
1991 ImGuiTableFlags_Borders = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInner | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter, // Draw all borders.
1992 ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody = 1 << 11, // [ALPHA] Disable vertical borders in columns Body (borders will always appear in Headers). -> May move to style
1993 ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBodyUntilResize = 1 << 12, // [ALPHA] Disable vertical borders in columns Body until hovered for resize (borders will always appear in Headers). -> May move to style
1994 // Sizing Policy (read above for defaults)
1995 ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit = 1 << 13, // Columns default to _WidthFixed or _WidthAuto (if resizable or not resizable), matching contents width.
1996 ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedSame = 2 << 13, // Columns default to _WidthFixed or _WidthAuto (if resizable or not resizable), matching the maximum contents width of all columns. Implicitly enable ImGuiTableFlags_NoKeepColumnsVisible.
1997 ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchProp = 3 << 13, // Columns default to _WidthStretch with default weights proportional to each columns contents widths.
1998 ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame = 4 << 13, // Columns default to _WidthStretch with default weights all equal, unless overridden by TableSetupColumn().
1999 // Sizing Extra Options
2000 ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendX = 1 << 16, // Make outer width auto-fit to columns, overriding outer_size.x value. Only available when ScrollX/ScrollY are disabled and Stretch columns are not used.
2001 ImGuiTableFlags_NoHostExtendY = 1 << 17, // Make outer height stop exactly at outer_size.y (prevent auto-extending table past the limit). Only available when ScrollX/ScrollY are disabled. Data below the limit will be clipped and not visible.
2002 ImGuiTableFlags_NoKeepColumnsVisible = 1 << 18, // Disable keeping column always minimally visible when ScrollX is off and table gets too small. Not recommended if columns are resizable.
2003 ImGuiTableFlags_PreciseWidths = 1 << 19, // Disable distributing remainder width to stretched columns (width allocation on a 100-wide table with 3 columns: Without this flag: 33,33,34. With this flag: 33,33,33). With larger number of columns, resizing will appear to be less smooth.
2004 // Clipping
2005 ImGuiTableFlags_NoClip = 1 << 20, // Disable clipping rectangle for every individual columns (reduce draw command count, items will be able to overflow into other columns). Generally incompatible with TableSetupScrollFreeze().
2006 // Padding
2007 ImGuiTableFlags_PadOuterX = 1 << 21, // Default if BordersOuterV is on. Enable outermost padding. Generally desirable if you have headers.
2008 ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadOuterX = 1 << 22, // Default if BordersOuterV is off. Disable outermost padding.
2009 ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadInnerX = 1 << 23, // Disable inner padding between columns (double inner padding if BordersOuterV is on, single inner padding if BordersOuterV is off).
2010 // Scrolling
2011 ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollX = 1 << 24, // Enable horizontal scrolling. Require 'outer_size' parameter of BeginTable() to specify the container size. Changes default sizing policy. Because this creates a child window, ScrollY is currently generally recommended when using ScrollX.
2012 ImGuiTableFlags_ScrollY = 1 << 25, // Enable vertical scrolling. Require 'outer_size' parameter of BeginTable() to specify the container size.
2013 // Sorting
2014 ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti = 1 << 26, // Hold shift when clicking headers to sort on multiple column. TableGetSortSpecs() may return specs where (SpecsCount > 1).
2015 ImGuiTableFlags_SortTristate = 1 << 27, // Allow no sorting, disable default sorting. TableGetSortSpecs() may return specs where (SpecsCount == 0).
2016 // Miscellaneous
2017 ImGuiTableFlags_HighlightHoveredColumn = 1 << 28, // Highlight column headers when hovered (may evolve into a fuller highlight)
2018
2019 // [Internal] Combinations and masks
2020 ImGuiTableFlags_SizingMask_ = ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit | ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedSame | ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchProp | ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame,
2021};
2022
2023// Flags for ImGui::TableSetupColumn()
2024enum ImGuiTableColumnFlags_
2025{
2026 // Input configuration flags
2027 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_None = 0,
2028 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_Disabled = 1 << 0, // Overriding/master disable flag: hide column, won't show in context menu (unlike calling TableSetColumnEnabled() which manipulates the user accessible state)
2029 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultHide = 1 << 1, // Default as a hidden/disabled column.
2030 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_DefaultSort = 1 << 2, // Default as a sorting column.
2031 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch = 1 << 3, // Column will stretch. Preferable with horizontal scrolling disabled (default if table sizing policy is _SizingStretchSame or _SizingStretchProp).
2032 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed = 1 << 4, // Column will not stretch. Preferable with horizontal scrolling enabled (default if table sizing policy is _SizingFixedFit and table is resizable).
2033 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoResize = 1 << 5, // Disable manual resizing.
2034 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoReorder = 1 << 6, // Disable manual reordering this column, this will also prevent other columns from crossing over this column.
2035 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHide = 1 << 7, // Disable ability to hide/disable this column.
2036 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoClip = 1 << 8, // Disable clipping for this column (all NoClip columns will render in a same draw command).
2037 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSort = 1 << 9, // Disable ability to sort on this field (even if ImGuiTableFlags_Sortable is set on the table).
2038 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSortAscending = 1 << 10, // Disable ability to sort in the ascending direction.
2039 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoSortDescending = 1 << 11, // Disable ability to sort in the descending direction.
2040 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHeaderLabel = 1 << 12, // TableHeadersRow() will submit an empty label for this column. Convenient for some small columns. Name will still appear in context menu or in angled headers. You may append into this cell by calling TableSetColumnIndex() right after the TableHeadersRow() call.
2041 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoHeaderWidth = 1 << 13, // Disable header text width contribution to automatic column width.
2042 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_PreferSortAscending = 1 << 14, // Make the initial sort direction Ascending when first sorting on this column (default).
2043 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_PreferSortDescending = 1 << 15, // Make the initial sort direction Descending when first sorting on this column.
2044 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IndentEnable = 1 << 16, // Use current Indent value when entering cell (default for column 0).
2045 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IndentDisable = 1 << 17, // Ignore current Indent value when entering cell (default for columns > 0). Indentation changes _within_ the cell will still be honored.
2046 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_AngledHeader = 1 << 18, // TableHeadersRow() will submit an angled header row for this column. Note this will add an extra row.
2047
2048 // Output status flags, read-only via TableGetColumnFlags()
2049 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsEnabled = 1 << 24, // Status: is enabled == not hidden by user/api (referred to as "Hide" in _DefaultHide and _NoHide) flags.
2050 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsVisible = 1 << 25, // Status: is visible == is enabled AND not clipped by scrolling.
2051 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsSorted = 1 << 26, // Status: is currently part of the sort specs
2052 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsHovered = 1 << 27, // Status: is hovered by mouse
2053
2054 // [Internal] Combinations and masks
2055 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthMask_ = ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthFixed,
2056 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IndentMask_ = ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IndentEnable | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IndentDisable,
2057 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_StatusMask_ = ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsEnabled | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsVisible | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsSorted | ImGuiTableColumnFlags_IsHovered,
2058 ImGuiTableColumnFlags_NoDirectResize_ = 1 << 30, // [Internal] Disable user resizing this column directly (it may however we resized indirectly from its left edge)
2059};
2060
2061// Flags for ImGui::TableNextRow()
2062enum ImGuiTableRowFlags_
2063{
2064 ImGuiTableRowFlags_None = 0,
2065 ImGuiTableRowFlags_Headers = 1 << 0, // Identify header row (set default background color + width of its contents accounted differently for auto column width)
2066};
2067
2068// Enum for ImGui::TableSetBgColor()
2069// Background colors are rendering in 3 layers:
2070// - Layer 0: draw with RowBg0 color if set, otherwise draw with ColumnBg0 if set.
2071// - Layer 1: draw with RowBg1 color if set, otherwise draw with ColumnBg1 if set.
2072// - Layer 2: draw with CellBg color if set.
2073// The purpose of the two row/columns layers is to let you decide if a background color change should override or blend with the existing color.
2074// When using ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg on the table, each row has the RowBg0 color automatically set for odd/even rows.
2075// If you set the color of RowBg0 target, your color will override the existing RowBg0 color.
2076// If you set the color of RowBg1 or ColumnBg1 target, your color will blend over the RowBg0 color.
2077enum ImGuiTableBgTarget_
2078{
2079 ImGuiTableBgTarget_None = 0,
2080 ImGuiTableBgTarget_RowBg0 = 1, // Set row background color 0 (generally used for background, automatically set when ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg is used)
2081 ImGuiTableBgTarget_RowBg1 = 2, // Set row background color 1 (generally used for selection marking)
2082 ImGuiTableBgTarget_CellBg = 3, // Set cell background color (top-most color)
2083};
2084
2085// Sorting specifications for a table (often handling sort specs for a single column, occasionally more)
2086// Obtained by calling TableGetSortSpecs().
2087// When 'SpecsDirty == true' you can sort your data. It will be true with sorting specs have changed since last call, or the first time.
2088// Make sure to set 'SpecsDirty = false' after sorting, else you may wastefully sort your data every frame!
2089struct ImGuiTableSortSpecs
2090{
2091 const ImGuiTableColumnSortSpecs* Specs; // Pointer to sort spec array.
2092 int SpecsCount; // Sort spec count. Most often 1. May be > 1 when ImGuiTableFlags_SortMulti is enabled. May be == 0 when ImGuiTableFlags_SortTristate is enabled.
2093 bool SpecsDirty; // Set to true when specs have changed since last time! Use this to sort again, then clear the flag.
2094
2095 ImGuiTableSortSpecs() { memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this)); }
2096};
2097
2098// Sorting specification for one column of a table (sizeof == 12 bytes)
2099struct ImGuiTableColumnSortSpecs
2100{
2101 ImGuiID ColumnUserID; // User id of the column (if specified by a TableSetupColumn() call)
2102 ImS16 ColumnIndex; // Index of the column
2103 ImS16 SortOrder; // Index within parent ImGuiTableSortSpecs (always stored in order starting from 0, tables sorted on a single criteria will always have a 0 here)
2104 ImGuiSortDirection SortDirection; // ImGuiSortDirection_Ascending or ImGuiSortDirection_Descending
2105
2106 ImGuiTableColumnSortSpecs() { memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this)); }
2107};
2108
2109//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2110// [SECTION] Helpers: Debug log, memory allocations macros, ImVector<>
2111//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2112
2113//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2114// Debug Logging into ShowDebugLogWindow(), tty and more.
2115//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2116
2117#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEBUG_TOOLS
2118#define IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG(...) ImGui::DebugLog(__VA_ARGS__)
2119#else
2120#define IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG(...) ((void)0)
2121#endif
2122
2123//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2124// IM_MALLOC(), IM_FREE(), IM_NEW(), IM_PLACEMENT_NEW(), IM_DELETE()
2125// We call C++ constructor on own allocated memory via the placement "new(ptr) Type()" syntax.
2126// Defining a custom placement new() with a custom parameter allows us to bypass including <new> which on some platforms complains when user has disabled exceptions.
2127//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2128
2129struct ImNewWrapper {};
2130inline void* operator new(size_t, ImNewWrapper, void* ptr) { return ptr; }
2131inline void operator delete(void*, ImNewWrapper, void*) {} // This is only required so we can use the symmetrical new()
2132#define IM_ALLOC(_SIZE) ImGui::MemAlloc(_SIZE)
2133#define IM_FREE(_PTR) ImGui::MemFree(_PTR)
2134#define IM_PLACEMENT_NEW(_PTR) new(ImNewWrapper(), _PTR)
2135#define IM_NEW(_TYPE) new(ImNewWrapper(), ImGui::MemAlloc(sizeof(_TYPE))) _TYPE
2136template<typename T> void IM_DELETE(T* p) { if (p) { p->~T(); ImGui::MemFree(p); } }
2137
2138//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2139// ImVector<>
2140// Lightweight std::vector<>-like class to avoid dragging dependencies (also, some implementations of STL with debug enabled are absurdly slow, we bypass it so our code runs fast in debug).
2141//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2142// - You generally do NOT need to care or use this ever. But we need to make it available in imgui.h because some of our public structures are relying on it.
2143// - We use std-like naming convention here, which is a little unusual for this codebase.
2144// - Important: clear() frees memory, resize(0) keep the allocated buffer. We use resize(0) a lot to intentionally recycle allocated buffers across frames and amortize our costs.
2145// - Important: our implementation does NOT call C++ constructors/destructors, we treat everything as raw data! This is intentional but be extra mindful of that,
2146// Do NOT use this class as a std::vector replacement in your own code! Many of the structures used by dear imgui can be safely initialized by a zero-memset.
2147//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2148
2149IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_OFF
2150template<typename T>
2151struct ImVector
2152{
2153 int Size;
2154 int Capacity;
2155 T* Data;
2156
2157 // Provide standard typedefs but we don't use them ourselves.
2158 typedef T value_type;
2159 typedef value_type* iterator;
2160 typedef const value_type* const_iterator;
2161
2162 // Constructors, destructor
2163 inline ImVector() { Size = Capacity = 0; Data = NULL; }
2164 inline ImVector(const ImVector<T>& src) { Size = Capacity = 0; Data = NULL; operator=(src); }
2165 inline ImVector<T>& operator=(const ImVector<T>& src) { clear(); resize(src.Size); if (src.Data) memcpy(Data, src.Data, (size_t)Size * sizeof(T)); return *this; }
2166 inline ~ImVector() { if (Data) IM_FREE(Data); } // Important: does not destruct anything
2167
2168 inline void clear() { if (Data) { Size = Capacity = 0; IM_FREE(Data); Data = NULL; } } // Important: does not destruct anything
2169 inline void clear_delete() { for (int n = 0; n < Size; n++) IM_DELETE(Data[n]); clear(); } // Important: never called automatically! always explicit.
2170 inline void clear_destruct() { for (int n = 0; n < Size; n++) Data[n].~T(); clear(); } // Important: never called automatically! always explicit.
2171
2172 inline bool empty() const { return Size == 0; }
2173 inline int size() const { return Size; }
2174 inline int size_in_bytes() const { return Size * (int)sizeof(T); }
2175 inline int max_size() const { return 0x7FFFFFFF / (int)sizeof(T); }
2176 inline int capacity() const { return Capacity; }
2177 inline T& operator[](int i) { IM_ASSERT(i >= 0 && i < Size); return Data[i]; }
2178 inline const T& operator[](int i) const { IM_ASSERT(i >= 0 && i < Size); return Data[i]; }
2179
2180 inline T* begin() { return Data; }
2181 inline const T* begin() const { return Data; }
2182 inline T* end() { return Data + Size; }
2183 inline const T* end() const { return Data + Size; }
2184 inline T& front() { IM_ASSERT(Size > 0); return Data[0]; }
2185 inline const T& front() const { IM_ASSERT(Size > 0); return Data[0]; }
2186 inline T& back() { IM_ASSERT(Size > 0); return Data[Size - 1]; }
2187 inline const T& back() const { IM_ASSERT(Size > 0); return Data[Size - 1]; }
2188 inline void swap(ImVector<T>& rhs) { int rhs_size = rhs.Size; rhs.Size = Size; Size = rhs_size; int rhs_cap = rhs.Capacity; rhs.Capacity = Capacity; Capacity = rhs_cap; T* rhs_data = rhs.Data; rhs.Data = Data; Data = rhs_data; }
2189
2190 inline int _grow_capacity(int sz) const { int new_capacity = Capacity ? (Capacity + Capacity / 2) : 8; return new_capacity > sz ? new_capacity : sz; }
2191 inline void resize(int new_size) { if (new_size > Capacity) reserve(_grow_capacity(new_size)); Size = new_size; }
2192 inline void resize(int new_size, const T& v) { if (new_size > Capacity) reserve(_grow_capacity(new_size)); if (new_size > Size) for (int n = Size; n < new_size; n++) memcpy(&Data[n], &v, sizeof(v)); Size = new_size; }
2193 inline void shrink(int new_size) { IM_ASSERT(new_size <= Size); Size = new_size; } // Resize a vector to a smaller size, guaranteed not to cause a reallocation
2194 inline void reserve(int new_capacity) { if (new_capacity <= Capacity) return; T* new_data = (T*)IM_ALLOC((size_t)new_capacity * sizeof(T)); if (Data) { memcpy(new_data, Data, (size_t)Size * sizeof(T)); IM_FREE(Data); } Data = new_data; Capacity = new_capacity; }
2195 inline void reserve_discard(int new_capacity) { if (new_capacity <= Capacity) return; if (Data) IM_FREE(Data); Data = (T*)IM_ALLOC((size_t)new_capacity * sizeof(T)); Capacity = new_capacity; }
2196
2197 // NB: It is illegal to call push_back/push_front/insert with a reference pointing inside the ImVector data itself! e.g. v.push_back(v[10]) is forbidden.
2198 inline void push_back(const T& v) { if (Size == Capacity) reserve(_grow_capacity(Size + 1)); memcpy(&Data[Size], &v, sizeof(v)); Size++; }
2199 inline void pop_back() { IM_ASSERT(Size > 0); Size--; }
2200 inline void push_front(const T& v) { if (Size == 0) push_back(v); else insert(Data, v); }
2201 inline T* erase(const T* it) { IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it < Data + Size); const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data; memmove(Data + off, Data + off + 1, ((size_t)Size - (size_t)off - 1) * sizeof(T)); Size--; return Data + off; }
2202 inline T* erase(const T* it, const T* it_last){ IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it < Data + Size && it_last >= it && it_last <= Data + Size); const ptrdiff_t count = it_last - it; const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data; memmove(Data + off, Data + off + count, ((size_t)Size - (size_t)off - (size_t)count) * sizeof(T)); Size -= (int)count; return Data + off; }
2203 inline T* erase_unsorted(const T* it) { IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it < Data + Size); const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data; if (it < Data + Size - 1) memcpy(Data + off, Data + Size - 1, sizeof(T)); Size--; return Data + off; }
2204 inline T* insert(const T* it, const T& v) { IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it <= Data + Size); const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data; if (Size == Capacity) reserve(_grow_capacity(Size + 1)); if (off < (int)Size) memmove(Data + off + 1, Data + off, ((size_t)Size - (size_t)off) * sizeof(T)); memcpy(&Data[off], &v, sizeof(v)); Size++; return Data + off; }
2205 inline bool contains(const T& v) const { const T* data = Data; const T* data_end = Data + Size; while (data < data_end) if (*data++ == v) return true; return false; }
2206 inline T* find(const T& v) { T* data = Data; const T* data_end = Data + Size; while (data < data_end) if (*data == v) break; else ++data; return data; }
2207 inline const T* find(const T& v) const { const T* data = Data; const T* data_end = Data + Size; while (data < data_end) if (*data == v) break; else ++data; return data; }
2208 inline int find_index(const T& v) const { const T* data_end = Data + Size; const T* it = find(v); if (it == data_end) return -1; const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data; return (int)off; }
2209 inline bool find_erase(const T& v) { const T* it = find(v); if (it < Data + Size) { erase(it); return true; } return false; }
2210 inline bool find_erase_unsorted(const T& v) { const T* it = find(v); if (it < Data + Size) { erase_unsorted(it); return true; } return false; }
2211 inline int index_from_ptr(const T* it) const { IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it < Data + Size); const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data; return (int)off; }
2212};
2213IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_RESTORE
2214
2215//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2216// [SECTION] ImGuiStyle
2217//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2218// You may modify the ImGui::GetStyle() main instance during initialization and before NewFrame().
2219// During the frame, use ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_XXXX)/PopStyleVar() to alter the main style values,
2220// and ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_XXX)/PopStyleColor() for colors.
2221//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2222
2223struct ImGuiStyle
2224{
2225 float Alpha; // Global alpha applies to everything in Dear ImGui.
2226 float DisabledAlpha; // Additional alpha multiplier applied by BeginDisabled(). Multiply over current value of Alpha.
2227 ImVec2 WindowPadding; // Padding within a window.
2228 float WindowRounding; // Radius of window corners rounding. Set to 0.0f to have rectangular windows. Large values tend to lead to variety of artifacts and are not recommended.
2229 float WindowBorderSize; // Thickness of border around windows. Generally set to 0.0f or 1.0f. (Other values are not well tested and more CPU/GPU costly).
2230 float WindowBorderHoverPadding; // Hit-testing extent outside/inside resizing border. Also extend determination of hovered window. Generally meaningfully larger than WindowBorderSize to make it easy to reach borders.
2231 ImVec2 WindowMinSize; // Minimum window size. This is a global setting. If you want to constrain individual windows, use SetNextWindowSizeConstraints().
2232 ImVec2 WindowTitleAlign; // Alignment for title bar text. Defaults to (0.0f,0.5f) for left-aligned,vertically centered.
2233 ImGuiDir WindowMenuButtonPosition; // Side of the collapsing/docking button in the title bar (None/Left/Right). Defaults to ImGuiDir_Left.
2234 float ChildRounding; // Radius of child window corners rounding. Set to 0.0f to have rectangular windows.
2235 float ChildBorderSize; // Thickness of border around child windows. Generally set to 0.0f or 1.0f. (Other values are not well tested and more CPU/GPU costly).
2236 float PopupRounding; // Radius of popup window corners rounding. (Note that tooltip windows use WindowRounding)
2237 float PopupBorderSize; // Thickness of border around popup/tooltip windows. Generally set to 0.0f or 1.0f. (Other values are not well tested and more CPU/GPU costly).
2238 ImVec2 FramePadding; // Padding within a framed rectangle (used by most widgets).
2239 float FrameRounding; // Radius of frame corners rounding. Set to 0.0f to have rectangular frame (used by most widgets).
2240 float FrameBorderSize; // Thickness of border around frames. Generally set to 0.0f or 1.0f. (Other values are not well tested and more CPU/GPU costly).
2241 ImVec2 ItemSpacing; // Horizontal and vertical spacing between widgets/lines.
2242 ImVec2 ItemInnerSpacing; // Horizontal and vertical spacing between within elements of a composed widget (e.g. a slider and its label).
2243 ImVec2 CellPadding; // Padding within a table cell. Cellpadding.x is locked for entire table. CellPadding.y may be altered between different rows.
2244 ImVec2 TouchExtraPadding; // Expand reactive bounding box for touch-based system where touch position is not accurate enough. Unfortunately we don't sort widgets so priority on overlap will always be given to the first widget. So don't grow this too much!
2245 float IndentSpacing; // Horizontal indentation when e.g. entering a tree node. Generally == (FontSize + FramePadding.x*2).
2246 float ColumnsMinSpacing; // Minimum horizontal spacing between two columns. Preferably > (FramePadding.x + 1).
2247 float ScrollbarSize; // Width of the vertical scrollbar, Height of the horizontal scrollbar.
2248 float ScrollbarRounding; // Radius of grab corners for scrollbar.
2249 float GrabMinSize; // Minimum width/height of a grab box for slider/scrollbar.
2250 float GrabRounding; // Radius of grabs corners rounding. Set to 0.0f to have rectangular slider grabs.
2251 float LogSliderDeadzone; // The size in pixels of the dead-zone around zero on logarithmic sliders that cross zero.
2252 float ImageBorderSize; // Thickness of border around Image() calls.
2253 float TabRounding; // Radius of upper corners of a tab. Set to 0.0f to have rectangular tabs.
2254 float TabBorderSize; // Thickness of border around tabs.
2255 float TabCloseButtonMinWidthSelected; // -1: always visible. 0.0f: visible when hovered. >0.0f: visible when hovered if minimum width.
2256 float TabCloseButtonMinWidthUnselected; // -1: always visible. 0.0f: visible when hovered. >0.0f: visible when hovered if minimum width. FLT_MAX: never show close button when unselected.
2257 float TabBarBorderSize; // Thickness of tab-bar separator, which takes on the tab active color to denote focus.
2258 float TabBarOverlineSize; // Thickness of tab-bar overline, which highlights the selected tab-bar.
2259 float TableAngledHeadersAngle; // Angle of angled headers (supported values range from -50.0f degrees to +50.0f degrees).
2260 ImVec2 TableAngledHeadersTextAlign;// Alignment of angled headers within the cell
2261 ImGuiDir ColorButtonPosition; // Side of the color button in the ColorEdit4 widget (left/right). Defaults to ImGuiDir_Right.
2262 ImVec2 ButtonTextAlign; // Alignment of button text when button is larger than text. Defaults to (0.5f, 0.5f) (centered).
2263 ImVec2 SelectableTextAlign; // Alignment of selectable text. Defaults to (0.0f, 0.0f) (top-left aligned). It's generally important to keep this left-aligned if you want to lay multiple items on a same line.
2264 float SeparatorTextBorderSize; // Thickness of border in SeparatorText()
2265 ImVec2 SeparatorTextAlign; // Alignment of text within the separator. Defaults to (0.0f, 0.5f) (left aligned, center).
2266 ImVec2 SeparatorTextPadding; // Horizontal offset of text from each edge of the separator + spacing on other axis. Generally small values. .y is recommended to be == FramePadding.y.
2267 ImVec2 DisplayWindowPadding; // Apply to regular windows: amount which we enforce to keep visible when moving near edges of your screen.
2268 ImVec2 DisplaySafeAreaPadding; // Apply to every windows, menus, popups, tooltips: amount where we avoid displaying contents. Adjust if you cannot see the edges of your screen (e.g. on a TV where scaling has not been configured).
2269 float DockingSeparatorSize; // Thickness of resizing border between docked windows
2270 float MouseCursorScale; // Scale software rendered mouse cursor (when io.MouseDrawCursor is enabled). We apply per-monitor DPI scaling over this scale. May be removed later.
2271 bool AntiAliasedLines; // Enable anti-aliased lines/borders. Disable if you are really tight on CPU/GPU. Latched at the beginning of the frame (copied to ImDrawList).
2272 bool AntiAliasedLinesUseTex; // Enable anti-aliased lines/borders using textures where possible. Require backend to render with bilinear filtering (NOT point/nearest filtering). Latched at the beginning of the frame (copied to ImDrawList).
2273 bool AntiAliasedFill; // Enable anti-aliased edges around filled shapes (rounded rectangles, circles, etc.). Disable if you are really tight on CPU/GPU. Latched at the beginning of the frame (copied to ImDrawList).
2274 float CurveTessellationTol; // Tessellation tolerance when using PathBezierCurveTo() without a specific number of segments. Decrease for highly tessellated curves (higher quality, more polygons), increase to reduce quality.
2275 float CircleTessellationMaxError; // Maximum error (in pixels) allowed when using AddCircle()/AddCircleFilled() or drawing rounded corner rectangles with no explicit segment count specified. Decrease for higher quality but more geometry.
2276
2277 // Colors
2278 ImVec4 Colors[ImGuiCol_COUNT];
2279
2280 // Behaviors
2281 // (It is possible to modify those fields mid-frame if specific behavior need it, unlike e.g. configuration fields in ImGuiIO)
2282 float HoverStationaryDelay; // Delay for IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_Stationary). Time required to consider mouse stationary.
2283 float HoverDelayShort; // Delay for IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayShort). Usually used along with HoverStationaryDelay.
2284 float HoverDelayNormal; // Delay for IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayNormal). "
2285 ImGuiHoveredFlags HoverFlagsForTooltipMouse;// Default flags when using IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip) or BeginItemTooltip()/SetItemTooltip() while using mouse.
2286 ImGuiHoveredFlags HoverFlagsForTooltipNav; // Default flags when using IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip) or BeginItemTooltip()/SetItemTooltip() while using keyboard/gamepad.
2287
2288 IMGUI_API ImGuiStyle();
2289 IMGUI_API void ScaleAllSizes(float scale_factor);
2290
2291 // Obsolete names
2292#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
2293 // TabMinWidthForCloseButton = TabCloseButtonMinWidthUnselected // Renamed in 1.91.9.
2294#endif
2295};
2296
2297//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2298// [SECTION] ImGuiIO
2299//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2300// Communicate most settings and inputs/outputs to Dear ImGui using this structure.
2301// Access via ImGui::GetIO(). Read 'Programmer guide' section in .cpp file for general usage.
2302// It is generally expected that:
2303// - initialization: backends and user code writes to ImGuiIO.
2304// - main loop: backends writes to ImGuiIO, user code and imgui code reads from ImGuiIO.
2305//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2306// Also see ImGui::GetPlatformIO() and ImGuiPlatformIO struct for OS/platform related functions: clipboard, IME etc.
2307//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2308
2309// [Internal] Storage used by IsKeyDown(), IsKeyPressed() etc functions.
2310// If prior to 1.87 you used io.KeysDownDuration[] (which was marked as internal), you should use GetKeyData(key)->DownDuration and *NOT* io.KeysData[key]->DownDuration.
2311struct ImGuiKeyData
2312{
2313 bool Down; // True for if key is down
2314 float DownDuration; // Duration the key has been down (<0.0f: not pressed, 0.0f: just pressed, >0.0f: time held)
2315 float DownDurationPrev; // Last frame duration the key has been down
2316 float AnalogValue; // 0.0f..1.0f for gamepad values
2317};
2318
2319struct ImGuiIO
2320{
2321 //------------------------------------------------------------------
2322 // Configuration // Default value
2323 //------------------------------------------------------------------
2324
2325 ImGuiConfigFlags ConfigFlags; // = 0 // See ImGuiConfigFlags_ enum. Set by user/application. Keyboard/Gamepad navigation options, etc.
2326 ImGuiBackendFlags BackendFlags; // = 0 // See ImGuiBackendFlags_ enum. Set by backend (imgui_impl_xxx files or custom backend) to communicate features supported by the backend.
2327 ImVec2 DisplaySize; // <unset> // Main display size, in pixels (generally == GetMainViewport()->Size). May change every frame.
2328 float DeltaTime; // = 1.0f/60.0f // Time elapsed since last frame, in seconds. May change every frame.
2329 float IniSavingRate; // = 5.0f // Minimum time between saving positions/sizes to .ini file, in seconds.
2330 const char* IniFilename; // = "imgui.ini" // Path to .ini file (important: default "imgui.ini" is relative to current working dir!). Set NULL to disable automatic .ini loading/saving or if you want to manually call LoadIniSettingsXXX() / SaveIniSettingsXXX() functions.
2331 const char* LogFilename; // = "imgui_log.txt"// Path to .log file (default parameter to ImGui::LogToFile when no file is specified).
2332 void* UserData; // = NULL // Store your own data.
2333
2334 // Font system
2335 ImFontAtlas*Fonts; // <auto> // Font atlas: load, rasterize and pack one or more fonts into a single texture.
2336 float FontGlobalScale; // = 1.0f // Global scale all fonts
2337 bool FontAllowUserScaling; // = false // [OBSOLETE] Allow user scaling text of individual window with CTRL+Wheel.
2338 ImFont* FontDefault; // = NULL // Font to use on NewFrame(). Use NULL to uses Fonts->Fonts[0].
2339 ImVec2 DisplayFramebufferScale; // = (1, 1) // For retina display or other situations where window coordinates are different from framebuffer coordinates. This generally ends up in ImDrawData::FramebufferScale.
2340
2341 // Keyboard/Gamepad Navigation options
2342 bool ConfigNavSwapGamepadButtons; // = false // Swap Activate<>Cancel (A<>B) buttons, matching typical "Nintendo/Japanese style" gamepad layout.
2343 bool ConfigNavMoveSetMousePos; // = false // Directional/tabbing navigation teleports the mouse cursor. May be useful on TV/console systems where moving a virtual mouse is difficult. Will update io.MousePos and set io.WantSetMousePos=true.
2344 bool ConfigNavCaptureKeyboard; // = true // Sets io.WantCaptureKeyboard when io.NavActive is set.
2345 bool ConfigNavEscapeClearFocusItem; // = true // Pressing Escape can clear focused item + navigation id/highlight. Set to false if you want to always keep highlight on.
2346 bool ConfigNavEscapeClearFocusWindow;// = false // Pressing Escape can clear focused window as well (super set of io.ConfigNavEscapeClearFocusItem).
2347 bool ConfigNavCursorVisibleAuto; // = true // Using directional navigation key makes the cursor visible. Mouse click hides the cursor.
2348 bool ConfigNavCursorVisibleAlways; // = false // Navigation cursor is always visible.
2349
2350 // Docking options (when ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable is set)
2351 bool ConfigDockingNoSplit; // = false // Simplified docking mode: disable window splitting, so docking is limited to merging multiple windows together into tab-bars.
2352 bool ConfigDockingWithShift; // = false // Enable docking with holding Shift key (reduce visual noise, allows dropping in wider space)
2353 bool ConfigDockingAlwaysTabBar; // = false // [BETA] [FIXME: This currently creates regression with auto-sizing and general overhead] Make every single floating window display within a docking node.
2354 bool ConfigDockingTransparentPayload;// = false // [BETA] Make window or viewport transparent when docking and only display docking boxes on the target viewport. Useful if rendering of multiple viewport cannot be synced. Best used with ConfigViewportsNoAutoMerge.
2355
2356 // Viewport options (when ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable is set)
2357 bool ConfigViewportsNoAutoMerge; // = false; // Set to make all floating imgui windows always create their own viewport. Otherwise, they are merged into the main host viewports when overlapping it. May also set ImGuiViewportFlags_NoAutoMerge on individual viewport.
2358 bool ConfigViewportsNoTaskBarIcon; // = false // Disable default OS task bar icon flag for secondary viewports. When a viewport doesn't want a task bar icon, ImGuiViewportFlags_NoTaskBarIcon will be set on it.
2359 bool ConfigViewportsNoDecoration; // = true // Disable default OS window decoration flag for secondary viewports. When a viewport doesn't want window decorations, ImGuiViewportFlags_NoDecoration will be set on it. Enabling decoration can create subsequent issues at OS levels (e.g. minimum window size).
2360 bool ConfigViewportsNoDefaultParent; // = false // Disable default OS parenting to main viewport for secondary viewports. By default, viewports are marked with ParentViewportId = <main_viewport>, expecting the platform backend to setup a parent/child relationship between the OS windows (some backend may ignore this). Set to true if you want the default to be 0, then all viewports will be top-level OS windows.
2361
2362 // Miscellaneous options
2363 // (you can visualize and interact with all options in 'Demo->Configuration')
2364 bool MouseDrawCursor; // = false // Request ImGui to draw a mouse cursor for you (if you are on a platform without a mouse cursor). Cannot be easily renamed to 'io.ConfigXXX' because this is frequently used by backend implementations.
2365 bool ConfigMacOSXBehaviors; // = defined(__APPLE__) // Swap Cmd<>Ctrl keys + OS X style text editing cursor movement using Alt instead of Ctrl, Shortcuts using Cmd/Super instead of Ctrl, Line/Text Start and End using Cmd+Arrows instead of Home/End, Double click selects by word instead of selecting whole text, Multi-selection in lists uses Cmd/Super instead of Ctrl.
2366 bool ConfigInputTrickleEventQueue; // = true // Enable input queue trickling: some types of events submitted during the same frame (e.g. button down + up) will be spread over multiple frames, improving interactions with low framerates.
2367 bool ConfigInputTextCursorBlink; // = true // Enable blinking cursor (optional as some users consider it to be distracting).
2368 bool ConfigInputTextEnterKeepActive; // = false // [BETA] Pressing Enter will keep item active and select contents (single-line only).
2369 bool ConfigDragClickToInputText; // = false // [BETA] Enable turning DragXXX widgets into text input with a simple mouse click-release (without moving). Not desirable on devices without a keyboard.
2370 bool ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges; // = true // Enable resizing of windows from their edges and from the lower-left corner. This requires ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors for better mouse cursor feedback. (This used to be a per-window ImGuiWindowFlags_ResizeFromAnySide flag)
2371 bool ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly; // = false // Enable allowing to move windows only when clicking on their title bar. Does not apply to windows without a title bar.
2372 bool ConfigWindowsCopyContentsWithCtrlC; // = false // [EXPERIMENTAL] CTRL+C copy the contents of focused window into the clipboard. Experimental because: (1) has known issues with nested Begin/End pairs (2) text output quality varies (3) text output is in submission order rather than spatial order.
2373 bool ConfigScrollbarScrollByPage; // = true // Enable scrolling page by page when clicking outside the scrollbar grab. When disabled, always scroll to clicked location. When enabled, Shift+Click scrolls to clicked location.
2374 float ConfigMemoryCompactTimer; // = 60.0f // Timer (in seconds) to free transient windows/tables memory buffers when unused. Set to -1.0f to disable.
2375
2376 // Inputs Behaviors
2377 // (other variables, ones which are expected to be tweaked within UI code, are exposed in ImGuiStyle)
2378 float MouseDoubleClickTime; // = 0.30f // Time for a double-click, in seconds.
2379 float MouseDoubleClickMaxDist; // = 6.0f // Distance threshold to stay in to validate a double-click, in pixels.
2380 float MouseDragThreshold; // = 6.0f // Distance threshold before considering we are dragging.
2381 float KeyRepeatDelay; // = 0.275f // When holding a key/button, time before it starts repeating, in seconds (for buttons in Repeat mode, etc.).
2382 float KeyRepeatRate; // = 0.050f // When holding a key/button, rate at which it repeats, in seconds.
2383
2384 //------------------------------------------------------------------
2385 // Debug options
2386 //------------------------------------------------------------------
2387
2388 // Options to configure Error Handling and how we handle recoverable errors [EXPERIMENTAL]
2389 // - Error recovery is provided as a way to facilitate:
2390 // - Recovery after a programming error (native code or scripting language - the later tends to facilitate iterating on code while running).
2391 // - Recovery after running an exception handler or any error processing which may skip code after an error has been detected.
2392 // - Error recovery is not perfect nor guaranteed! It is a feature to ease development.
2393 // You not are not supposed to rely on it in the course of a normal application run.
2394 // - Functions that support error recovery are using IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR() instead of IM_ASSERT().
2395 // - By design, we do NOT allow error recovery to be 100% silent. One of the three options needs to be checked!
2396 // - Always ensure that on programmers seats you have at minimum Asserts or Tooltips enabled when making direct imgui API calls!
2397 // Otherwise it would severely hinder your ability to catch and correct mistakes!
2398 // Read https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Error-Handling for details.
2399 // - Programmer seats: keep asserts (default), or disable asserts and keep error tooltips (new and nice!)
2400 // - Non-programmer seats: maybe disable asserts, but make sure errors are resurfaced (tooltips, visible log entries, use callback etc.)
2401 // - Recovery after error/exception: record stack sizes with ErrorRecoveryStoreState(), disable assert, set log callback (to e.g. trigger high-level breakpoint), recover with ErrorRecoveryTryToRecoverState(), restore settings.
2402 bool ConfigErrorRecovery; // = true // Enable error recovery support. Some errors won't be detected and lead to direct crashes if recovery is disabled.
2403 bool ConfigErrorRecoveryEnableAssert; // = true // Enable asserts on recoverable error. By default call IM_ASSERT() when returning from a failing IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR()
2404 bool ConfigErrorRecoveryEnableDebugLog; // = true // Enable debug log output on recoverable errors.
2405 bool ConfigErrorRecoveryEnableTooltip; // = true // Enable tooltip on recoverable errors. The tooltip include a way to enable asserts if they were disabled.
2406
2407 // Option to enable various debug tools showing buttons that will call the IM_DEBUG_BREAK() macro.
2408 // - The Item Picker tool will be available regardless of this being enabled, in order to maximize its discoverability.
2409 // - Requires a debugger being attached, otherwise IM_DEBUG_BREAK() options will appear to crash your application.
2410 // e.g. io.ConfigDebugIsDebuggerPresent = ::IsDebuggerPresent() on Win32, or refer to ImOsIsDebuggerPresent() imgui_test_engine/imgui_te_utils.cpp for a Unix compatible version).
2411 bool ConfigDebugIsDebuggerPresent; // = false // Enable various tools calling IM_DEBUG_BREAK().
2412
2413 // Tools to detect code submitting items with conflicting/duplicate IDs
2414 // - Code should use PushID()/PopID() in loops, or append "##xx" to same-label identifiers.
2415 // - Empty label e.g. Button("") == same ID as parent widget/node. Use Button("##xx") instead!
2416 // - See FAQ https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md#q-about-the-id-stack-system
2417 bool ConfigDebugHighlightIdConflicts;// = true // Highlight and show an error message popup when multiple items have conflicting identifiers.
2418 bool ConfigDebugHighlightIdConflictsShowItemPicker;//=true // Show "Item Picker" button in aforementioned popup.
2419
2420 // Tools to test correct Begin/End and BeginChild/EndChild behaviors.
2421 // - Presently Begin()/End() and BeginChild()/EndChild() needs to ALWAYS be called in tandem, regardless of return value of BeginXXX()
2422 // - This is inconsistent with other BeginXXX functions and create confusion for many users.
2423 // - We expect to update the API eventually. In the meanwhile we provide tools to facilitate checking user-code behavior.
2424 bool ConfigDebugBeginReturnValueOnce;// = false // First-time calls to Begin()/BeginChild() will return false. NEEDS TO BE SET AT APPLICATION BOOT TIME if you don't want to miss windows.
2425 bool ConfigDebugBeginReturnValueLoop;// = false // Some calls to Begin()/BeginChild() will return false. Will cycle through window depths then repeat. Suggested use: add "io.ConfigDebugBeginReturnValue = io.KeyShift" in your main loop then occasionally press SHIFT. Windows should be flickering while running.
2426
2427 // Option to deactivate io.AddFocusEvent(false) handling.
2428 // - May facilitate interactions with a debugger when focus loss leads to clearing inputs data.
2429 // - Backends may have other side-effects on focus loss, so this will reduce side-effects but not necessary remove all of them.
2430 bool ConfigDebugIgnoreFocusLoss; // = false // Ignore io.AddFocusEvent(false), consequently not calling io.ClearInputKeys()/io.ClearInputMouse() in input processing.
2431
2432 // Option to audit .ini data
2433 bool ConfigDebugIniSettings; // = false // Save .ini data with extra comments (particularly helpful for Docking, but makes saving slower)
2434
2435 //------------------------------------------------------------------
2436 // Platform Identifiers
2437 // (the imgui_impl_xxxx backend files are setting those up for you)
2438 //------------------------------------------------------------------
2439
2440 // Nowadays those would be stored in ImGuiPlatformIO but we are leaving them here for legacy reasons.
2441 // Optional: Platform/Renderer backend name (informational only! will be displayed in About Window) + User data for backend/wrappers to store their own stuff.
2442 const char* BackendPlatformName; // = NULL
2443 const char* BackendRendererName; // = NULL
2444 void* BackendPlatformUserData; // = NULL // User data for platform backend
2445 void* BackendRendererUserData; // = NULL // User data for renderer backend
2446 void* BackendLanguageUserData; // = NULL // User data for non C++ programming language backend
2447
2448 //------------------------------------------------------------------
2449 // Input - Call before calling NewFrame()
2450 //------------------------------------------------------------------
2451
2452 // Input Functions
2453 IMGUI_API void AddKeyEvent(ImGuiKey key, bool down); // Queue a new key down/up event. Key should be "translated" (as in, generally ImGuiKey_A matches the key end-user would use to emit an 'A' character)
2454 IMGUI_API void AddKeyAnalogEvent(ImGuiKey key, bool down, float v); // Queue a new key down/up event for analog values (e.g. ImGuiKey_Gamepad_ values). Dead-zones should be handled by the backend.
2455 IMGUI_API void AddMousePosEvent(float x, float y); // Queue a mouse position update. Use -FLT_MAX,-FLT_MAX to signify no mouse (e.g. app not focused and not hovered)
2456 IMGUI_API void AddMouseButtonEvent(int button, bool down); // Queue a mouse button change
2457 IMGUI_API void AddMouseWheelEvent(float wheel_x, float wheel_y); // Queue a mouse wheel update. wheel_y<0: scroll down, wheel_y>0: scroll up, wheel_x<0: scroll right, wheel_x>0: scroll left.
2458 IMGUI_API void AddMouseSourceEvent(ImGuiMouseSource source); // Queue a mouse source change (Mouse/TouchScreen/Pen)
2459 IMGUI_API void AddMouseViewportEvent(ImGuiID id); // Queue a mouse hovered viewport. Requires backend to set ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseHoveredViewport to call this (for multi-viewport support).
2460 IMGUI_API void AddFocusEvent(bool focused); // Queue a gain/loss of focus for the application (generally based on OS/platform focus of your window)
2461 IMGUI_API void AddInputCharacter(unsigned int c); // Queue a new character input
2462 IMGUI_API void AddInputCharacterUTF16(ImWchar16 c); // Queue a new character input from a UTF-16 character, it can be a surrogate
2463 IMGUI_API void AddInputCharactersUTF8(const char* str); // Queue a new characters input from a UTF-8 string
2464
2465 IMGUI_API void SetKeyEventNativeData(ImGuiKey key, int native_keycode, int native_scancode, int native_legacy_index = -1); // [Optional] Specify index for legacy <1.87 IsKeyXXX() functions with native indices + specify native keycode, scancode.
2466 IMGUI_API void SetAppAcceptingEvents(bool accepting_events); // Set master flag for accepting key/mouse/text events (default to true). Useful if you have native dialog boxes that are interrupting your application loop/refresh, and you want to disable events being queued while your app is frozen.
2467 IMGUI_API void ClearEventsQueue(); // Clear all incoming events.
2468 IMGUI_API void ClearInputKeys(); // Clear current keyboard/gamepad state + current frame text input buffer. Equivalent to releasing all keys/buttons.
2469 IMGUI_API void ClearInputMouse(); // Clear current mouse state.
2470#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
2471 IMGUI_API void ClearInputCharacters(); // [Obsoleted in 1.89.8] Clear the current frame text input buffer. Now included within ClearInputKeys().
2472#endif
2473
2474 //------------------------------------------------------------------
2475 // Output - Updated by NewFrame() or EndFrame()/Render()
2476 // (when reading from the io.WantCaptureMouse, io.WantCaptureKeyboard flags to dispatch your inputs, it is
2477 // generally easier and more correct to use their state BEFORE calling NewFrame(). See FAQ for details!)
2478 //------------------------------------------------------------------
2479
2480 bool WantCaptureMouse; // Set when Dear ImGui will use mouse inputs, in this case do not dispatch them to your main game/application (either way, always pass on mouse inputs to imgui). (e.g. unclicked mouse is hovering over an imgui window, widget is active, mouse was clicked over an imgui window, etc.).
2481 bool WantCaptureKeyboard; // Set when Dear ImGui will use keyboard inputs, in this case do not dispatch them to your main game/application (either way, always pass keyboard inputs to imgui). (e.g. InputText active, or an imgui window is focused and navigation is enabled, etc.).
2482 bool WantTextInput; // Mobile/console: when set, you may display an on-screen keyboard. This is set by Dear ImGui when it wants textual keyboard input to happen (e.g. when a InputText widget is active).
