2483 bool WantSetMousePos; // MousePos has been altered, backend should reposition mouse on next frame. Rarely used! Set only when io.ConfigNavMoveSetMousePos is enabled.
2484 bool WantSaveIniSettings; // When manual .ini load/save is active (io.IniFilename == NULL), this will be set to notify your application that you can call SaveIniSettingsToMemory() and save yourself. Important: clear io.WantSaveIniSettings yourself after saving!
2485 bool NavActive; // Keyboard/Gamepad navigation is currently allowed (will handle ImGuiKey_NavXXX events) = a window is focused and it doesn't use the ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs flag.
2486 bool NavVisible; // Keyboard/Gamepad navigation highlight is visible and allowed (will handle ImGuiKey_NavXXX events).
2487 float Framerate; // Estimate of application framerate (rolling average over 60 frames, based on io.DeltaTime), in frame per second. Solely for convenience. Slow applications may not want to use a moving average or may want to reset underlying buffers occasionally.
2488 int MetricsRenderVertices; // Vertices output during last call to Render()
2489 int MetricsRenderIndices; // Indices output during last call to Render() = number of triangles * 3
2490 int MetricsRenderWindows; // Number of visible windows
2491 int MetricsActiveWindows; // Number of active windows
2492 ImVec2 MouseDelta; // Mouse delta. Note that this is zero if either current or previous position are invalid (-FLT_MAX,-FLT_MAX), so a disappearing/reappearing mouse won't have a huge delta.
2493
2494 //------------------------------------------------------------------
2495 // [Internal] Dear ImGui will maintain those fields. Forward compatibility not guaranteed!
2496 //------------------------------------------------------------------
2497
2498 ImGuiContext* Ctx; // Parent UI context (needs to be set explicitly by parent).
2499
2500 // Main Input State
2501 // (this block used to be written by backend, since 1.87 it is best to NOT write to those directly, call the AddXXX functions above instead)
2502 // (reading from those variables is fair game, as they are extremely unlikely to be moving anywhere)
2503 ImVec2 MousePos; // Mouse position, in pixels. Set to ImVec2(-FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX) if mouse is unavailable (on another screen, etc.)
2504 bool MouseDown[5]; // Mouse buttons: 0=left, 1=right, 2=middle + extras (ImGuiMouseButton_COUNT == 5). Dear ImGui mostly uses left and right buttons. Other buttons allow us to track if the mouse is being used by your application + available to user as a convenience via IsMouse** API.
2505 float MouseWheel; // Mouse wheel Vertical: 1 unit scrolls about 5 lines text. >0 scrolls Up, <0 scrolls Down. Hold SHIFT to turn vertical scroll into horizontal scroll.
2506 float MouseWheelH; // Mouse wheel Horizontal. >0 scrolls Left, <0 scrolls Right. Most users don't have a mouse with a horizontal wheel, may not be filled by all backends.
2507 ImGuiMouseSource MouseSource; // Mouse actual input peripheral (Mouse/TouchScreen/Pen).
2508 ImGuiID MouseHoveredViewport; // (Optional) Modify using io.AddMouseViewportEvent(). With multi-viewports: viewport the OS mouse is hovering. If possible _IGNORING_ viewports with the ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs flag is much better (few backends can handle that). Set io.BackendFlags |= ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseHoveredViewport if you can provide this info. If you don't imgui will infer the value using the rectangles and last focused time of the viewports it knows about (ignoring other OS windows).
2509 bool KeyCtrl; // Keyboard modifier down: Control
2510 bool KeyShift; // Keyboard modifier down: Shift
2511 bool KeyAlt; // Keyboard modifier down: Alt
2512 bool KeySuper; // Keyboard modifier down: Cmd/Super/Windows
2513
2514 // Other state maintained from data above + IO function calls
2515 ImGuiKeyChord KeyMods; // Key mods flags (any of ImGuiMod_Ctrl/ImGuiMod_Shift/ImGuiMod_Alt/ImGuiMod_Super flags, same as io.KeyCtrl/KeyShift/KeyAlt/KeySuper but merged into flags. Read-only, updated by NewFrame()
2516 ImGuiKeyData KeysData[ImGuiKey_NamedKey_COUNT];// Key state for all known keys. Use IsKeyXXX() functions to access this.
2517 bool WantCaptureMouseUnlessPopupClose; // Alternative to WantCaptureMouse: (WantCaptureMouse == true && WantCaptureMouseUnlessPopupClose == false) when a click over void is expected to close a popup.
2518 ImVec2 MousePosPrev; // Previous mouse position (note that MouseDelta is not necessary == MousePos-MousePosPrev, in case either position is invalid)
2519 ImVec2 MouseClickedPos[5]; // Position at time of clicking
2520 double MouseClickedTime[5]; // Time of last click (used to figure out double-click)
2521 bool MouseClicked[5]; // Mouse button went from !Down to Down (same as MouseClickedCount[x] != 0)
2522 bool MouseDoubleClicked[5]; // Has mouse button been double-clicked? (same as MouseClickedCount[x] == 2)
2523 ImU16 MouseClickedCount[5]; // == 0 (not clicked), == 1 (same as MouseClicked[]), == 2 (double-clicked), == 3 (triple-clicked) etc. when going from !Down to Down
2524 ImU16 MouseClickedLastCount[5]; // Count successive number of clicks. Stays valid after mouse release. Reset after another click is done.
2525 bool MouseReleased[5]; // Mouse button went from Down to !Down
2526 double MouseReleasedTime[5]; // Time of last released (rarely used! but useful to handle delayed single-click when trying to disambiguate them from double-click).
2527 bool MouseDownOwned[5]; // Track if button was clicked inside a dear imgui window or over void blocked by a popup. We don't request mouse capture from the application if click started outside ImGui bounds.
2528 bool MouseDownOwnedUnlessPopupClose[5]; // Track if button was clicked inside a dear imgui window.
2529 bool MouseWheelRequestAxisSwap; // On a non-Mac system, holding SHIFT requests WheelY to perform the equivalent of a WheelX event. On a Mac system this is already enforced by the system.
2530 bool MouseCtrlLeftAsRightClick; // (OSX) Set to true when the current click was a Ctrl+click that spawned a simulated right click
2531 float MouseDownDuration[5]; // Duration the mouse button has been down (0.0f == just clicked)
2532 float MouseDownDurationPrev[5]; // Previous time the mouse button has been down
2533 ImVec2 MouseDragMaxDistanceAbs[5]; // Maximum distance, absolute, on each axis, of how much mouse has traveled from the clicking point
2534 float MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[5]; // Squared maximum distance of how much mouse has traveled from the clicking point (used for moving thresholds)
2535 float PenPressure; // Touch/Pen pressure (0.0f to 1.0f, should be >0.0f only when MouseDown[0] == true). Helper storage currently unused by Dear ImGui.
2536 bool AppFocusLost; // Only modify via AddFocusEvent()
2537 bool AppAcceptingEvents; // Only modify via SetAppAcceptingEvents()
2538 ImWchar16 InputQueueSurrogate; // For AddInputCharacterUTF16()
2539 ImVector<ImWchar> InputQueueCharacters; // Queue of _characters_ input (obtained by platform backend). Fill using AddInputCharacter() helper.
2540
2541 // Legacy: before 1.87, we required backend to fill io.KeyMap[] (imgui->native map) during initialization and io.KeysDown[] (native indices) every frame.
2542 // This is still temporarily supported as a legacy feature. However the new preferred scheme is for backend to call io.AddKeyEvent().
2543 // Old (<1.87): ImGui::IsKeyPressed(ImGui::GetIO().KeyMap[ImGuiKey_Space]) --> New (1.87+) ImGui::IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Space)
2544 // Old (<1.87): ImGui::IsKeyPressed(MYPLATFORM_KEY_SPACE) --> New (1.87+) ImGui::IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Space)
2545 // Read https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues/4921 for details.
2546 //int KeyMap[ImGuiKey_COUNT]; // [LEGACY] Input: map of indices into the KeysDown[512] entries array which represent your "native" keyboard state. The first 512 are now unused and should be kept zero. Legacy backend will write into KeyMap[] using ImGuiKey_ indices which are always >512.
2547 //bool KeysDown[ImGuiKey_COUNT]; // [LEGACY] Input: Keyboard keys that are pressed (ideally left in the "native" order your engine has access to keyboard keys, so you can use your own defines/enums for keys). This used to be [512] sized. It is now ImGuiKey_COUNT to allow legacy io.KeysDown[GetKeyIndex(...)] to work without an overflow.
2548 //float NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_COUNT]; // [LEGACY] Since 1.88, NavInputs[] was removed. Backends from 1.60 to 1.86 won't build. Feed gamepad inputs via io.AddKeyEvent() and ImGuiKey_GamepadXXX enums.
2549 //void* ImeWindowHandle; // [Obsoleted in 1.87] Set ImGuiViewport::PlatformHandleRaw instead. Set this to your HWND to get automatic IME cursor positioning.
2550
2551 // Legacy: before 1.91.1, clipboard functions were stored in ImGuiIO instead of ImGuiPlatformIO.
2552 // As this is will affect all users of custom engines/backends, we are providing proper legacy redirection (will obsolete).
2553#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
2554 const char* (*GetClipboardTextFn)(void* user_data);
2555 void (*SetClipboardTextFn)(void* user_data, const char* text);
2556 void* ClipboardUserData;
2557#endif
2558
2559 IMGUI_API ImGuiIO();
2560};
2561
2562//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2563// [SECTION] Misc data structures (ImGuiInputTextCallbackData, ImGuiSizeCallbackData, ImGuiPayload)
2564//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2565
2566// Shared state of InputText(), passed as an argument to your callback when a ImGuiInputTextFlags_Callback* flag is used.
2567// The callback function should return 0 by default.
2568// Callbacks (follow a flag name and see comments in ImGuiInputTextFlags_ declarations for more details)
2569// - ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackEdit: Callback on buffer edit. Note that InputText() already returns true on edit + you can always use IsItemEdited(). The callback is useful to manipulate the underlying buffer while focus is active.
2570// - ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackAlways: Callback on each iteration
2571// - ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion: Callback on pressing TAB
2572// - ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory: Callback on pressing Up/Down arrows
2573// - ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCharFilter: Callback on character inputs to replace or discard them. Modify 'EventChar' to replace or discard, or return 1 in callback to discard.
2574// - ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize: Callback on buffer capacity changes request (beyond 'buf_size' parameter value), allowing the string to grow.
2575struct ImGuiInputTextCallbackData
2576{
2577 ImGuiContext* Ctx; // Parent UI context
2578 ImGuiInputTextFlags EventFlag; // One ImGuiInputTextFlags_Callback* // Read-only
2579 ImGuiInputTextFlags Flags; // What user passed to InputText() // Read-only
2580 void* UserData; // What user passed to InputText() // Read-only
2581
2582 // Arguments for the different callback events
2583 // - During Resize callback, Buf will be same as your input buffer.
2584 // - However, during Completion/History/Always callback, Buf always points to our own internal data (it is not the same as your buffer)! Changes to it will be reflected into your own buffer shortly after the callback.
2585 // - To modify the text buffer in a callback, prefer using the InsertChars() / DeleteChars() function. InsertChars() will take care of calling the resize callback if necessary.
2586 // - If you know your edits are not going to resize the underlying buffer allocation, you may modify the contents of 'Buf[]' directly. You need to update 'BufTextLen' accordingly (0 <= BufTextLen < BufSize) and set 'BufDirty'' to true so InputText can update its internal state.
2587 ImWchar EventChar; // Character input // Read-write // [CharFilter] Replace character with another one, or set to zero to drop. return 1 is equivalent to setting EventChar=0;
2588 ImGuiKey EventKey; // Key pressed (Up/Down/TAB) // Read-only // [Completion,History]
2589 char* Buf; // Text buffer // Read-write // [Resize] Can replace pointer / [Completion,History,Always] Only write to pointed data, don't replace the actual pointer!
2590 int BufTextLen; // Text length (in bytes) // Read-write // [Resize,Completion,History,Always] Exclude zero-terminator storage. In C land: == strlen(some_text), in C++ land: string.length()
2591 int BufSize; // Buffer size (in bytes) = capacity+1 // Read-only // [Resize,Completion,History,Always] Include zero-terminator storage. In C land == ARRAYSIZE(my_char_array), in C++ land: string.capacity()+1
2592 bool BufDirty; // Set if you modify Buf/BufTextLen! // Write // [Completion,History,Always]
2593 int CursorPos; // // Read-write // [Completion,History,Always]
2594 int SelectionStart; // // Read-write // [Completion,History,Always] == to SelectionEnd when no selection)
2595 int SelectionEnd; // // Read-write // [Completion,History,Always]
2596
2597 // Helper functions for text manipulation.
2598 // Use those function to benefit from the CallbackResize behaviors. Calling those function reset the selection.
2599 IMGUI_API ImGuiInputTextCallbackData();
2600 IMGUI_API void DeleteChars(int pos, int bytes_count);
2601 IMGUI_API void InsertChars(int pos, const char* text, const char* text_end = NULL);
2602 void SelectAll() { SelectionStart = 0; SelectionEnd = BufTextLen; }
2603 void ClearSelection() { SelectionStart = SelectionEnd = BufTextLen; }
2604 bool HasSelection() const { return SelectionStart != SelectionEnd; }
2605};
2606
2607// Resizing callback data to apply custom constraint. As enabled by SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(). Callback is called during the next Begin().
2608// NB: For basic min/max size constraint on each axis you don't need to use the callback! The SetNextWindowSizeConstraints() parameters are enough.
2609struct ImGuiSizeCallbackData
2610{
2611 void* UserData; // Read-only. What user passed to SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(). Generally store an integer or float in here (need reinterpret_cast<>).
2612 ImVec2 Pos; // Read-only. Window position, for reference.
2613 ImVec2 CurrentSize; // Read-only. Current window size.
2614 ImVec2 DesiredSize; // Read-write. Desired size, based on user's mouse position. Write to this field to restrain resizing.
2615};
2616
2617// [ALPHA] Rarely used / very advanced uses only. Use with SetNextWindowClass() and DockSpace() functions.
2618// Important: the content of this class is still highly WIP and likely to change and be refactored
2619// before we stabilize Docking features. Please be mindful if using this.
2620// Provide hints:
2621// - To the platform backend via altered viewport flags (enable/disable OS decoration, OS task bar icons, etc.)
2622// - To the platform backend for OS level parent/child relationships of viewport.
2623// - To the docking system for various options and filtering.
2624struct ImGuiWindowClass
2625{
2626 ImGuiID ClassId; // User data. 0 = Default class (unclassed). Windows of different classes cannot be docked with each others.
2627 ImGuiID ParentViewportId; // Hint for the platform backend. -1: use default. 0: request platform backend to not parent the platform. != 0: request platform backend to create a parent<>child relationship between the platform windows. Not conforming backends are free to e.g. parent every viewport to the main viewport or not.
2628 ImGuiID FocusRouteParentWindowId; // ID of parent window for shortcut focus route evaluation, e.g. Shortcut() call from Parent Window will succeed when this window is focused.
2629 ImGuiViewportFlags ViewportFlagsOverrideSet; // Viewport flags to set when a window of this class owns a viewport. This allows you to enforce OS decoration or task bar icon, override the defaults on a per-window basis.
2630 ImGuiViewportFlags ViewportFlagsOverrideClear; // Viewport flags to clear when a window of this class owns a viewport. This allows you to enforce OS decoration or task bar icon, override the defaults on a per-window basis.
2631 ImGuiTabItemFlags TabItemFlagsOverrideSet; // [EXPERIMENTAL] TabItem flags to set when a window of this class gets submitted into a dock node tab bar. May use with ImGuiTabItemFlags_Leading or ImGuiTabItemFlags_Trailing.
2632 ImGuiDockNodeFlags DockNodeFlagsOverrideSet; // [EXPERIMENTAL] Dock node flags to set when a window of this class is hosted by a dock node (it doesn't have to be selected!)
2633 bool DockingAlwaysTabBar; // Set to true to enforce single floating windows of this class always having their own docking node (equivalent of setting the global io.ConfigDockingAlwaysTabBar)
2634 bool DockingAllowUnclassed; // Set to true to allow windows of this class to be docked/merged with an unclassed window. // FIXME-DOCK: Move to DockNodeFlags override?
2635
2636 ImGuiWindowClass() { memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this)); ParentViewportId = (ImGuiID)-1; DockingAllowUnclassed = true; }
2637};
2638
2639// Data payload for Drag and Drop operations: AcceptDragDropPayload(), GetDragDropPayload()
2640struct ImGuiPayload
2641{
2642 // Members
2643 void* Data; // Data (copied and owned by dear imgui)
2644 int DataSize; // Data size
2645
2646 // [Internal]
2647 ImGuiID SourceId; // Source item id
2648 ImGuiID SourceParentId; // Source parent id (if available)
2649 int DataFrameCount; // Data timestamp
2650 char DataType[32 + 1]; // Data type tag (short user-supplied string, 32 characters max)
2651 bool Preview; // Set when AcceptDragDropPayload() was called and mouse has been hovering the target item (nb: handle overlapping drag targets)
2652 bool Delivery; // Set when AcceptDragDropPayload() was called and mouse button is released over the target item.
2653
2654 ImGuiPayload() { Clear(); }
2655 void Clear() { SourceId = SourceParentId = 0; Data = NULL; DataSize = 0; memset(DataType, 0, sizeof(DataType)); DataFrameCount = -1; Preview = Delivery = false; }
2656 bool IsDataType(const char* type) const { return DataFrameCount != -1 && strcmp(type, DataType) == 0; }
2657 bool IsPreview() const { return Preview; }
2658 bool IsDelivery() const { return Delivery; }
2659};
2660
2661//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2662// [SECTION] Helpers (ImGuiOnceUponAFrame, ImGuiTextFilter, ImGuiTextBuffer, ImGuiStorage, ImGuiListClipper, Math Operators, ImColor)
2663//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2664
2665// Helper: Unicode defines
2666#define IM_UNICODE_CODEPOINT_INVALID 0xFFFD // Invalid Unicode code point (standard value).
2667#ifdef IMGUI_USE_WCHAR32
2668#define IM_UNICODE_CODEPOINT_MAX 0x10FFFF // Maximum Unicode code point supported by this build.
2669#else
2670#define IM_UNICODE_CODEPOINT_MAX 0xFFFF // Maximum Unicode code point supported by this build.
2671#endif
2672
2673// Helper: Execute a block of code at maximum once a frame. Convenient if you want to quickly create a UI within deep-nested code that runs multiple times every frame.
2674// Usage: static ImGuiOnceUponAFrame oaf; if (oaf) ImGui::Text("This will be called only once per frame");
2675struct ImGuiOnceUponAFrame
2676{
2677 ImGuiOnceUponAFrame() { RefFrame = -1; }
2678 mutable int RefFrame;
2679 operator bool() const { int current_frame = ImGui::GetFrameCount(); if (RefFrame == current_frame) return false; RefFrame = current_frame; return true; }
2680};
2681
2682// Helper: Parse and apply text filters. In format "aaaaa[,bbbb][,ccccc]"
2683struct ImGuiTextFilter
2684{
2685 IMGUI_API ImGuiTextFilter(const char* default_filter = "");
2686 IMGUI_API bool Draw(const char* label = "Filter (inc,-exc)", float width = 0.0f); // Helper calling InputText+Build
2687 IMGUI_API bool PassFilter(const char* text, const char* text_end = NULL) const;
2688 IMGUI_API void Build();
2689 void Clear() { InputBuf[0] = 0; Build(); }
2690 bool IsActive() const { return !Filters.empty(); }
2691
2692 // [Internal]
2693 struct ImGuiTextRange
2694 {
2695 const char* b;
2696 const char* e;
2697
2698 ImGuiTextRange() { b = e = NULL; }
2699 ImGuiTextRange(const char* _b, const char* _e) { b = _b; e = _e; }
2700 bool empty() const { return b == e; }
2701 IMGUI_API void split(char separator, ImVector<ImGuiTextRange>* out) const;
2702 };
2703 char InputBuf[256];
2704 ImVector<ImGuiTextRange>Filters;
2705 int CountGrep;
2706};
2707
2708// Helper: Growable text buffer for logging/accumulating text
2709// (this could be called 'ImGuiTextBuilder' / 'ImGuiStringBuilder')
2710struct ImGuiTextBuffer
2711{
2712 ImVector<char> Buf;
2713 IMGUI_API static char EmptyString[1];
2714
2715 ImGuiTextBuffer() { }
2716 inline char operator[](int i) const { IM_ASSERT(Buf.Data != NULL); return Buf.Data[i]; }
2717 const char* begin() const { return Buf.Data ? &Buf.front() : EmptyString; }
2718 const char* end() const { return Buf.Data ? &Buf.back() : EmptyString; } // Buf is zero-terminated, so end() will point on the zero-terminator
2719 int size() const { return Buf.Size ? Buf.Size - 1 : 0; }
2720 bool empty() const { return Buf.Size <= 1; }
2721 void clear() { Buf.clear(); }
2722 void resize(int size) { if (Buf.Size > size) Buf.Data[size] = 0; Buf.resize(size ? size + 1 : 0, 0); } // Similar to resize(0) on ImVector: empty string but don't free buffer.
2723 void reserve(int capacity) { Buf.reserve(capacity); }
2724 const char* c_str() const { return Buf.Data ? Buf.Data : EmptyString; }
2725 IMGUI_API void append(const char* str, const char* str_end = NULL);
2726 IMGUI_API void appendf(const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(2);
2727 IMGUI_API void appendfv(const char* fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(2);
2728};
2729
2730// [Internal] Key+Value for ImGuiStorage
2731struct ImGuiStoragePair
2732{
2733 ImGuiID key;
2734 union { int val_i; float val_f; void* val_p; };
2735 ImGuiStoragePair(ImGuiID _key, int _val) { key = _key; val_i = _val; }
2736 ImGuiStoragePair(ImGuiID _key, float _val) { key = _key; val_f = _val; }
2737 ImGuiStoragePair(ImGuiID _key, void* _val) { key = _key; val_p = _val; }
2738};
2739
2740// Helper: Key->Value storage
2741// Typically you don't have to worry about this since a storage is held within each Window.
2742// We use it to e.g. store collapse state for a tree (Int 0/1)
2743// This is optimized for efficient lookup (dichotomy into a contiguous buffer) and rare insertion (typically tied to user interactions aka max once a frame)
2744// You can use it as custom user storage for temporary values. Declare your own storage if, for example:
2745// - You want to manipulate the open/close state of a particular sub-tree in your interface (tree node uses Int 0/1 to store their state).
2746// - You want to store custom debug data easily without adding or editing structures in your code (probably not efficient, but convenient)
2747// Types are NOT stored, so it is up to you to make sure your Key don't collide with different types.
2748struct ImGuiStorage
2749{
2750 // [Internal]
2751 ImVector<ImGuiStoragePair> Data;
2752
2753 // - Get***() functions find pair, never add/allocate. Pairs are sorted so a query is O(log N)
2754 // - Set***() functions find pair, insertion on demand if missing.
2755 // - Sorted insertion is costly, paid once. A typical frame shouldn't need to insert any new pair.
2756 void Clear() { Data.clear(); }
2757 IMGUI_API int GetInt(ImGuiID key, int default_val = 0) const;
2758 IMGUI_API void SetInt(ImGuiID key, int val);
2759 IMGUI_API bool GetBool(ImGuiID key, bool default_val = false) const;
2760 IMGUI_API void SetBool(ImGuiID key, bool val);
2761 IMGUI_API float GetFloat(ImGuiID key, float default_val = 0.0f) const;
2762 IMGUI_API void SetFloat(ImGuiID key, float val);
2763 IMGUI_API void* GetVoidPtr(ImGuiID key) const; // default_val is NULL
2764 IMGUI_API void SetVoidPtr(ImGuiID key, void* val);
2765
2766 // - Get***Ref() functions finds pair, insert on demand if missing, return pointer. Useful if you intend to do Get+Set.
2767 // - References are only valid until a new value is added to the storage. Calling a Set***() function or a Get***Ref() function invalidates the pointer.
2768 // - A typical use case where this is convenient for quick hacking (e.g. add storage during a live Edit&Continue session if you can't modify existing struct)
2769 // float* pvar = ImGui::GetFloatRef(key); ImGui::SliderFloat("var", pvar, 0, 100.0f); some_var += *pvar;
2770 IMGUI_API int* GetIntRef(ImGuiID key, int default_val = 0);
2771 IMGUI_API bool* GetBoolRef(ImGuiID key, bool default_val = false);
2772 IMGUI_API float* GetFloatRef(ImGuiID key, float default_val = 0.0f);
2773 IMGUI_API void** GetVoidPtrRef(ImGuiID key, void* default_val = NULL);
2774
2775 // Advanced: for quicker full rebuild of a storage (instead of an incremental one), you may add all your contents and then sort once.
2776 IMGUI_API void BuildSortByKey();
2777 // Obsolete: use on your own storage if you know only integer are being stored (open/close all tree nodes)
2778 IMGUI_API void SetAllInt(int val);
2779
2780#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
2781 //typedef ::ImGuiStoragePair ImGuiStoragePair; // 1.90.8: moved type outside struct
2782#endif
2783};
2784
2785// Helper: Manually clip large list of items.
2786// If you have lots evenly spaced items and you have random access to the list, you can perform coarse
2787// clipping based on visibility to only submit items that are in view.
2788// The clipper calculates the range of visible items and advance the cursor to compensate for the non-visible items we have skipped.
2789// (Dear ImGui already clip items based on their bounds but: it needs to first layout the item to do so, and generally
2790// fetching/submitting your own data incurs additional cost. Coarse clipping using ImGuiListClipper allows you to easily
2791// scale using lists with tens of thousands of items without a problem)
2792// Usage:
2793// ImGuiListClipper clipper;
2794// clipper.Begin(1000); // We have 1000 elements, evenly spaced.
2795// while (clipper.Step())
2796// for (int i = clipper.DisplayStart; i < clipper.DisplayEnd; i++)
2797// ImGui::Text("line number %d", i);
2798// Generally what happens is:
2799// - Clipper lets you process the first element (DisplayStart = 0, DisplayEnd = 1) regardless of it being visible or not.
2800// - User code submit that one element.
2801// - Clipper can measure the height of the first element
2802// - Clipper calculate the actual range of elements to display based on the current clipping rectangle, position the cursor before the first visible element.
2803// - User code submit visible elements.
2804// - The clipper also handles various subtleties related to keyboard/gamepad navigation, wrapping etc.
2805struct ImGuiListClipper
2806{
2807 ImGuiContext* Ctx; // Parent UI context
2808 int DisplayStart; // First item to display, updated by each call to Step()
2809 int DisplayEnd; // End of items to display (exclusive)
2810 int ItemsCount; // [Internal] Number of items
2811 float ItemsHeight; // [Internal] Height of item after a first step and item submission can calculate it
2812 float StartPosY; // [Internal] Cursor position at the time of Begin() or after table frozen rows are all processed
2813 double StartSeekOffsetY; // [Internal] Account for frozen rows in a table and initial loss of precision in very large windows.
2814 void* TempData; // [Internal] Internal data
2815
2816 // items_count: Use INT_MAX if you don't know how many items you have (in which case the cursor won't be advanced in the final step, and you can call SeekCursorForItem() manually if you need)
2817 // items_height: Use -1.0f to be calculated automatically on first step. Otherwise pass in the distance between your items, typically GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing() or GetFrameHeightWithSpacing().
2818 IMGUI_API ImGuiListClipper();
2819 IMGUI_API ~ImGuiListClipper();
2820 IMGUI_API void Begin(int items_count, float items_height = -1.0f);
2821 IMGUI_API void End(); // Automatically called on the last call of Step() that returns false.
2822 IMGUI_API bool Step(); // Call until it returns false. The DisplayStart/DisplayEnd fields will be set and you can process/draw those items.
2823
2824 // Call IncludeItemByIndex() or IncludeItemsByIndex() *BEFORE* first call to Step() if you need a range of items to not be clipped, regardless of their visibility.
2825 // (Due to alignment / padding of certain items it is possible that an extra item may be included on either end of the display range).
2826 inline void IncludeItemByIndex(int item_index) { IncludeItemsByIndex(item_index, item_index + 1); }
2827 IMGUI_API void IncludeItemsByIndex(int item_begin, int item_end); // item_end is exclusive e.g. use (42, 42+1) to make item 42 never clipped.
2828
2829 // Seek cursor toward given item. This is automatically called while stepping.
2830 // - The only reason to call this is: you can use ImGuiListClipper::Begin(INT_MAX) if you don't know item count ahead of time.
2831 // - In this case, after all steps are done, you'll want to call SeekCursorForItem(item_count).
2832 IMGUI_API void SeekCursorForItem(int item_index);
2833
2834#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
2835 inline void IncludeRangeByIndices(int item_begin, int item_end) { IncludeItemsByIndex(item_begin, item_end); } // [renamed in 1.89.9]
2836 inline void ForceDisplayRangeByIndices(int item_begin, int item_end) { IncludeItemsByIndex(item_begin, item_end); } // [renamed in 1.89.6]
2837 //inline ImGuiListClipper(int items_count, float items_height = -1.0f) { memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this)); ItemsCount = -1; Begin(items_count, items_height); } // [removed in 1.79]
2838#endif
2839};
2840
2841// Helpers: ImVec2/ImVec4 operators
2842// - It is important that we are keeping those disabled by default so they don't leak in user space.
2843// - This is in order to allow user enabling implicit cast operators between ImVec2/ImVec4 and their own types (using IM_VEC2_CLASS_EXTRA in imconfig.h)
2844// - Add '#define IMGUI_DEFINE_MATH_OPERATORS' before including this file (or in imconfig.h) to access courtesy maths operators for ImVec2 and ImVec4.
2845// - We intentionally provide ImVec2*float but not float*ImVec2: this is rare enough and we want to reduce the surface for possible user mistake.
2846#ifdef IMGUI_DEFINE_MATH_OPERATORS
2847#define IMGUI_DEFINE_MATH_OPERATORS_IMPLEMENTED
2848IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_OFF
2849// ImVec2 operators
2850static inline ImVec2 operator*(const ImVec2& lhs, const float rhs) { return ImVec2(lhs.x * rhs, lhs.y * rhs); }
2851static inline ImVec2 operator/(const ImVec2& lhs, const float rhs) { return ImVec2(lhs.x / rhs, lhs.y / rhs); }
2852static inline ImVec2 operator+(const ImVec2& lhs, const ImVec2& rhs) { return ImVec2(lhs.x + rhs.x, lhs.y + rhs.y); }
2853static inline ImVec2 operator-(const ImVec2& lhs, const ImVec2& rhs) { return ImVec2(lhs.x - rhs.x, lhs.y - rhs.y); }
2854static inline ImVec2 operator*(const ImVec2& lhs, const ImVec2& rhs) { return ImVec2(lhs.x * rhs.x, lhs.y * rhs.y); }
2855static inline ImVec2 operator/(const ImVec2& lhs, const ImVec2& rhs) { return ImVec2(lhs.x / rhs.x, lhs.y / rhs.y); }
2856static inline ImVec2 operator-(const ImVec2& lhs) { return ImVec2(-lhs.x, -lhs.y); }
2857static inline ImVec2& operator*=(ImVec2& lhs, const float rhs) { lhs.x *= rhs; lhs.y *= rhs; return lhs; }
2858static inline ImVec2& operator/=(ImVec2& lhs, const float rhs) { lhs.x /= rhs; lhs.y /= rhs; return lhs; }
2859static inline ImVec2& operator+=(ImVec2& lhs, const ImVec2& rhs) { lhs.x += rhs.x; lhs.y += rhs.y; return lhs; }
2860static inline ImVec2& operator-=(ImVec2& lhs, const ImVec2& rhs) { lhs.x -= rhs.x; lhs.y -= rhs.y; return lhs; }
2861static inline ImVec2& operator*=(ImVec2& lhs, const ImVec2& rhs) { lhs.x *= rhs.x; lhs.y *= rhs.y; return lhs; }
2862static inline ImVec2& operator/=(ImVec2& lhs, const ImVec2& rhs) { lhs.x /= rhs.x; lhs.y /= rhs.y; return lhs; }
2863static inline bool operator==(const ImVec2& lhs, const ImVec2& rhs) { return lhs.x == rhs.x && lhs.y == rhs.y; }
2864static inline bool operator!=(const ImVec2& lhs, const ImVec2& rhs) { return lhs.x != rhs.x || lhs.y != rhs.y; }
2865// ImVec4 operators
2866static inline ImVec4 operator*(const ImVec4& lhs, const float rhs) { return ImVec4(lhs.x * rhs, lhs.y * rhs, lhs.z * rhs, lhs.w * rhs); }
2867static inline ImVec4 operator/(const ImVec4& lhs, const float rhs) { return ImVec4(lhs.x / rhs, lhs.y / rhs, lhs.z / rhs, lhs.w / rhs); }
2868static inline ImVec4 operator+(const ImVec4& lhs, const ImVec4& rhs) { return ImVec4(lhs.x + rhs.x, lhs.y + rhs.y, lhs.z + rhs.z, lhs.w + rhs.w); }
2869static inline ImVec4 operator-(const ImVec4& lhs, const ImVec4& rhs) { return ImVec4(lhs.x - rhs.x, lhs.y - rhs.y, lhs.z - rhs.z, lhs.w - rhs.w); }
2870static inline ImVec4 operator*(const ImVec4& lhs, const ImVec4& rhs) { return ImVec4(lhs.x * rhs.x, lhs.y * rhs.y, lhs.z * rhs.z, lhs.w * rhs.w); }
2871static inline ImVec4 operator/(const ImVec4& lhs, const ImVec4& rhs) { return ImVec4(lhs.x / rhs.x, lhs.y / rhs.y, lhs.z / rhs.z, lhs.w / rhs.w); }
2872static inline ImVec4 operator-(const ImVec4& lhs) { return ImVec4(-lhs.x, -lhs.y, -lhs.z, -lhs.w); }
2873static inline bool operator==(const ImVec4& lhs, const ImVec4& rhs) { return lhs.x == rhs.x && lhs.y == rhs.y && lhs.z == rhs.z && lhs.w == rhs.w; }
2874static inline bool operator!=(const ImVec4& lhs, const ImVec4& rhs) { return lhs.x != rhs.x || lhs.y != rhs.y || lhs.z != rhs.z || lhs.w != rhs.w; }
2875IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_RESTORE
2876#endif
2877
2878// Helpers macros to generate 32-bit encoded colors
2879// - User can declare their own format by #defining the 5 _SHIFT/_MASK macros in their imconfig file.
2880// - Any setting other than the default will need custom backend support. The only standard backend that supports anything else than the default is DirectX9.
2881#ifndef IM_COL32_R_SHIFT
2882#ifdef IMGUI_USE_BGRA_PACKED_COLOR
2883#define IM_COL32_R_SHIFT 16
2884#define IM_COL32_G_SHIFT 8
2885#define IM_COL32_B_SHIFT 0
2886#define IM_COL32_A_SHIFT 24
2887#define IM_COL32_A_MASK 0xFF000000
2888#else
2889#define IM_COL32_R_SHIFT 0
2890#define IM_COL32_G_SHIFT 8
2891#define IM_COL32_B_SHIFT 16
2892#define IM_COL32_A_SHIFT 24
2893#define IM_COL32_A_MASK 0xFF000000
2894#endif
2895#endif
2896#define IM_COL32(R,G,B,A) (((ImU32)(A)<<IM_COL32_A_SHIFT) | ((ImU32)(B)<<IM_COL32_B_SHIFT) | ((ImU32)(G)<<IM_COL32_G_SHIFT) | ((ImU32)(R)<<IM_COL32_R_SHIFT))
2897#define IM_COL32_WHITE IM_COL32(255,255,255,255) // Opaque white = 0xFFFFFFFF
2898#define IM_COL32_BLACK IM_COL32(0,0,0,255) // Opaque black
2899#define IM_COL32_BLACK_TRANS IM_COL32(0,0,0,0) // Transparent black = 0x00000000
2900
2901// Helper: ImColor() implicitly converts colors to either ImU32 (packed 4x1 byte) or ImVec4 (4x1 float)
2902// Prefer using IM_COL32() macros if you want a guaranteed compile-time ImU32 for usage with ImDrawList API.
2903// **Avoid storing ImColor! Store either u32 of ImVec4. This is not a full-featured color class. MAY OBSOLETE.
2904// **None of the ImGui API are using ImColor directly but you can use it as a convenience to pass colors in either ImU32 or ImVec4 formats. Explicitly cast to ImU32 or ImVec4 if needed.
2905struct ImColor
2906{
2907 ImVec4 Value;
2908
2909 constexpr ImColor() { }
2910 constexpr ImColor(float r, float g, float b, float a = 1.0f) : Value(r, g, b, a) { }
2911 constexpr ImColor(const ImVec4& col) : Value(col) {}
2912 constexpr ImColor(int r, int g, int b, int a = 255) : Value((float)r * (1.0f / 255.0f), (float)g * (1.0f / 255.0f), (float)b * (1.0f / 255.0f), (float)a* (1.0f / 255.0f)) {}
2913 constexpr ImColor(ImU32 rgba) : Value((float)((rgba >> IM_COL32_R_SHIFT) & 0xFF) * (1.0f / 255.0f), (float)((rgba >> IM_COL32_G_SHIFT) & 0xFF) * (1.0f / 255.0f), (float)((rgba >> IM_COL32_B_SHIFT) & 0xFF) * (1.0f / 255.0f), (float)((rgba >> IM_COL32_A_SHIFT) & 0xFF) * (1.0f / 255.0f)) {}
2914 inline operator ImU32() const { return ImGui::ColorConvertFloat4ToU32(Value); }
2915 inline operator ImVec4() const { return Value; }
2916
2917 // FIXME-OBSOLETE: May need to obsolete/cleanup those helpers.
2918 inline void SetHSV(float h, float s, float v, float a = 1.0f){ ImGui::ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(h, s, v, Value.x, Value.y, Value.z); Value.w = a; }
2919 static ImColor HSV(float h, float s, float v, float a = 1.0f) { float r, g, b; ImGui::ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(h, s, v, r, g, b); return ImColor(r, g, b, a); }
2920};
2921
2922//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2923// [SECTION] Multi-Select API flags and structures (ImGuiMultiSelectFlags, ImGuiSelectionRequestType, ImGuiSelectionRequest, ImGuiMultiSelectIO, ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage)
2924//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2925
2926// Multi-selection system
2927// Documentation at: https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Multi-Select
2928// - Refer to 'Demo->Widgets->Selection State & Multi-Select' for demos using this.
2929// - This system implements standard multi-selection idioms (CTRL+Mouse/Keyboard, SHIFT+Mouse/Keyboard, etc)
2930// with support for clipper (skipping non-visible items), box-select and many other details.
2931// - Selectable(), Checkbox() are supported but custom widgets may use it as well.
2932// - TreeNode() is technically supported but... using this correctly is more complicated: you need some sort of linear/random access to your tree,
2933// which is suited to advanced trees setups also implementing filters and clipper. We will work toward simplifying and demoing it.
2934// - In the spirit of Dear ImGui design, your code owns actual selection data.
2935// This is designed to allow all kinds of selection storage you may use in your application e.g. set/map/hash.
2936// About ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage:
2937// - This is an optional helper to store a selection state and apply selection requests.
2938// - It is used by our demos and provided as a convenience to quickly implement multi-selection.
2939// Usage:
2940// - Identify submitted items with SetNextItemSelectionUserData(), most likely using an index into your current data-set.
2941// - Store and maintain actual selection data using persistent object identifiers.
2942// - Usage flow:
2943// BEGIN - (1) Call BeginMultiSelect() and retrieve the ImGuiMultiSelectIO* result.
2944// - (2) Honor request list (SetAll/SetRange requests) by updating your selection data. Same code as Step 6.
2945// - (3) [If using clipper] You need to make sure RangeSrcItem is always submitted. Calculate its index and pass to clipper.IncludeItemByIndex(). If storing indices in ImGuiSelectionUserData, a simple clipper.IncludeItemByIndex(ms_io->RangeSrcItem) call will work.
2946// LOOP - (4) Submit your items with SetNextItemSelectionUserData() + Selectable()/TreeNode() calls.
2947// END - (5) Call EndMultiSelect() and retrieve the ImGuiMultiSelectIO* result.
2948// - (6) Honor request list (SetAll/SetRange requests) by updating your selection data. Same code as Step 2.
2949// If you submit all items (no clipper), Step 2 and 3 are optional and will be handled by each item themselves. It is fine to always honor those steps.
2950// About ImGuiSelectionUserData:
2951// - This can store an application-defined identifier (e.g. index or pointer) submitted via SetNextItemSelectionUserData().
2952// - In return we store them into RangeSrcItem/RangeFirstItem/RangeLastItem and other fields in ImGuiMultiSelectIO.
2953// - Most applications will store an object INDEX, hence the chosen name and type. Storing an index is natural, because
2954// SetRange requests will give you two end-points and you will need to iterate/interpolate between them to update your selection.
2955// - However it is perfectly possible to store a POINTER or another IDENTIFIER inside ImGuiSelectionUserData.
2956// Our system never assume that you identify items by indices, it never attempts to interpolate between two values.
2957// - If you enable ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoRangeSelect then it is guaranteed that you will never have to interpolate
2958// between two ImGuiSelectionUserData, which may be a convenient way to use part of the feature with less code work.
2959// - As most users will want to store an index, for convenience and to reduce confusion we use ImS64 instead of void*,
2960// being syntactically easier to downcast. Feel free to reinterpret_cast and store a pointer inside.
2961
2962// Flags for BeginMultiSelect()
2963enum ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_
2964{
2965 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_None = 0,
2966 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_SingleSelect = 1 << 0, // Disable selecting more than one item. This is available to allow single-selection code to share same code/logic if desired. It essentially disables the main purpose of BeginMultiSelect() tho!
2967 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoSelectAll = 1 << 1, // Disable CTRL+A shortcut to select all.
2968 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoRangeSelect = 1 << 2, // Disable Shift+selection mouse/keyboard support (useful for unordered 2D selection). With BoxSelect is also ensure contiguous SetRange requests are not combined into one. This allows not handling interpolation in SetRange requests.
2969 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoSelect = 1 << 3, // Disable selecting items when navigating (useful for e.g. supporting range-select in a list of checkboxes).
2970 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoClear = 1 << 4, // Disable clearing selection when navigating or selecting another one (generally used with ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoSelect. useful for e.g. supporting range-select in a list of checkboxes).
2971 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoClearOnReselect = 1 << 5, // Disable clearing selection when clicking/selecting an already selected item.
2972 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect1d = 1 << 6, // Enable box-selection with same width and same x pos items (e.g. full row Selectable()). Box-selection works better with little bit of spacing between items hit-box in order to be able to aim at empty space.
2973 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect2d = 1 << 7, // Enable box-selection with varying width or varying x pos items support (e.g. different width labels, or 2D layout/grid). This is slower: alters clipping logic so that e.g. horizontal movements will update selection of normally clipped items.
2974 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelectNoScroll = 1 << 8, // Disable scrolling when box-selecting near edges of scope.
2975 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ClearOnEscape = 1 << 9, // Clear selection when pressing Escape while scope is focused.
2976 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ClearOnClickVoid = 1 << 10, // Clear selection when clicking on empty location within scope.
2977 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ScopeWindow = 1 << 11, // Scope for _BoxSelect and _ClearOnClickVoid is whole window (Default). Use if BeginMultiSelect() covers a whole window or used a single time in same window.
2978 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ScopeRect = 1 << 12, // Scope for _BoxSelect and _ClearOnClickVoid is rectangle encompassing BeginMultiSelect()/EndMultiSelect(). Use if BeginMultiSelect() is called multiple times in same window.
2979 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_SelectOnClick = 1 << 13, // Apply selection on mouse down when clicking on unselected item. (Default)
2980 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_SelectOnClickRelease = 1 << 14, // Apply selection on mouse release when clicking an unselected item. Allow dragging an unselected item without altering selection.
2981 //ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_RangeSelect2d = 1 << 15, // Shift+Selection uses 2d geometry instead of linear sequence, so possible to use Shift+up/down to select vertically in grid. Analogous to what BoxSelect does.
2982 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NavWrapX = 1 << 16, // [Temporary] Enable navigation wrapping on X axis. Provided as a convenience because we don't have a design for the general Nav API for this yet. When the more general feature be public we may obsolete this flag in favor of new one.
2983};
2984
2985// Main IO structure returned by BeginMultiSelect()/EndMultiSelect().
2986// This mainly contains a list of selection requests.
2987// - Use 'Demo->Tools->Debug Log->Selection' to see requests as they happen.
2988// - Some fields are only useful if your list is dynamic and allows deletion (getting post-deletion focus/state right is shown in the demo)
2989// - Below: who reads/writes each fields? 'r'=read, 'w'=write, 'ms'=multi-select code, 'app'=application/user code.
2990struct ImGuiMultiSelectIO
2991{
2992 //------------------------------------------// BeginMultiSelect / EndMultiSelect
2993 ImVector<ImGuiSelectionRequest> Requests; // ms:w, app:r / ms:w app:r // Requests to apply to your selection data.
2994 ImGuiSelectionUserData RangeSrcItem; // ms:w app:r / // (If using clipper) Begin: Source item (often the first selected item) must never be clipped: use clipper.IncludeItemByIndex() to ensure it is submitted.
2995 ImGuiSelectionUserData NavIdItem; // ms:w, app:r / // (If using deletion) Last known SetNextItemSelectionUserData() value for NavId (if part of submitted items).
2996 bool NavIdSelected; // ms:w, app:r / app:r // (If using deletion) Last known selection state for NavId (if part of submitted items).
2997 bool RangeSrcReset; // app:w / ms:r // (If using deletion) Set before EndMultiSelect() to reset ResetSrcItem (e.g. if deleted selection).
2998 int ItemsCount; // ms:w, app:r / app:r // 'int items_count' parameter to BeginMultiSelect() is copied here for convenience, allowing simpler calls to your ApplyRequests handler. Not used internally.
2999};
3000
3001// Selection request type
3002enum ImGuiSelectionRequestType
3003{
3004 ImGuiSelectionRequestType_None = 0,
3005 ImGuiSelectionRequestType_SetAll, // Request app to clear selection (if Selected==false) or select all items (if Selected==true). We cannot set RangeFirstItem/RangeLastItem as its contents is entirely up to user (not necessarily an index)
3006 ImGuiSelectionRequestType_SetRange, // Request app to select/unselect [RangeFirstItem..RangeLastItem] items (inclusive) based on value of Selected. Only EndMultiSelect() request this, app code can read after BeginMultiSelect() and it will always be false.
3007};
3008
3009// Selection request item
3010struct ImGuiSelectionRequest
3011{
3012 //------------------------------------------// BeginMultiSelect / EndMultiSelect
3013 ImGuiSelectionRequestType Type; // ms:w, app:r / ms:w, app:r // Request type. You'll most often receive 1 Clear + 1 SetRange with a single-item range.
3014 bool Selected; // ms:w, app:r / ms:w, app:r // Parameter for SetAll/SetRange requests (true = select, false = unselect)
3015 ImS8 RangeDirection; // / ms:w app:r // Parameter for SetRange request: +1 when RangeFirstItem comes before RangeLastItem, -1 otherwise. Useful if you want to preserve selection order on a backward Shift+Click.
3016 ImGuiSelectionUserData RangeFirstItem; // / ms:w, app:r // Parameter for SetRange request (this is generally == RangeSrcItem when shift selecting from top to bottom).
3017 ImGuiSelectionUserData RangeLastItem; // / ms:w, app:r // Parameter for SetRange request (this is generally == RangeSrcItem when shift selecting from bottom to top). Inclusive!
3018};
3019
3020// Optional helper to store multi-selection state + apply multi-selection requests.
3021// - Used by our demos and provided as a convenience to easily implement basic multi-selection.
3022// - Iterate selection with 'void* it = NULL; ImGuiID id; while (selection.GetNextSelectedItem(&it, &id)) { ... }'
3023// Or you can check 'if (Contains(id)) { ... }' for each possible object if their number is not too high to iterate.
3024// - USING THIS IS NOT MANDATORY. This is only a helper and not a required API.
3025// To store a multi-selection, in your application you could:
3026// - Use this helper as a convenience. We use our simple key->value ImGuiStorage as a std::set<ImGuiID> replacement.
3027// - Use your own external storage: e.g. std::set<MyObjectId>, std::vector<MyObjectId>, interval trees, intrusively stored selection etc.
3028// In ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage we:
3029// - always use indices in the multi-selection API (passed to SetNextItemSelectionUserData(), retrieved in ImGuiMultiSelectIO)
3030// - use the AdapterIndexToStorageId() indirection layer to abstract how persistent selection data is derived from an index.
3031// - use decently optimized logic to allow queries and insertion of very large selection sets.
3032// - do not preserve selection order.
3033// Many combinations are possible depending on how you prefer to store your items and how you prefer to store your selection.
3034// Large applications are likely to eventually want to get rid of this indirection layer and do their own thing.
3035// See https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Multi-Select for details and pseudo-code using this helper.
3036struct ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage
3037{
3038 // Members
3039 int Size; // // Number of selected items, maintained by this helper.
3040 bool PreserveOrder; // = false // GetNextSelectedItem() will return ordered selection (currently implemented by two additional sorts of selection. Could be improved)
3041 void* UserData; // = NULL // User data for use by adapter function // e.g. selection.UserData = (void*)my_items;
3042 ImGuiID (*AdapterIndexToStorageId)(ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage* self, int idx); // e.g. selection.AdapterIndexToStorageId = [](ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage* self, int idx) { return ((MyItems**)self->UserData)[idx]->ID; };
3043 int _SelectionOrder;// [Internal] Increasing counter to store selection order
3044 ImGuiStorage _Storage; // [Internal] Selection set. Think of this as similar to e.g. std::set<ImGuiID>. Prefer not accessing directly: iterate with GetNextSelectedItem().
3045
3046 // Methods
3047 IMGUI_API ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage();
3048 IMGUI_API void ApplyRequests(ImGuiMultiSelectIO* ms_io); // Apply selection requests coming from BeginMultiSelect() and EndMultiSelect() functions. It uses 'items_count' passed to BeginMultiSelect()
3049 IMGUI_API bool Contains(ImGuiID id) const; // Query if an item id is in selection.
3050 IMGUI_API void Clear(); // Clear selection
3051 IMGUI_API void Swap(ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage& r); // Swap two selections
3052 IMGUI_API void SetItemSelected(ImGuiID id, bool selected); // Add/remove an item from selection (generally done by ApplyRequests() function)
3053 IMGUI_API bool GetNextSelectedItem(void** opaque_it, ImGuiID* out_id); // Iterate selection with 'void* it = NULL; ImGuiID id; while (selection.GetNextSelectedItem(&it, &id)) { ... }'
3054 inline ImGuiID GetStorageIdFromIndex(int idx) { return AdapterIndexToStorageId(this, idx); } // Convert index to item id based on provided adapter.
3055};
3056
3057// Optional helper to apply multi-selection requests to existing randomly accessible storage.
3058// Convenient if you want to quickly wire multi-select API on e.g. an array of bool or items storing their own selection state.
3059struct ImGuiSelectionExternalStorage
3060{
3061 // Members
3062 void* UserData; // User data for use by adapter function // e.g. selection.UserData = (void*)my_items;
3063 void (*AdapterSetItemSelected)(ImGuiSelectionExternalStorage* self, int idx, bool selected); // e.g. AdapterSetItemSelected = [](ImGuiSelectionExternalStorage* self, int idx, bool selected) { ((MyItems**)self->UserData)[idx]->Selected = selected; }
3064
3065 // Methods
3066 IMGUI_API ImGuiSelectionExternalStorage();
3067 IMGUI_API void ApplyRequests(ImGuiMultiSelectIO* ms_io); // Apply selection requests by using AdapterSetItemSelected() calls
3068};
3069
3070//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3071// [SECTION] Drawing API (ImDrawCmd, ImDrawIdx, ImDrawVert, ImDrawChannel, ImDrawListSplitter, ImDrawListFlags, ImDrawList, ImDrawData)
3072// Hold a series of drawing commands. The user provides a renderer for ImDrawData which essentially contains an array of ImDrawList.
3073//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3074
3075// The maximum line width to bake anti-aliased textures for. Build atlas with ImFontAtlasFlags_NoBakedLines to disable baking.
3076#ifndef IM_DRAWLIST_TEX_LINES_WIDTH_MAX
3077#define IM_DRAWLIST_TEX_LINES_WIDTH_MAX (32)
3078#endif
3079
3080// ImDrawIdx: vertex index. [Compile-time configurable type]
3081// - To use 16-bit indices + allow large meshes: backend need to set 'io.BackendFlags |= ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset' and handle ImDrawCmd::VtxOffset (recommended).
3082// - To use 32-bit indices: override with '#define ImDrawIdx unsigned int' in your imconfig.h file.
3083#ifndef ImDrawIdx
3084typedef unsigned short ImDrawIdx; // Default: 16-bit (for maximum compatibility with renderer backends)
3085#endif
3086
3087// ImDrawCallback: Draw callbacks for advanced uses [configurable type: override in imconfig.h]
3088// NB: You most likely do NOT need to use draw callbacks just to create your own widget or customized UI rendering,
3089// you can poke into the draw list for that! Draw callback may be useful for example to:
3090// A) Change your GPU render state,
3091// B) render a complex 3D scene inside a UI element without an intermediate texture/render target, etc.
3092// The expected behavior from your rendering function is 'if (cmd.UserCallback != NULL) { cmd.UserCallback(parent_list, cmd); } else { RenderTriangles() }'
3093// If you want to override the signature of ImDrawCallback, you can simply use e.g. '#define ImDrawCallback MyDrawCallback' (in imconfig.h) + update rendering backend accordingly.
3094#ifndef ImDrawCallback
3095typedef void (*ImDrawCallback)(const ImDrawList* parent_list, const ImDrawCmd* cmd);
3096#endif
3097
3098// Special Draw callback value to request renderer backend to reset the graphics/render state.
3099// The renderer backend needs to handle this special value, otherwise it will crash trying to call a function at this address.
3100// This is useful, for example, if you submitted callbacks which you know have altered the render state and you want it to be restored.
3101// Render state is not reset by default because they are many perfectly useful way of altering render state (e.g. changing shader/blending settings before an Image call).
3102#define ImDrawCallback_ResetRenderState (ImDrawCallback)(-8)
3103
3104// Typically, 1 command = 1 GPU draw call (unless command is a callback)
3105// - VtxOffset: When 'io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset' is enabled,
3106// this fields allow us to render meshes larger than 64K vertices while keeping 16-bit indices.
3107// Backends made for <1.71. will typically ignore the VtxOffset fields.
3108// - The ClipRect/TextureId/VtxOffset fields must be contiguous as we memcmp() them together (this is asserted for).
3109struct ImDrawCmd
3110{
3111 ImVec4 ClipRect; // 4*4 // Clipping rectangle (x1, y1, x2, y2). Subtract ImDrawData->DisplayPos to get clipping rectangle in "viewport" coordinates
3112 ImTextureID TextureId; // 4-8 // User-provided texture ID. Set by user in ImfontAtlas::SetTexID() for fonts or passed to Image*() functions. Ignore if never using images or multiple fonts atlas.
3113 unsigned int VtxOffset; // 4 // Start offset in vertex buffer. ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset: always 0, otherwise may be >0 to support meshes larger than 64K vertices with 16-bit indices.
3114 unsigned int IdxOffset; // 4 // Start offset in index buffer.
3115 unsigned int ElemCount; // 4 // Number of indices (multiple of 3) to be rendered as triangles. Vertices are stored in the callee ImDrawList's vtx_buffer[] array, indices in idx_buffer[].
3116 ImDrawCallback UserCallback; // 4-8 // If != NULL, call the function instead of rendering the vertices. clip_rect and texture_id will be set normally.
3117 void* UserCallbackData; // 4-8 // Callback user data (when UserCallback != NULL). If called AddCallback() with size == 0, this is a copy of the AddCallback() argument. If called AddCallback() with size > 0, this is pointing to a buffer where data is stored.
3118 int UserCallbackDataSize; // 4 // Size of callback user data when using storage, otherwise 0.
3119 int UserCallbackDataOffset;// 4 // [Internal] Offset of callback user data when using storage, otherwise -1.
3120
3121 ImDrawCmd() { memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this)); } // Also ensure our padding fields are zeroed
3122
3123 // Since 1.83: returns ImTextureID associated with this draw call. Warning: DO NOT assume this is always same as 'TextureId' (we will change this function for an upcoming feature)
3124 inline ImTextureID GetTexID() const { return TextureId; }
3125};
3126
3127// Vertex layout
3128#ifndef IMGUI_OVERRIDE_DRAWVERT_STRUCT_LAYOUT
3129struct ImDrawVert
3130{
3131 ImVec2 pos;
3132 ImVec2 uv;
3133 ImU32 col;
3134};
3135#else
3136// You can override the vertex format layout by defining IMGUI_OVERRIDE_DRAWVERT_STRUCT_LAYOUT in imconfig.h
3137// The code expect ImVec2 pos (8 bytes), ImVec2 uv (8 bytes), ImU32 col (4 bytes), but you can re-order them or add other fields as needed to simplify integration in your engine.
3138// The type has to be described within the macro (you can either declare the struct or use a typedef). This is because ImVec2/ImU32 are likely not declared at the time you'd want to set your type up.
3139// NOTE: IMGUI DOESN'T CLEAR THE STRUCTURE AND DOESN'T CALL A CONSTRUCTOR SO ANY CUSTOM FIELD WILL BE UNINITIALIZED. IF YOU ADD EXTRA FIELDS (SUCH AS A 'Z' COORDINATES) YOU WILL NEED TO CLEAR THEM DURING RENDER OR TO IGNORE THEM.
3140IMGUI_OVERRIDE_DRAWVERT_STRUCT_LAYOUT;
3141#endif
3142
3143// [Internal] For use by ImDrawList
3144struct ImDrawCmdHeader
3145{
3146 ImVec4 ClipRect;
3147 ImTextureID TextureId;
3148 unsigned int VtxOffset;
3149};
3150
3151// [Internal] For use by ImDrawListSplitter
3152struct ImDrawChannel
3153{
3154 ImVector<ImDrawCmd> _CmdBuffer;
3155 ImVector<ImDrawIdx> _IdxBuffer;
3156};
3157
3158// Split/Merge functions are used to split the draw list into different layers which can be drawn into out of order.
3159// This is used by the Columns/Tables API, so items of each column can be batched together in a same draw call.
3160struct ImDrawListSplitter
3161{
3162 int _Current; // Current channel number (0)
3163 int _Count; // Number of active channels (1+)
3164 ImVector<ImDrawChannel> _Channels; // Draw channels (not resized down so _Count might be < Channels.Size)
3165
3166 inline ImDrawListSplitter() { memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this)); }
3167 inline ~ImDrawListSplitter() { ClearFreeMemory(); }
3168 inline void Clear() { _Current = 0; _Count = 1; } // Do not clear Channels[] so our allocations are reused next frame
3169 IMGUI_API void ClearFreeMemory();
3170 IMGUI_API void Split(ImDrawList* draw_list, int count);
3171 IMGUI_API void Merge(ImDrawList* draw_list);
3172 IMGUI_API void SetCurrentChannel(ImDrawList* draw_list, int channel_idx);
3173};
3174
3175// Flags for ImDrawList functions
3176// (Legacy: bit 0 must always correspond to ImDrawFlags_Closed to be backward compatible with old API using a bool. Bits 1..3 must be unused)
3177enum ImDrawFlags_
3178{
3179 ImDrawFlags_None = 0,
3180 ImDrawFlags_Closed = 1 << 0, // PathStroke(), AddPolyline(): specify that shape should be closed (Important: this is always == 1 for legacy reason)
3181 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopLeft = 1 << 4, // AddRect(), AddRectFilled(), PathRect(): enable rounding top-left corner only (when rounding > 0.0f, we default to all corners). Was 0x01.
3182 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopRight = 1 << 5, // AddRect(), AddRectFilled(), PathRect(): enable rounding top-right corner only (when rounding > 0.0f, we default to all corners). Was 0x02.
3183 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomLeft = 1 << 6, // AddRect(), AddRectFilled(), PathRect(): enable rounding bottom-left corner only (when rounding > 0.0f, we default to all corners). Was 0x04.
3184 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomRight = 1 << 7, // AddRect(), AddRectFilled(), PathRect(): enable rounding bottom-right corner only (when rounding > 0.0f, we default to all corners). Wax 0x08.
3185 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersNone = 1 << 8, // AddRect(), AddRectFilled(), PathRect(): disable rounding on all corners (when rounding > 0.0f). This is NOT zero, NOT an implicit flag!
3186 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTop = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopLeft | ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopRight,
3187 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottom = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomLeft | ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomRight,
3188 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersLeft = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomLeft | ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopLeft,
3189 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersRight = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomRight | ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopRight,
3190 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersAll = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopLeft | ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopRight | ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomLeft | ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomRight,
3191 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersDefault_ = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersAll, // Default to ALL corners if none of the _RoundCornersXX flags are specified.
3192 ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersMask_ = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersAll | ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersNone,
3193};
3194
3195// Flags for ImDrawList instance. Those are set automatically by ImGui:: functions from ImGuiIO settings, and generally not manipulated directly.
3196// It is however possible to temporarily alter flags between calls to ImDrawList:: functions.
3197enum ImDrawListFlags_
3198{
3199 ImDrawListFlags_None = 0,
3200 ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedLines = 1 << 0, // Enable anti-aliased lines/borders (*2 the number of triangles for 1.0f wide line or lines thin enough to be drawn using textures, otherwise *3 the number of triangles)
3201 ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedLinesUseTex = 1 << 1, // Enable anti-aliased lines/borders using textures when possible. Require backend to render with bilinear filtering (NOT point/nearest filtering).
3202 ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedFill = 1 << 2, // Enable anti-aliased edge around filled shapes (rounded rectangles, circles).
3203 ImDrawListFlags_AllowVtxOffset = 1 << 3, // Can emit 'VtxOffset > 0' to allow large meshes. Set when 'ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset' is enabled.
3204};
3205
3206// Draw command list
3207// This is the low-level list of polygons that ImGui:: functions are filling. At the end of the frame,
3208// all command lists are passed to your ImGuiIO::RenderDrawListFn function for rendering.
3209// Each dear imgui window contains its own ImDrawList. You can use ImGui::GetWindowDrawList() to
3210// access the current window draw list and draw custom primitives.
3211// You can interleave normal ImGui:: calls and adding primitives to the current draw list.
3212// In single viewport mode, top-left is == GetMainViewport()->Pos (generally 0,0), bottom-right is == GetMainViewport()->Pos+Size (generally io.DisplaySize).
3213// You are totally free to apply whatever transformation matrix you want to the data (depending on the use of the transformation you may want to apply it to ClipRect as well!)
3214// Important: Primitives are always added to the list and not culled (culling is done at higher-level by ImGui:: functions), if you use this API a lot consider coarse culling your drawn objects.
3215struct ImDrawList
3216{
3217 // This is what you have to render
3218 ImVector<ImDrawCmd> CmdBuffer; // Draw commands. Typically 1 command = 1 GPU draw call, unless the command is a callback.
3219 ImVector<ImDrawIdx> IdxBuffer; // Index buffer. Each command consume ImDrawCmd::ElemCount of those
3220 ImVector<ImDrawVert> VtxBuffer; // Vertex buffer.
3221 ImDrawListFlags Flags; // Flags, you may poke into these to adjust anti-aliasing settings per-primitive.
3222
3223 // [Internal, used while building lists]
3224 unsigned int _VtxCurrentIdx; // [Internal] generally == VtxBuffer.Size unless we are past 64K vertices, in which case this gets reset to 0.
3225 ImDrawListSharedData* _Data; // Pointer to shared draw data (you can use ImGui::GetDrawListSharedData() to get the one from current ImGui context)
3226 ImDrawVert* _VtxWritePtr; // [Internal] point within VtxBuffer.Data after each add command (to avoid using the ImVector<> operators too much)
3227 ImDrawIdx* _IdxWritePtr; // [Internal] point within IdxBuffer.Data after each add command (to avoid using the ImVector<> operators too much)
3228 ImVector<ImVec2> _Path; // [Internal] current path building
3229 ImDrawCmdHeader _CmdHeader; // [Internal] template of active commands. Fields should match those of CmdBuffer.back().
3230 ImDrawListSplitter _Splitter; // [Internal] for channels api (note: prefer using your own persistent instance of ImDrawListSplitter!)
3231 ImVector<ImVec4> _ClipRectStack; // [Internal]
3232 ImVector<ImTextureID> _TextureIdStack; // [Internal]
3233 ImVector<ImU8> _CallbacksDataBuf; // [Internal]
3234 float _FringeScale; // [Internal] anti-alias fringe is scaled by this value, this helps to keep things sharp while zooming at vertex buffer content
3235 const char* _OwnerName; // Pointer to owner window's name for debugging
3236
3237 // If you want to create ImDrawList instances, pass them ImGui::GetDrawListSharedData().
3238 // (advanced: you may create and use your own ImDrawListSharedData so you can use ImDrawList without ImGui, but that's more involved)
3239 IMGUI_API ImDrawList(ImDrawListSharedData* shared_data);
3240 IMGUI_API ~ImDrawList();
3241
3242 IMGUI_API void PushClipRect(const ImVec2& clip_rect_min, const ImVec2& clip_rect_max, bool intersect_with_current_clip_rect = false); // Render-level scissoring. This is passed down to your render function but not used for CPU-side coarse clipping. Prefer using higher-level ImGui::PushClipRect() to affect logic (hit-testing and widget culling)
3243 IMGUI_API void PushClipRectFullScreen();
3244 IMGUI_API void PopClipRect();
3245 IMGUI_API void PushTextureID(ImTextureID texture_id);
3246 IMGUI_API void PopTextureID();
3247 inline ImVec2 GetClipRectMin() const { const ImVec4& cr = _ClipRectStack.back(); return ImVec2(cr.x, cr.y); }
3248 inline ImVec2 GetClipRectMax() const { const ImVec4& cr = _ClipRectStack.back(); return ImVec2(cr.z, cr.w); }
3249
3250 // Primitives
3251 // - Filled shapes must always use clockwise winding order. The anti-aliasing fringe depends on it. Counter-clockwise shapes will have "inward" anti-aliasing.
3252 // - For rectangular primitives, "p_min" and "p_max" represent the upper-left and lower-right corners.
3253 // - For circle primitives, use "num_segments == 0" to automatically calculate tessellation (preferred).
3254 // In older versions (until Dear ImGui 1.77) the AddCircle functions defaulted to num_segments == 12.
3255 // In future versions we will use textures to provide cheaper and higher-quality circles.
3256 // Use AddNgon() and AddNgonFilled() functions if you need to guarantee a specific number of sides.
3257 IMGUI_API void AddLine(const ImVec2& p1, const ImVec2& p2, ImU32 col, float thickness = 1.0f);
3258 IMGUI_API void AddRect(const ImVec2& p_min, const ImVec2& p_max, ImU32 col, float rounding = 0.0f, ImDrawFlags flags = 0, float thickness = 1.0f); // a: upper-left, b: lower-right (== upper-left + size)
3259 IMGUI_API void AddRectFilled(const ImVec2& p_min, const ImVec2& p_max, ImU32 col, float rounding = 0.0f, ImDrawFlags flags = 0); // a: upper-left, b: lower-right (== upper-left + size)
3260 IMGUI_API void AddRectFilledMultiColor(const ImVec2& p_min, const ImVec2& p_max, ImU32 col_upr_left, ImU32 col_upr_right, ImU32 col_bot_right, ImU32 col_bot_left);
3261 IMGUI_API void AddQuad(const ImVec2& p1, const ImVec2& p2, const ImVec2& p3, const ImVec2& p4, ImU32 col, float thickness = 1.0f);
3262 IMGUI_API void AddQuadFilled(const ImVec2& p1, const ImVec2& p2, const ImVec2& p3, const ImVec2& p4, ImU32 col);
3263 IMGUI_API void AddTriangle(const ImVec2& p1, const ImVec2& p2, const ImVec2& p3, ImU32 col, float thickness = 1.0f);
3264 IMGUI_API void AddTriangleFilled(const ImVec2& p1, const ImVec2& p2, const ImVec2& p3, ImU32 col);
3265 IMGUI_API void AddCircle(const ImVec2& center, float radius, ImU32 col, int num_segments = 0, float thickness = 1.0f);
3266 IMGUI_API void AddCircleFilled(const ImVec2& center, float radius, ImU32 col, int num_segments = 0);
3267 IMGUI_API void AddNgon(const ImVec2& center, float radius, ImU32 col, int num_segments, float thickness = 1.0f);
3268 IMGUI_API void AddNgonFilled(const ImVec2& center, float radius, ImU32 col, int num_segments);
3269 IMGUI_API void AddEllipse(const ImVec2& center, const ImVec2& radius, ImU32 col, float rot = 0.0f, int num_segments = 0, float thickness = 1.0f);
3270 IMGUI_API void AddEllipseFilled(const ImVec2& center, const ImVec2& radius, ImU32 col, float rot = 0.0f, int num_segments = 0);
3271 IMGUI_API void AddText(const ImVec2& pos, ImU32 col, const char* text_begin, const char* text_end = NULL);
3272 IMGUI_API void AddText(ImFont* font, float font_size, const ImVec2& pos, ImU32 col, const char* text_begin, const char* text_end = NULL, float wrap_width = 0.0f, const ImVec4* cpu_fine_clip_rect = NULL);
3273 IMGUI_API void AddBezierCubic(const ImVec2& p1, const ImVec2& p2, const ImVec2& p3, const ImVec2& p4, ImU32 col, float thickness, int num_segments = 0); // Cubic Bezier (4 control points)
3274 IMGUI_API void AddBezierQuadratic(const ImVec2& p1, const ImVec2& p2, const ImVec2& p3, ImU32 col, float thickness, int num_segments = 0); // Quadratic Bezier (3 control points)
3275
3276 // General polygon
3277 // - Only simple polygons are supported by filling functions (no self-intersections, no holes).
3278 // - Concave polygon fill is more expensive than convex one: it has O(N^2) complexity. Provided as a convenience for the user but not used by the main library.
3279 IMGUI_API void AddPolyline(const ImVec2* points, int num_points, ImU32 col, ImDrawFlags flags, float thickness);
3280 IMGUI_API void AddConvexPolyFilled(const ImVec2* points, int num_points, ImU32 col);
3281 IMGUI_API void AddConcavePolyFilled(const ImVec2* points, int num_points, ImU32 col);
3282
3283 // Image primitives
3284 // - Read FAQ to understand what ImTextureID is.
3285 // - "p_min" and "p_max" represent the upper-left and lower-right corners of the rectangle.
3286 // - "uv_min" and "uv_max" represent the normalized texture coordinates to use for those corners. Using (0,0)->(1,1) texture coordinates will generally display the entire texture.
3287 IMGUI_API void AddImage(ImTextureID user_texture_id, const ImVec2& p_min, const ImVec2& p_max, const ImVec2& uv_min = ImVec2(0, 0), const ImVec2& uv_max = ImVec2(1, 1), ImU32 col = IM_COL32_WHITE);
3288 IMGUI_API void AddImageQuad(ImTextureID user_texture_id, const ImVec2& p1, const ImVec2& p2, const ImVec2& p3, const ImVec2& p4, const ImVec2& uv1 = ImVec2(0, 0), const ImVec2& uv2 = ImVec2(1, 0), const ImVec2& uv3 = ImVec2(1, 1), const ImVec2& uv4 = ImVec2(0, 1), ImU32 col = IM_COL32_WHITE);
3289 IMGUI_API void AddImageRounded(ImTextureID user_texture_id, const ImVec2& p_min, const ImVec2& p_max, const ImVec2& uv_min, const ImVec2& uv_max, ImU32 col, float rounding, ImDrawFlags flags = 0);
3290
3291 // Stateful path API, add points then finish with PathFillConvex() or PathStroke()
3292 // - Important: filled shapes must always use clockwise winding order! The anti-aliasing fringe depends on it. Counter-clockwise shapes will have "inward" anti-aliasing.
3293 // so e.g. 'PathArcTo(center, radius, PI * -0.5f, PI)' is ok, whereas 'PathArcTo(center, radius, PI, PI * -0.5f)' won't have correct anti-aliasing when followed by PathFillConvex().
3294 inline void PathClear() { _Path.Size = 0; }
3295 inline void PathLineTo(const ImVec2& pos) { _Path.push_back(pos); }
3296 inline void PathLineToMergeDuplicate(const ImVec2& pos) { if (_Path.Size == 0 || memcmp(&_Path.Data[_Path.Size - 1], &pos, 8) != 0) _Path.push_back(pos); }
3297 inline void PathFillConvex(ImU32 col) { AddConvexPolyFilled(_Path.Data, _Path.Size, col); _Path.Size = 0; }
3298 inline void PathFillConcave(ImU32 col) { AddConcavePolyFilled(_Path.Data, _Path.Size, col); _Path.Size = 0; }
3299 inline void PathStroke(ImU32 col, ImDrawFlags flags = 0, float thickness = 1.0f) { AddPolyline(_Path.Data, _Path.Size, col, flags, thickness); _Path.Size = 0; }
3300 IMGUI_API void PathArcTo(const ImVec2& center, float radius, float a_min, float a_max, int num_segments = 0);
3301 IMGUI_API void PathArcToFast(const ImVec2& center, float radius, int a_min_of_12, int a_max_of_12); // Use precomputed angles for a 12 steps circle
3302 IMGUI_API void PathEllipticalArcTo(const ImVec2& center, const ImVec2& radius, float rot, float a_min, float a_max, int num_segments = 0); // Ellipse
3303 IMGUI_API void PathBezierCubicCurveTo(const ImVec2& p2, const ImVec2& p3, const ImVec2& p4, int num_segments = 0); // Cubic Bezier (4 control points)
3304 IMGUI_API void PathBezierQuadraticCurveTo(const ImVec2& p2, const ImVec2& p3, int num_segments = 0); // Quadratic Bezier (3 control points)
3305 IMGUI_API void PathRect(const ImVec2& rect_min, const ImVec2& rect_max, float rounding = 0.0f, ImDrawFlags flags = 0);
3306
3307 // Advanced: Draw Callbacks
3308 // - May be used to alter render state (change sampler, blending, current shader). May be used to emit custom rendering commands (difficult to do correctly, but possible).
3309 // - Use special ImDrawCallback_ResetRenderState callback to instruct backend to reset its render state to the default.
3310 // - Your rendering loop must check for 'UserCallback' in ImDrawCmd and call the function instead of rendering triangles. All standard backends are honoring this.
3311 // - For some backends, the callback may access selected render-states exposed by the backend in a ImGui_ImplXXXX_RenderState structure pointed to by platform_io.Renderer_RenderState.
3312 // - IMPORTANT: please be mindful of the different level of indirection between using size==0 (copying argument) and using size>0 (copying pointed data into a buffer).
3313 // - If userdata_size == 0: we copy/store the 'userdata' argument as-is. It will be available unmodified in ImDrawCmd::UserCallbackData during render.
3314 // - If userdata_size > 0, we copy/store 'userdata_size' bytes pointed to by 'userdata'. We store them in a buffer stored inside the drawlist. ImDrawCmd::UserCallbackData will point inside that buffer so you have to retrieve data from there. Your callback may need to use ImDrawCmd::UserCallbackDataSize if you expect dynamically-sized data.
3315 // - Support for userdata_size > 0 was added in v1.91.4, October 2024. So earlier code always only allowed to copy/store a simple void*.
3316 IMGUI_API void AddCallback(ImDrawCallback callback, void* userdata, size_t userdata_size = 0);
3317
3318 // Advanced: Miscellaneous
3319 IMGUI_API void AddDrawCmd(); // This is useful if you need to forcefully create a new draw call (to allow for dependent rendering / blending). Otherwise primitives are merged into the same draw-call as much as possible
3320 IMGUI_API ImDrawList* CloneOutput() const; // Create a clone of the CmdBuffer/IdxBuffer/VtxBuffer.
3321
3322 // Advanced: Channels
3323 // - Use to split render into layers. By switching channels to can render out-of-order (e.g. submit FG primitives before BG primitives)
3324 // - Use to minimize draw calls (e.g. if going back-and-forth between multiple clipping rectangles, prefer to append into separate channels then merge at the end)
3325 // - This API shouldn't have been in ImDrawList in the first place!
3326 // Prefer using your own persistent instance of ImDrawListSplitter as you can stack them.
3327 // Using the ImDrawList::ChannelsXXXX you cannot stack a split over another.
3328 inline void ChannelsSplit(int count) { _Splitter.Split(this, count); }
3329 inline void ChannelsMerge() { _Splitter.Merge(this); }
3330 inline void ChannelsSetCurrent(int n) { _Splitter.SetCurrentChannel(this, n); }
3331
3332 // Advanced: Primitives allocations
3333 // - We render triangles (three vertices)
3334 // - All primitives needs to be reserved via PrimReserve() beforehand.
3335 IMGUI_API void PrimReserve(int idx_count, int vtx_count);
3336 IMGUI_API void PrimUnreserve(int idx_count, int vtx_count);
3337 IMGUI_API void PrimRect(const ImVec2& a, const ImVec2& b, ImU32 col); // Axis aligned rectangle (composed of two triangles)
3338 IMGUI_API void PrimRectUV(const ImVec2& a, const ImVec2& b, const ImVec2& uv_a, const ImVec2& uv_b, ImU32 col);
3339 IMGUI_API void PrimQuadUV(const ImVec2& a, const ImVec2& b, const ImVec2& c, const ImVec2& d, const ImVec2& uv_a, const ImVec2& uv_b, const ImVec2& uv_c, const ImVec2& uv_d, ImU32 col);
3340 inline void PrimWriteVtx(const ImVec2& pos, const ImVec2& uv, ImU32 col) { _VtxWritePtr->pos = pos; _VtxWritePtr->uv = uv; _VtxWritePtr->col = col; _VtxWritePtr++; _VtxCurrentIdx++; }
3341 inline void PrimWriteIdx(ImDrawIdx idx) { *_IdxWritePtr = idx; _IdxWritePtr++; }
3342 inline void PrimVtx(const ImVec2& pos, const ImVec2& uv, ImU32 col) { PrimWriteIdx((ImDrawIdx)_VtxCurrentIdx); PrimWriteVtx(pos, uv, col); } // Write vertex with unique index
3343
3344 // Obsolete names
3345 //inline void AddEllipse(const ImVec2& center, float radius_x, float radius_y, ImU32 col, float rot = 0.0f, int num_segments = 0, float thickness = 1.0f) { AddEllipse(center, ImVec2(radius_x, radius_y), col, rot, num_segments, thickness); } // OBSOLETED in 1.90.5 (Mar 2024)
3346 //inline void AddEllipseFilled(const ImVec2& center, float radius_x, float radius_y, ImU32 col, float rot = 0.0f, int num_segments = 0) { AddEllipseFilled(center, ImVec2(radius_x, radius_y), col, rot, num_segments); } // OBSOLETED in 1.90.5 (Mar 2024)
3347 //inline void PathEllipticalArcTo(const ImVec2& center, float radius_x, float radius_y, float rot, float a_min, float a_max, int num_segments = 0) { PathEllipticalArcTo(center, ImVec2(radius_x, radius_y), rot, a_min, a_max, num_segments); } // OBSOLETED in 1.90.5 (Mar 2024)
3348 //inline void AddBezierCurve(const ImVec2& p1, const ImVec2& p2, const ImVec2& p3, const ImVec2& p4, ImU32 col, float thickness, int num_segments = 0) { AddBezierCubic(p1, p2, p3, p4, col, thickness, num_segments); } // OBSOLETED in 1.80 (Jan 2021)
3349 //inline void PathBezierCurveTo(const ImVec2& p2, const ImVec2& p3, const ImVec2& p4, int num_segments = 0) { PathBezierCubicCurveTo(p2, p3, p4, num_segments); } // OBSOLETED in 1.80 (Jan 2021)
3350
3351 // [Internal helpers]
3352 IMGUI_API void _ResetForNewFrame();
3353 IMGUI_API void _ClearFreeMemory();
3354 IMGUI_API void _PopUnusedDrawCmd();
3355 IMGUI_API void _TryMergeDrawCmds();
3356 IMGUI_API void _OnChangedClipRect();
3357 IMGUI_API void _OnChangedTextureID();
3358 IMGUI_API void _OnChangedVtxOffset();
3359 IMGUI_API void _SetTextureID(ImTextureID texture_id);
3360 IMGUI_API int _CalcCircleAutoSegmentCount(float radius) const;
3361 IMGUI_API void _PathArcToFastEx(const ImVec2& center, float radius, int a_min_sample, int a_max_sample, int a_step);
3362 IMGUI_API void _PathArcToN(const ImVec2& center, float radius, float a_min, float a_max, int num_segments);
3363};
3364
3365// All draw data to render a Dear ImGui frame
3366// (NB: the style and the naming convention here is a little inconsistent, we currently preserve them for backward compatibility purpose,
3367// as this is one of the oldest structure exposed by the library! Basically, ImDrawList == CmdList)
3368struct ImDrawData
3369{
3370 bool Valid; // Only valid after Render() is called and before the next NewFrame() is called.
3371 int CmdListsCount; // Number of ImDrawList* to render
3372 int TotalIdxCount; // For convenience, sum of all ImDrawList's IdxBuffer.Size
3373 int TotalVtxCount; // For convenience, sum of all ImDrawList's VtxBuffer.Size
3374 ImVector<ImDrawList*> CmdLists; // Array of ImDrawList* to render. The ImDrawLists are owned by ImGuiContext and only pointed to from here.
3375 ImVec2 DisplayPos; // Top-left position of the viewport to render (== top-left of the orthogonal projection matrix to use) (== GetMainViewport()->Pos for the main viewport, == (0.0) in most single-viewport applications)
3376 ImVec2 DisplaySize; // Size of the viewport to render (== GetMainViewport()->Size for the main viewport, == io.DisplaySize in most single-viewport applications)
