3377 ImVec2 FramebufferScale; // Amount of pixels for each unit of DisplaySize. Based on io.DisplayFramebufferScale. Generally (1,1) on normal display, (2,2) on OSX with Retina display.
3378 ImGuiViewport* OwnerViewport; // Viewport carrying the ImDrawData instance, might be of use to the renderer (generally not).
3379
3380 // Functions
3381 ImDrawData() { Clear(); }
3382 IMGUI_API void Clear();
3383 IMGUI_API void AddDrawList(ImDrawList* draw_list); // Helper to add an external draw list into an existing ImDrawData.
3384 IMGUI_API void DeIndexAllBuffers(); // Helper to convert all buffers from indexed to non-indexed, in case you cannot render indexed. Note: this is slow and most likely a waste of resources. Always prefer indexed rendering!
3385 IMGUI_API void ScaleClipRects(const ImVec2& fb_scale); // Helper to scale the ClipRect field of each ImDrawCmd. Use if your final output buffer is at a different scale than Dear ImGui expects, or if there is a difference between your window resolution and framebuffer resolution.
3386};
3387
3388//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3389// [SECTION] Font API (ImFontConfig, ImFontGlyph, ImFontAtlasFlags, ImFontAtlas, ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder, ImFont)
3390//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3391
3392// A font input/source (we may rename this to ImFontSource in the future)
3393struct ImFontConfig
3394{
3395 void* FontData; // // TTF/OTF data
3396 int FontDataSize; // // TTF/OTF data size
3397 bool FontDataOwnedByAtlas; // true // TTF/OTF data ownership taken by the container ImFontAtlas (will delete memory itself).
3398 bool MergeMode; // false // Merge into previous ImFont, so you can combine multiple inputs font into one ImFont (e.g. ASCII font + icons + Japanese glyphs). You may want to use GlyphOffset.y when merge font of different heights.
3399 bool PixelSnapH; // false // Align every glyph AdvanceX to pixel boundaries. Useful e.g. if you are merging a non-pixel aligned font with the default font. If enabled, you can set OversampleH/V to 1.
3400 int FontNo; // 0 // Index of font within TTF/OTF file
3401 int OversampleH; // 0 (2) // Rasterize at higher quality for sub-pixel positioning. 0 == auto == 1 or 2 depending on size. Note the difference between 2 and 3 is minimal. You can reduce this to 1 for large glyphs save memory. Read https://github.com/nothings/stb/blob/master/tests/oversample/README.md for details.
3402 int OversampleV; // 0 (1) // Rasterize at higher quality for sub-pixel positioning. 0 == auto == 1. This is not really useful as we don't use sub-pixel positions on the Y axis.
3403 float SizePixels; // // Size in pixels for rasterizer (more or less maps to the resulting font height).
3404 //ImVec2 GlyphExtraSpacing; // 0, 0 // (REMOVED IN 1.91.9: use GlyphExtraAdvanceX)
3405 ImVec2 GlyphOffset; // 0, 0 // Offset all glyphs from this font input.
3406 const ImWchar* GlyphRanges; // NULL // THE ARRAY DATA NEEDS TO PERSIST AS LONG AS THE FONT IS ALIVE. Pointer to a user-provided list of Unicode range (2 value per range, values are inclusive, zero-terminated list).
3407 float GlyphMinAdvanceX; // 0 // Minimum AdvanceX for glyphs, set Min to align font icons, set both Min/Max to enforce mono-space font
3408 float GlyphMaxAdvanceX; // FLT_MAX // Maximum AdvanceX for glyphs
3409 float GlyphExtraAdvanceX; // 0 // Extra spacing (in pixels) between glyphs. Please contact us if you are using this.
3410 unsigned int FontBuilderFlags; // 0 // Settings for custom font builder. THIS IS BUILDER IMPLEMENTATION DEPENDENT. Leave as zero if unsure.
3411 float RasterizerMultiply; // 1.0f // Linearly brighten (>1.0f) or darken (<1.0f) font output. Brightening small fonts may be a good workaround to make them more readable. This is a silly thing we may remove in the future.
3412 float RasterizerDensity; // 1.0f // DPI scale for rasterization, not altering other font metrics: make it easy to swap between e.g. a 100% and a 400% fonts for a zooming display, or handle Retina screen. IMPORTANT: If you change this it is expected that you increase/decrease font scale roughly to the inverse of this, otherwise quality may look lowered.
3413 ImWchar EllipsisChar; // 0 // Explicitly specify Unicode codepoint of ellipsis character. When fonts are being merged first specified ellipsis will be used.
3414
3415 // [Internal]
3416 char Name[40]; // Name (strictly to ease debugging)
3417 ImFont* DstFont;
3418
3419 IMGUI_API ImFontConfig();
3420};
3421
3422// Hold rendering data for one glyph.
3423// (Note: some language parsers may fail to convert the 31+1 bitfield members, in this case maybe drop store a single u32 or we can rework this)
3424struct ImFontGlyph
3425{
3426 unsigned int Colored : 1; // Flag to indicate glyph is colored and should generally ignore tinting (make it usable with no shift on little-endian as this is used in loops)
3427 unsigned int Visible : 1; // Flag to indicate glyph has no visible pixels (e.g. space). Allow early out when rendering.
3428 unsigned int Codepoint : 30; // 0x0000..0x10FFFF
3429 float AdvanceX; // Horizontal distance to advance layout with
3430 float X0, Y0, X1, Y1; // Glyph corners
3431 float U0, V0, U1, V1; // Texture coordinates
3432};
3433
3434// Helper to build glyph ranges from text/string data. Feed your application strings/characters to it then call BuildRanges().
3435// This is essentially a tightly packed of vector of 64k booleans = 8KB storage.
3436struct ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder
3437{
3438 ImVector<ImU32> UsedChars; // Store 1-bit per Unicode code point (0=unused, 1=used)
3439
3440 ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder() { Clear(); }
3441 inline void Clear() { int size_in_bytes = (IM_UNICODE_CODEPOINT_MAX + 1) / 8; UsedChars.resize(size_in_bytes / (int)sizeof(ImU32)); memset(UsedChars.Data, 0, (size_t)size_in_bytes); }
3442 inline bool GetBit(size_t n) const { int off = (int)(n >> 5); ImU32 mask = 1u << (n & 31); return (UsedChars[off] & mask) != 0; } // Get bit n in the array
3443 inline void SetBit(size_t n) { int off = (int)(n >> 5); ImU32 mask = 1u << (n & 31); UsedChars[off] |= mask; } // Set bit n in the array
3444 inline void AddChar(ImWchar c) { SetBit(c); } // Add character
3445 IMGUI_API void AddText(const char* text, const char* text_end = NULL); // Add string (each character of the UTF-8 string are added)
3446 IMGUI_API void AddRanges(const ImWchar* ranges); // Add ranges, e.g. builder.AddRanges(ImFontAtlas::GetGlyphRangesDefault()) to force add all of ASCII/Latin+Ext
3447 IMGUI_API void BuildRanges(ImVector<ImWchar>* out_ranges); // Output new ranges
3448};
3449
3450// See ImFontAtlas::AddCustomRectXXX functions.
3451struct ImFontAtlasCustomRect
3452{
3453 unsigned short X, Y; // Output // Packed position in Atlas
3454
3455 // [Internal]
3456 unsigned short Width, Height; // Input // Desired rectangle dimension
3457 unsigned int GlyphID : 31; // Input // For custom font glyphs only (ID < 0x110000)
3458 unsigned int GlyphColored : 1; // Input // For custom font glyphs only: glyph is colored, removed tinting.
3459 float GlyphAdvanceX; // Input // For custom font glyphs only: glyph xadvance
3460 ImVec2 GlyphOffset; // Input // For custom font glyphs only: glyph display offset
3461 ImFont* Font; // Input // For custom font glyphs only: target font
3462 ImFontAtlasCustomRect() { X = Y = 0xFFFF; Width = Height = 0; GlyphID = 0; GlyphColored = 0; GlyphAdvanceX = 0.0f; GlyphOffset = ImVec2(0, 0); Font = NULL; }
3463 bool IsPacked() const { return X != 0xFFFF; }
3464};
3465
3466// Flags for ImFontAtlas build
3467enum ImFontAtlasFlags_
3468{
3469 ImFontAtlasFlags_None = 0,
3470 ImFontAtlasFlags_NoPowerOfTwoHeight = 1 << 0, // Don't round the height to next power of two
3471 ImFontAtlasFlags_NoMouseCursors = 1 << 1, // Don't build software mouse cursors into the atlas (save a little texture memory)
3472 ImFontAtlasFlags_NoBakedLines = 1 << 2, // Don't build thick line textures into the atlas (save a little texture memory, allow support for point/nearest filtering). The AntiAliasedLinesUseTex features uses them, otherwise they will be rendered using polygons (more expensive for CPU/GPU).
3473};
3474
3475// Load and rasterize multiple TTF/OTF fonts into a same texture. The font atlas will build a single texture holding:
3476// - One or more fonts.
3477// - Custom graphics data needed to render the shapes needed by Dear ImGui.
3478// - Mouse cursor shapes for software cursor rendering (unless setting 'Flags |= ImFontAtlasFlags_NoMouseCursors' in the font atlas).
3479// It is the user-code responsibility to setup/build the atlas, then upload the pixel data into a texture accessible by your graphics api.
3480// - Optionally, call any of the AddFont*** functions. If you don't call any, the default font embedded in the code will be loaded for you.
3481// - Call GetTexDataAsAlpha8() or GetTexDataAsRGBA32() to build and retrieve pixels data.
3482// - Upload the pixels data into a texture within your graphics system (see imgui_impl_xxxx.cpp examples)
3483// - Call SetTexID(my_tex_id); and pass the pointer/identifier to your texture in a format natural to your graphics API.
3484// This value will be passed back to you during rendering to identify the texture. Read FAQ entry about ImTextureID for more details.
3485// Common pitfalls:
3486// - If you pass a 'glyph_ranges' array to AddFont*** functions, you need to make sure that your array persist up until the
3487// atlas is build (when calling GetTexData*** or Build()). We only copy the pointer, not the data.
3488// - Important: By default, AddFontFromMemoryTTF() takes ownership of the data. Even though we are not writing to it, we will free the pointer on destruction.
3489// You can set font_cfg->FontDataOwnedByAtlas=false to keep ownership of your data and it won't be freed,
3490// - Even though many functions are suffixed with "TTF", OTF data is supported just as well.
3491// - This is an old API and it is currently awkward for those and various other reasons! We will address them in the future!
3492struct ImFontAtlas
3493{
3494 IMGUI_API ImFontAtlas();
3495 IMGUI_API ~ImFontAtlas();
3496 IMGUI_API ImFont* AddFont(const ImFontConfig* font_cfg);
3497 IMGUI_API ImFont* AddFontDefault(const ImFontConfig* font_cfg = NULL);
3498 IMGUI_API ImFont* AddFontFromFileTTF(const char* filename, float size_pixels, const ImFontConfig* font_cfg = NULL, const ImWchar* glyph_ranges = NULL);
3499 IMGUI_API ImFont* AddFontFromMemoryTTF(void* font_data, int font_data_size, float size_pixels, const ImFontConfig* font_cfg = NULL, const ImWchar* glyph_ranges = NULL); // Note: Transfer ownership of 'ttf_data' to ImFontAtlas! Will be deleted after destruction of the atlas. Set font_cfg->FontDataOwnedByAtlas=false to keep ownership of your data and it won't be freed.
3500 IMGUI_API ImFont* AddFontFromMemoryCompressedTTF(const void* compressed_font_data, int compressed_font_data_size, float size_pixels, const ImFontConfig* font_cfg = NULL, const ImWchar* glyph_ranges = NULL); // 'compressed_font_data' still owned by caller. Compress with binary_to_compressed_c.cpp.
3501 IMGUI_API ImFont* AddFontFromMemoryCompressedBase85TTF(const char* compressed_font_data_base85, float size_pixels, const ImFontConfig* font_cfg = NULL, const ImWchar* glyph_ranges = NULL); // 'compressed_font_data_base85' still owned by caller. Compress with binary_to_compressed_c.cpp with -base85 parameter.
3502 IMGUI_API void ClearInputData(); // Clear input data (all ImFontConfig structures including sizes, TTF data, glyph ranges, etc.) = all the data used to build the texture and fonts.
3503 IMGUI_API void ClearFonts(); // Clear input+output font data (same as ClearInputData() + glyphs storage, UV coordinates).
3504 IMGUI_API void ClearTexData(); // Clear output texture data (CPU side). Saves RAM once the texture has been copied to graphics memory.
3505 IMGUI_API void Clear(); // Clear all input and output.
3506
3507 // Build atlas, retrieve pixel data.
3508 // User is in charge of copying the pixels into graphics memory (e.g. create a texture with your engine). Then store your texture handle with SetTexID().
3509 // The pitch is always = Width * BytesPerPixels (1 or 4)
3510 // Building in RGBA32 format is provided for convenience and compatibility, but note that unless you manually manipulate or copy color data into
3511 // the texture (e.g. when using the AddCustomRect*** api), then the RGB pixels emitted will always be white (~75% of memory/bandwidth waste.
3512 IMGUI_API bool Build(); // Build pixels data. This is called automatically for you by the GetTexData*** functions.
3513 IMGUI_API void GetTexDataAsAlpha8(unsigned char** out_pixels, int* out_width, int* out_height, int* out_bytes_per_pixel = NULL); // 1 byte per-pixel
3514 IMGUI_API void GetTexDataAsRGBA32(unsigned char** out_pixels, int* out_width, int* out_height, int* out_bytes_per_pixel = NULL); // 4 bytes-per-pixel
3515 bool IsBuilt() const { return Fonts.Size > 0 && TexReady; } // Bit ambiguous: used to detect when user didn't build texture but effectively we should check TexID != 0 except that would be backend dependent...
3516 void SetTexID(ImTextureID id) { TexID = id; }
3517
3518 //-------------------------------------------
3519 // Glyph Ranges
3520 //-------------------------------------------
3521
3522 // Helpers to retrieve list of common Unicode ranges (2 value per range, values are inclusive, zero-terminated list)
3523 // NB: Make sure that your string are UTF-8 and NOT in your local code page.
3524 // Read https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/blob/master/docs/FONTS.md/#about-utf-8-encoding for details.
3525 // NB: Consider using ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder to build glyph ranges from textual data.
3526 IMGUI_API const ImWchar* GetGlyphRangesDefault(); // Basic Latin, Extended Latin
3527 IMGUI_API const ImWchar* GetGlyphRangesGreek(); // Default + Greek and Coptic
3528 IMGUI_API const ImWchar* GetGlyphRangesKorean(); // Default + Korean characters
3529 IMGUI_API const ImWchar* GetGlyphRangesJapanese(); // Default + Hiragana, Katakana, Half-Width, Selection of 2999 Ideographs
3530 IMGUI_API const ImWchar* GetGlyphRangesChineseFull(); // Default + Half-Width + Japanese Hiragana/Katakana + full set of about 21000 CJK Unified Ideographs
3531 IMGUI_API const ImWchar* GetGlyphRangesChineseSimplifiedCommon();// Default + Half-Width + Japanese Hiragana/Katakana + set of 2500 CJK Unified Ideographs for common simplified Chinese
3532 IMGUI_API const ImWchar* GetGlyphRangesCyrillic(); // Default + about 400 Cyrillic characters
3533 IMGUI_API const ImWchar* GetGlyphRangesThai(); // Default + Thai characters
3534 IMGUI_API const ImWchar* GetGlyphRangesVietnamese(); // Default + Vietnamese characters
3535
3536 //-------------------------------------------
3537 // [ALPHA] Custom Rectangles/Glyphs API
3538 //-------------------------------------------
3539
3540 // You can request arbitrary rectangles to be packed into the atlas, for your own purposes.
3541 // - After calling Build(), you can query the rectangle position and render your pixels.
3542 // - If you render colored output, set 'atlas->TexPixelsUseColors = true' as this may help some backends decide of preferred texture format.
3543 // - You can also request your rectangles to be mapped as font glyph (given a font + Unicode point),
3544 // so you can render e.g. custom colorful icons and use them as regular glyphs.
3545 // - Read docs/FONTS.md for more details about using colorful icons.
3546 // - Note: this API may be redesigned later in order to support multi-monitor varying DPI settings.
3547 IMGUI_API int AddCustomRectRegular(int width, int height);
3548 IMGUI_API int AddCustomRectFontGlyph(ImFont* font, ImWchar id, int width, int height, float advance_x, const ImVec2& offset = ImVec2(0, 0));
3549 ImFontAtlasCustomRect* GetCustomRectByIndex(int index) { IM_ASSERT(index >= 0); return &CustomRects[index]; }
3550
3551 // [Internal]
3552 IMGUI_API void CalcCustomRectUV(const ImFontAtlasCustomRect* rect, ImVec2* out_uv_min, ImVec2* out_uv_max) const;
3553
3554 //-------------------------------------------
3555 // Members
3556 //-------------------------------------------
3557
3558 // Input
3559 ImFontAtlasFlags Flags; // Build flags (see ImFontAtlasFlags_)
3560 ImTextureID TexID; // User data to refer to the texture once it has been uploaded to user's graphic systems. It is passed back to you during rendering via the ImDrawCmd structure.
3561 int TexDesiredWidth; // Texture width desired by user before Build(). Must be a power-of-two. If have many glyphs your graphics API have texture size restrictions you may want to increase texture width to decrease height.
3562 int TexGlyphPadding; // FIXME: Should be called "TexPackPadding". Padding between glyphs within texture in pixels. Defaults to 1. If your rendering method doesn't rely on bilinear filtering you may set this to 0 (will also need to set AntiAliasedLinesUseTex = false).
3563 void* UserData; // Store your own atlas related user-data (if e.g. you have multiple font atlas).
3564
3565 // [Internal]
3566 // NB: Access texture data via GetTexData*() calls! Which will setup a default font for you.
3567 bool Locked; // Marked as Locked by ImGui::NewFrame() so attempt to modify the atlas will assert.
3568 bool TexReady; // Set when texture was built matching current font input
3569 bool TexPixelsUseColors; // Tell whether our texture data is known to use colors (rather than just alpha channel), in order to help backend select a format.
3570 unsigned char* TexPixelsAlpha8; // 1 component per pixel, each component is unsigned 8-bit. Total size = TexWidth * TexHeight
3571 unsigned int* TexPixelsRGBA32; // 4 component per pixel, each component is unsigned 8-bit. Total size = TexWidth * TexHeight * 4
3572 int TexWidth; // Texture width calculated during Build().
3573 int TexHeight; // Texture height calculated during Build().
3574 ImVec2 TexUvScale; // = (1.0f/TexWidth, 1.0f/TexHeight)
3575 ImVec2 TexUvWhitePixel; // Texture coordinates to a white pixel
3576 ImVector<ImFont*> Fonts; // Hold all the fonts returned by AddFont*. Fonts[0] is the default font upon calling ImGui::NewFrame(), use ImGui::PushFont()/PopFont() to change the current font.
3577 ImVector<ImFontAtlasCustomRect> CustomRects; // Rectangles for packing custom texture data into the atlas.
3578 ImVector<ImFontConfig> Sources; // Source/configuration data
3579 ImVec4 TexUvLines[IM_DRAWLIST_TEX_LINES_WIDTH_MAX + 1]; // UVs for baked anti-aliased lines
3580
3581 // [Internal] Font builder
3582 const ImFontBuilderIO* FontBuilderIO; // Opaque interface to a font builder (default to stb_truetype, can be changed to use FreeType by defining IMGUI_ENABLE_FREETYPE).
3583 unsigned int FontBuilderFlags; // Shared flags (for all fonts) for custom font builder. THIS IS BUILD IMPLEMENTATION DEPENDENT. Per-font override is also available in ImFontConfig.
3584
3585 // [Internal] Packing data
3586 int PackIdMouseCursors; // Custom texture rectangle ID for white pixel and mouse cursors
3587 int PackIdLines; // Custom texture rectangle ID for baked anti-aliased lines
3588
3589 // [Obsolete]
3590 //typedef ImFontAtlasCustomRect CustomRect; // OBSOLETED in 1.72+
3591 //typedef ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder GlyphRangesBuilder; // OBSOLETED in 1.67+
3592};
3593
3594// Font runtime data and rendering
3595// ImFontAtlas automatically loads a default embedded font for you when you call GetTexDataAsAlpha8() or GetTexDataAsRGBA32().
3596struct ImFont
3597{
3598 // [Internal] Members: Hot ~20/24 bytes (for CalcTextSize)
3599 ImVector<float> IndexAdvanceX; // 12-16 // out // Sparse. Glyphs->AdvanceX in a directly indexable way (cache-friendly for CalcTextSize functions which only this info, and are often bottleneck in large UI).
3600 float FallbackAdvanceX; // 4 // out // = FallbackGlyph->AdvanceX
3601 float FontSize; // 4 // in // Height of characters/line, set during loading (don't change after loading)
3602
3603 // [Internal] Members: Hot ~28/40 bytes (for RenderText loop)
3604 ImVector<ImU16> IndexLookup; // 12-16 // out // Sparse. Index glyphs by Unicode code-point.
3605 ImVector<ImFontGlyph> Glyphs; // 12-16 // out // All glyphs.
3606 ImFontGlyph* FallbackGlyph; // 4-8 // out // = FindGlyph(FontFallbackChar)
3607
3608 // [Internal] Members: Cold ~32/40 bytes
3609 // Conceptually Sources[] is the list of font sources merged to create this font.
3610 ImFontAtlas* ContainerAtlas; // 4-8 // out // What we has been loaded into
3611 ImFontConfig* Sources; // 4-8 // in // Pointer within ContainerAtlas->Sources[], to SourcesCount instances
3612 short SourcesCount; // 2 // in // Number of ImFontConfig involved in creating this font. Usually 1, or >1 when merging multiple font sources into one ImFont.
3613 short EllipsisCharCount; // 1 // out // 1 or 3
3614 ImWchar EllipsisChar; // 2-4 // out // Character used for ellipsis rendering ('...').
3615 ImWchar FallbackChar; // 2-4 // out // Character used if a glyph isn't found (U+FFFD, '?')
3616 float EllipsisWidth; // 4 // out // Total ellipsis Width
3617 float EllipsisCharStep; // 4 // out // Step between characters when EllipsisCount > 0
3618 float Scale; // 4 // in // Base font scale (1.0f), multiplied by the per-window font scale which you can adjust with SetWindowFontScale()
3619 float Ascent, Descent; // 4+4 // out // Ascent: distance from top to bottom of e.g. 'A' [0..FontSize] (unscaled)
3620 int MetricsTotalSurface;// 4 // out // Total surface in pixels to get an idea of the font rasterization/texture cost (not exact, we approximate the cost of padding between glyphs)
3621 bool DirtyLookupTables; // 1 // out //
3622 ImU8 Used8kPagesMap[(IM_UNICODE_CODEPOINT_MAX+1)/8192/8]; // 1 bytes if ImWchar=ImWchar16, 16 bytes if ImWchar==ImWchar32. Store 1-bit for each block of 4K codepoints that has one active glyph. This is mainly used to facilitate iterations across all used codepoints.
3623
3624 // Methods
3625 IMGUI_API ImFont();
3626 IMGUI_API ~ImFont();
3627 IMGUI_API ImFontGlyph* FindGlyph(ImWchar c);
3628 IMGUI_API ImFontGlyph* FindGlyphNoFallback(ImWchar c);
3629 float GetCharAdvance(ImWchar c) { return ((int)c < IndexAdvanceX.Size) ? IndexAdvanceX[(int)c] : FallbackAdvanceX; }
3630 bool IsLoaded() const { return ContainerAtlas != NULL; }
3631 const char* GetDebugName() const { return Sources ? Sources->Name : "<unknown>"; }
3632
3633 // [Internal] Don't use!
3634 // 'max_width' stops rendering after a certain width (could be turned into a 2d size). FLT_MAX to disable.
3635 // 'wrap_width' enable automatic word-wrapping across multiple lines to fit into given width. 0.0f to disable.
3636 IMGUI_API ImVec2 CalcTextSizeA(float size, float max_width, float wrap_width, const char* text_begin, const char* text_end = NULL, const char** remaining = NULL); // utf8
3637 IMGUI_API const char* CalcWordWrapPositionA(float scale, const char* text, const char* text_end, float wrap_width);
3638 IMGUI_API void RenderChar(ImDrawList* draw_list, float size, const ImVec2& pos, ImU32 col, ImWchar c);
3639 IMGUI_API void RenderText(ImDrawList* draw_list, float size, const ImVec2& pos, ImU32 col, const ImVec4& clip_rect, const char* text_begin, const char* text_end, float wrap_width = 0.0f, bool cpu_fine_clip = false);
3640
3641 // [Internal] Don't use!
3642 IMGUI_API void BuildLookupTable();
3643 IMGUI_API void ClearOutputData();
3644 IMGUI_API void GrowIndex(int new_size);
3645 IMGUI_API void AddGlyph(const ImFontConfig* src_cfg, ImWchar c, float x0, float y0, float x1, float y1, float u0, float v0, float u1, float v1, float advance_x);
3646 IMGUI_API void AddRemapChar(ImWchar dst, ImWchar src, bool overwrite_dst = true); // Makes 'dst' character/glyph points to 'src' character/glyph. Currently needs to be called AFTER fonts have been built.
3647 IMGUI_API bool IsGlyphRangeUnused(unsigned int c_begin, unsigned int c_last);
3648};
3649
3650//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3651// [SECTION] Viewports
3652//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3653
3654// Flags stored in ImGuiViewport::Flags, giving indications to the platform backends.
3655enum ImGuiViewportFlags_
3656{
3657 ImGuiViewportFlags_None = 0,
3658 ImGuiViewportFlags_IsPlatformWindow = 1 << 0, // Represent a Platform Window
3659 ImGuiViewportFlags_IsPlatformMonitor = 1 << 1, // Represent a Platform Monitor (unused yet)
3660 ImGuiViewportFlags_OwnedByApp = 1 << 2, // Platform Window: Is created/managed by the user application? (rather than our backend)
3661 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoDecoration = 1 << 3, // Platform Window: Disable platform decorations: title bar, borders, etc. (generally set all windows, but if ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsDecoration is set we only set this on popups/tooltips)
3662 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoTaskBarIcon = 1 << 4, // Platform Window: Disable platform task bar icon (generally set on popups/tooltips, or all windows if ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsNoTaskBarIcon is set)
3663 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing = 1 << 5, // Platform Window: Don't take focus when created.
3664 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoFocusOnClick = 1 << 6, // Platform Window: Don't take focus when clicked on.
3665 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs = 1 << 7, // Platform Window: Make mouse pass through so we can drag this window while peaking behind it.
3666 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoRendererClear = 1 << 8, // Platform Window: Renderer doesn't need to clear the framebuffer ahead (because we will fill it entirely).
3667 ImGuiViewportFlags_NoAutoMerge = 1 << 9, // Platform Window: Avoid merging this window into another host window. This can only be set via ImGuiWindowClass viewport flags override (because we need to now ahead if we are going to create a viewport in the first place!).
3668 ImGuiViewportFlags_TopMost = 1 << 10, // Platform Window: Display on top (for tooltips only).
3669 ImGuiViewportFlags_CanHostOtherWindows = 1 << 11, // Viewport can host multiple imgui windows (secondary viewports are associated to a single window). // FIXME: In practice there's still probably code making the assumption that this is always and only on the MainViewport. Will fix once we add support for "no main viewport".
3670
3671 // Output status flags (from Platform)
3672 ImGuiViewportFlags_IsMinimized = 1 << 12, // Platform Window: Window is minimized, can skip render. When minimized we tend to avoid using the viewport pos/size for clipping window or testing if they are contained in the viewport.
3673 ImGuiViewportFlags_IsFocused = 1 << 13, // Platform Window: Window is focused (last call to Platform_GetWindowFocus() returned true)
3674};
3675
3676// - Currently represents the Platform Window created by the application which is hosting our Dear ImGui windows.
3677// - With multi-viewport enabled, we extend this concept to have multiple active viewports.
3678// - In the future we will extend this concept further to also represent Platform Monitor and support a "no main platform window" operation mode.
3679// - About Main Area vs Work Area:
3680// - Main Area = entire viewport.
3681// - Work Area = entire viewport minus sections used by main menu bars (for platform windows), or by task bar (for platform monitor).
3682// - Windows are generally trying to stay within the Work Area of their host viewport.
3683struct ImGuiViewport
3684{
3685 ImGuiID ID; // Unique identifier for the viewport
3686 ImGuiViewportFlags Flags; // See ImGuiViewportFlags_
3687 ImVec2 Pos; // Main Area: Position of the viewport (Dear ImGui coordinates are the same as OS desktop/native coordinates)
3688 ImVec2 Size; // Main Area: Size of the viewport.
3689 ImVec2 WorkPos; // Work Area: Position of the viewport minus task bars, menus bars, status bars (>= Pos)
3690 ImVec2 WorkSize; // Work Area: Size of the viewport minus task bars, menu bars, status bars (<= Size)
3691 float DpiScale; // 1.0f = 96 DPI = No extra scale.
3692 ImGuiID ParentViewportId; // (Advanced) 0: no parent. Instruct the platform backend to setup a parent/child relationship between platform windows.
3693 ImDrawData* DrawData; // The ImDrawData corresponding to this viewport. Valid after Render() and until the next call to NewFrame().
3694
3695 // Platform/Backend Dependent Data
3696 // Our design separate the Renderer and Platform backends to facilitate combining default backends with each others.
3697 // When our create your own backend for a custom engine, it is possible that both Renderer and Platform will be handled
3698 // by the same system and you may not need to use all the UserData/Handle fields.
3699 // The library never uses those fields, they are merely storage to facilitate backend implementation.
3700 void* RendererUserData; // void* to hold custom data structure for the renderer (e.g. swap chain, framebuffers etc.). generally set by your Renderer_CreateWindow function.
3701 void* PlatformUserData; // void* to hold custom data structure for the OS / platform (e.g. windowing info, render context). generally set by your Platform_CreateWindow function.
3702 void* PlatformHandle; // void* to hold higher-level, platform window handle (e.g. HWND for Win32 backend, Uint32 WindowID for SDL, GLFWWindow* for GLFW), for FindViewportByPlatformHandle().
3703 void* PlatformHandleRaw; // void* to hold lower-level, platform-native window handle (always HWND on Win32 platform, unused for other platforms).
3704 bool PlatformWindowCreated; // Platform window has been created (Platform_CreateWindow() has been called). This is false during the first frame where a viewport is being created.
3705 bool PlatformRequestMove; // Platform window requested move (e.g. window was moved by the OS / host window manager, authoritative position will be OS window position)
3706 bool PlatformRequestResize; // Platform window requested resize (e.g. window was resized by the OS / host window manager, authoritative size will be OS window size)
3707 bool PlatformRequestClose; // Platform window requested closure (e.g. window was moved by the OS / host window manager, e.g. pressing ALT-F4)
3708
3709 ImGuiViewport() { memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this)); }
3710 ~ImGuiViewport() { IM_ASSERT(PlatformUserData == NULL && RendererUserData == NULL); }
3711
3712 // Helpers
3713 ImVec2 GetCenter() const { return ImVec2(Pos.x + Size.x * 0.5f, Pos.y + Size.y * 0.5f); }
3714 ImVec2 GetWorkCenter() const { return ImVec2(WorkPos.x + WorkSize.x * 0.5f, WorkPos.y + WorkSize.y * 0.5f); }
3715};
3716
3717//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3718// [SECTION] ImGuiPlatformIO + other Platform Dependent Interfaces (ImGuiPlatformMonitor, ImGuiPlatformImeData)
3719//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3720
3721// [BETA] (Optional) Multi-Viewport Support!
3722// If you are new to Dear ImGui and trying to integrate it into your engine, you can probably ignore this for now.
3723//
3724// This feature allows you to seamlessly drag Dear ImGui windows outside of your application viewport.
3725// This is achieved by creating new Platform/OS windows on the fly, and rendering into them.
3726// Dear ImGui manages the viewport structures, and the backend create and maintain one Platform/OS window for each of those viewports.
3727//
3728// See Recap: https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Multi-Viewports
3729// See Glossary https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Glossary for details about some of the terminology.
3730//
3731// About the coordinates system:
3732// - When multi-viewports are enabled, all Dear ImGui coordinates become absolute coordinates (same as OS coordinates!)
3733// - So e.g. ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(ImVec2(0,0)) will position a window relative to your primary monitor!
3734// - If you want to position windows relative to your main application viewport, use ImGui::GetMainViewport()->Pos as a base position.
3735//
3736// Steps to use multi-viewports in your application, when using a default backend from the examples/ folder:
3737// - Application: Enable feature with 'io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable'.
3738// - Backend: The backend initialization will setup all necessary ImGuiPlatformIO's functions and update monitors info every frame.
3739// - Application: In your main loop, call ImGui::UpdatePlatformWindows(), ImGui::RenderPlatformWindowsDefault() after EndFrame() or Render().
3740// - Application: Fix absolute coordinates used in ImGui::SetWindowPos() or ImGui::SetNextWindowPos() calls.
3741//
3742// Steps to use multi-viewports in your application, when using a custom backend:
3743// - Important: THIS IS NOT EASY TO DO and comes with many subtleties not described here!
3744// It's also an experimental feature, so some of the requirements may evolve.
3745// Consider using default backends if you can. Either way, carefully follow and refer to examples/ backends for details.
3746// - Application: Enable feature with 'io.ConfigFlags |= ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable'.
3747// - Backend: Hook ImGuiPlatformIO's Platform_* and Renderer_* callbacks (see below).
3748// Set 'io.BackendFlags |= ImGuiBackendFlags_PlatformHasViewports' and 'io.BackendFlags |= ImGuiBackendFlags_PlatformHasViewports'.
3749// Update ImGuiPlatformIO's Monitors list every frame.
3750// Update MousePos every frame, in absolute coordinates.
3751// - Application: In your main loop, call ImGui::UpdatePlatformWindows(), ImGui::RenderPlatformWindowsDefault() after EndFrame() or Render().
3752// You may skip calling RenderPlatformWindowsDefault() if its API is not convenient for your needs. Read comments below.
3753// - Application: Fix absolute coordinates used in ImGui::SetWindowPos() or ImGui::SetNextWindowPos() calls.
3754//
3755// About ImGui::RenderPlatformWindowsDefault():
3756// - This function is a mostly a _helper_ for the common-most cases, and to facilitate using default backends.
3757// - You can check its simple source code to understand what it does.
3758// It basically iterates secondary viewports and call 4 functions that are setup in ImGuiPlatformIO, if available:
3759// Platform_RenderWindow(), Renderer_RenderWindow(), Platform_SwapBuffers(), Renderer_SwapBuffers()
3760// Those functions pointers exists only for the benefit of RenderPlatformWindowsDefault().
3761// - If you have very specific rendering needs (e.g. flipping multiple swap-chain simultaneously, unusual sync/threading issues, etc.),
3762// you may be tempted to ignore RenderPlatformWindowsDefault() and write customized code to perform your renderingg.
3763// You may decide to setup the platform_io's *RenderWindow and *SwapBuffers pointers and call your functions through those pointers,
3764// or you may decide to never setup those pointers and call your code directly. They are a convenience, not an obligatory interface.
3765//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3766
3767// Access via ImGui::GetPlatformIO()
3768struct ImGuiPlatformIO
3769{
3770 IMGUI_API ImGuiPlatformIO();
3771
3772 //------------------------------------------------------------------
3773 // Input - Interface with OS and Platform backend (most common stuff)
3774 //------------------------------------------------------------------
3775
3776 // Optional: Access OS clipboard
3777 // (default to use native Win32 clipboard on Windows, otherwise uses a private clipboard. Override to access OS clipboard on other architectures)
3778 const char* (*Platform_GetClipboardTextFn)(ImGuiContext* ctx);
3779 void (*Platform_SetClipboardTextFn)(ImGuiContext* ctx, const char* text);
3780 void* Platform_ClipboardUserData;
3781
3782 // Optional: Open link/folder/file in OS Shell
3783 // (default to use ShellExecuteW() on Windows, system() on Linux/Mac)
3784 bool (*Platform_OpenInShellFn)(ImGuiContext* ctx, const char* path);
3785 void* Platform_OpenInShellUserData;
3786
3787 // Optional: Notify OS Input Method Editor of the screen position of your cursor for text input position (e.g. when using Japanese/Chinese IME on Windows)
3788 // (default to use native imm32 api on Windows)
3789 void (*Platform_SetImeDataFn)(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiViewport* viewport, ImGuiPlatformImeData* data);
3790 void* Platform_ImeUserData;
3791 //void (*SetPlatformImeDataFn)(ImGuiViewport* viewport, ImGuiPlatformImeData* data); // [Renamed to platform_io.PlatformSetImeDataFn in 1.91.1]
3792
3793 // Optional: Platform locale
3794 // [Experimental] Configure decimal point e.g. '.' or ',' useful for some languages (e.g. German), generally pulled from *localeconv()->decimal_point
3795 ImWchar Platform_LocaleDecimalPoint; // '.'
3796
3797 //------------------------------------------------------------------
3798 // Input - Interface with Renderer Backend
3799 //------------------------------------------------------------------
3800
3801 // Written by some backends during ImGui_ImplXXXX_RenderDrawData() call to point backend_specific ImGui_ImplXXXX_RenderState* structure.
3802 void* Renderer_RenderState;
3803
3804 //------------------------------------------------------------------
3805 // Input - Interface with Platform & Renderer backends for Multi-Viewport support
3806 //------------------------------------------------------------------
3807
3808 // For reference, the second column shows which function are generally calling the Platform Functions:
3809 // N = ImGui::NewFrame() ~ beginning of the dear imgui frame: read info from platform/OS windows (latest size/position)
3810 // F = ImGui::Begin(), ImGui::EndFrame() ~ during the dear imgui frame
3811 // U = ImGui::UpdatePlatformWindows() ~ after the dear imgui frame: create and update all platform/OS windows
3812 // R = ImGui::RenderPlatformWindowsDefault() ~ render
3813 // D = ImGui::DestroyPlatformWindows() ~ shutdown
3814 // The general idea is that NewFrame() we will read the current Platform/OS state, and UpdatePlatformWindows() will write to it.
3815
3816 // The handlers are designed so we can mix and match two imgui_impl_xxxx files, one Platform backend and one Renderer backend.
3817 // Custom engine backends will often provide both Platform and Renderer interfaces together and so may not need to use all functions.
3818 // Platform functions are typically called _before_ their Renderer counterpart, apart from Destroy which are called the other way.
3819
3820 // Platform Backend functions (e.g. Win32, GLFW, SDL) ------------------- Called by -----
3821 void (*Platform_CreateWindow)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // . . U . . // Create a new platform window for the given viewport
3822 void (*Platform_DestroyWindow)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // N . U . D //
3823 void (*Platform_ShowWindow)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // . . U . . // Newly created windows are initially hidden so SetWindowPos/Size/Title can be called on them before showing the window
3824 void (*Platform_SetWindowPos)(ImGuiViewport* vp, ImVec2 pos); // . . U . . // Set platform window position (given the upper-left corner of client area)
3825 ImVec2 (*Platform_GetWindowPos)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // N . . . . //
3826 void (*Platform_SetWindowSize)(ImGuiViewport* vp, ImVec2 size); // . . U . . // Set platform window client area size (ignoring OS decorations such as OS title bar etc.)
3827 ImVec2 (*Platform_GetWindowSize)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // N . . . . // Get platform window client area size
3828 void (*Platform_SetWindowFocus)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // N . . . . // Move window to front and set input focus
3829 bool (*Platform_GetWindowFocus)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // . . U . . //
3830 bool (*Platform_GetWindowMinimized)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // N . . . . // Get platform window minimized state. When minimized, we generally won't attempt to get/set size and contents will be culled more easily
3831 void (*Platform_SetWindowTitle)(ImGuiViewport* vp, const char* str); // . . U . . // Set platform window title (given an UTF-8 string)
3832 void (*Platform_SetWindowAlpha)(ImGuiViewport* vp, float alpha); // . . U . . // (Optional) Setup global transparency (not per-pixel transparency)
3833 void (*Platform_UpdateWindow)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // . . U . . // (Optional) Called by UpdatePlatformWindows(). Optional hook to allow the platform backend from doing general book-keeping every frame.
3834 void (*Platform_RenderWindow)(ImGuiViewport* vp, void* render_arg); // . . . R . // (Optional) Main rendering (platform side! This is often unused, or just setting a "current" context for OpenGL bindings). 'render_arg' is the value passed to RenderPlatformWindowsDefault().
3835 void (*Platform_SwapBuffers)(ImGuiViewport* vp, void* render_arg); // . . . R . // (Optional) Call Present/SwapBuffers (platform side! This is often unused!). 'render_arg' is the value passed to RenderPlatformWindowsDefault().
3836 float (*Platform_GetWindowDpiScale)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // N . . . . // (Optional) [BETA] FIXME-DPI: DPI handling: Return DPI scale for this viewport. 1.0f = 96 DPI.
3837 void (*Platform_OnChangedViewport)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // . F . . . // (Optional) [BETA] FIXME-DPI: DPI handling: Called during Begin() every time the viewport we are outputting into changes, so backend has a chance to swap fonts to adjust style.
3838 ImVec4 (*Platform_GetWindowWorkAreaInsets)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // N . . . . // (Optional) [BETA] Get initial work area inset for the viewport (won't be covered by main menu bar, dockspace over viewport etc.). Default to (0,0),(0,0). 'safeAreaInsets' in iOS land, 'DisplayCutout' in Android land.
3839 int (*Platform_CreateVkSurface)(ImGuiViewport* vp, ImU64 vk_inst, const void* vk_allocators, ImU64* out_vk_surface); // (Optional) For a Vulkan Renderer to call into Platform code (since the surface creation needs to tie them both).
3840
3841 // Renderer Backend functions (e.g. DirectX, OpenGL, Vulkan) ------------ Called by -----
3842 void (*Renderer_CreateWindow)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // . . U . . // Create swap chain, frame buffers etc. (called after Platform_CreateWindow)
3843 void (*Renderer_DestroyWindow)(ImGuiViewport* vp); // N . U . D // Destroy swap chain, frame buffers etc. (called before Platform_DestroyWindow)
3844 void (*Renderer_SetWindowSize)(ImGuiViewport* vp, ImVec2 size); // . . U . . // Resize swap chain, frame buffers etc. (called after Platform_SetWindowSize)
3845 void (*Renderer_RenderWindow)(ImGuiViewport* vp, void* render_arg); // . . . R . // (Optional) Clear framebuffer, setup render target, then render the viewport->DrawData. 'render_arg' is the value passed to RenderPlatformWindowsDefault().
3846 void (*Renderer_SwapBuffers)(ImGuiViewport* vp, void* render_arg); // . . . R . // (Optional) Call Present/SwapBuffers. 'render_arg' is the value passed to RenderPlatformWindowsDefault().
3847
3848 // (Optional) Monitor list
3849 // - Updated by: app/backend. Update every frame to dynamically support changing monitor or DPI configuration.
3850 // - Used by: dear imgui to query DPI info, clamp popups/tooltips within same monitor and not have them straddle monitors.
3851 ImVector<ImGuiPlatformMonitor> Monitors;
3852
3853 //------------------------------------------------------------------
3854 // Output - List of viewports to render into platform windows
3855 //------------------------------------------------------------------
3856
3857 // Viewports list (the list is updated by calling ImGui::EndFrame or ImGui::Render)
3858 // (in the future we will attempt to organize this feature to remove the need for a "main viewport")
3859 ImVector<ImGuiViewport*> Viewports; // Main viewports, followed by all secondary viewports.
3860};
3861
3862// (Optional) This is required when enabling multi-viewport. Represent the bounds of each connected monitor/display and their DPI.
3863// We use this information for multiple DPI support + clamping the position of popups and tooltips so they don't straddle multiple monitors.
3864struct ImGuiPlatformMonitor
3865{
3866 ImVec2 MainPos, MainSize; // Coordinates of the area displayed on this monitor (Min = upper left, Max = bottom right)
3867 ImVec2 WorkPos, WorkSize; // Coordinates without task bars / side bars / menu bars. Used to avoid positioning popups/tooltips inside this region. If you don't have this info, please copy the value for MainPos/MainSize.
3868 float DpiScale; // 1.0f = 96 DPI
3869 void* PlatformHandle; // Backend dependant data (e.g. HMONITOR, GLFWmonitor*, SDL Display Index, NSScreen*)
3870 ImGuiPlatformMonitor() { MainPos = MainSize = WorkPos = WorkSize = ImVec2(0, 0); DpiScale = 1.0f; PlatformHandle = NULL; }
3871};
3872
3873// (Optional) Support for IME (Input Method Editor) via the platform_io.Platform_SetImeDataFn() function.
3874struct ImGuiPlatformImeData
3875{
3876 bool WantVisible; // A widget wants the IME to be visible
3877 ImVec2 InputPos; // Position of the input cursor
3878 float InputLineHeight; // Line height
3879
3880 ImGuiPlatformImeData() { memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this)); }
3881};
3882
3883//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3884// [SECTION] Obsolete functions and types
3885// (Will be removed! Read 'API BREAKING CHANGES' section in imgui.cpp for details)
3886// Please keep your copy of dear imgui up to date! Occasionally set '#define IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS' in imconfig.h to stay ahead.
3887//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3888
3889#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
3890namespace ImGui
3891{

3896 static inline void PopButtonRepeat() { PopItemFlag(); }
3897 static inline void PushTabStop(bool tab_stop) { PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoTabStop, !tab_stop); }
3898 static inline void PopTabStop() { PopItemFlag(); }
3899 IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetContentRegionMax(); // Content boundaries max (e.g. window boundaries including scrolling, or current column boundaries). You should never need this. Always use GetCursorScreenPos() and GetContentRegionAvail()!
3900 IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetWindowContentRegionMin(); // Content boundaries min for the window (roughly (0,0)-Scroll), in window-local coordinates. You should never need this. Always use GetCursorScreenPos() and GetContentRegionAvail()!
3901 IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetWindowContentRegionMax(); // Content boundaries max for the window (roughly (0,0)+Size-Scroll), in window-local coordinates. You should never need this. Always use GetCursorScreenPos() and GetContentRegionAvail()!

3979//-- OBSOLETED in 1.82 (from Mars 2021): flags for AddRect(), AddRectFilled(), AddImageRounded(), PathRect()
3980//typedef ImDrawFlags ImDrawCornerFlags;
3981//enum ImDrawCornerFlags_
3982//{
3983// ImDrawCornerFlags_None = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersNone, // Was == 0 prior to 1.82, this is now == ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersNone which is != 0 and not implicit
3984// ImDrawCornerFlags_TopLeft = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopLeft, // Was == 0x01 (1 << 0) prior to 1.82. Order matches ImDrawFlags_NoRoundCorner* flag (we exploit this internally).
3985// ImDrawCornerFlags_TopRight = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopRight, // Was == 0x02 (1 << 1) prior to 1.82.
3986// ImDrawCornerFlags_BotLeft = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomLeft, // Was == 0x04 (1 << 2) prior to 1.82.
3987// ImDrawCornerFlags_BotRight = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomRight, // Was == 0x08 (1 << 3) prior to 1.82.
3988// ImDrawCornerFlags_All = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersAll, // Was == 0x0F prior to 1.82
3989// ImDrawCornerFlags_Top = ImDrawCornerFlags_TopLeft | ImDrawCornerFlags_TopRight,
3990// ImDrawCornerFlags_Bot = ImDrawCornerFlags_BotLeft | ImDrawCornerFlags_BotRight,
3991// ImDrawCornerFlags_Left = ImDrawCornerFlags_TopLeft | ImDrawCornerFlags_BotLeft,
3992// ImDrawCornerFlags_Right = ImDrawCornerFlags_TopRight | ImDrawCornerFlags_BotRight,
3993//};
3994
3995// RENAMED and MERGED both ImGuiKey_ModXXX and ImGuiModFlags_XXX into ImGuiMod_XXX (from September 2022)
3996// RENAMED ImGuiKeyModFlags -> ImGuiModFlags in 1.88 (from April 2022). Exceptionally commented out ahead of obscolescence schedule to reduce confusion and because they were not meant to be used in the first place.
3997//typedef ImGuiKeyChord ImGuiModFlags; // == int. We generally use ImGuiKeyChord to mean "a ImGuiKey or-ed with any number of ImGuiMod_XXX value", so you may store mods in there.
3998//enum ImGuiModFlags_ { ImGuiModFlags_None = 0, ImGuiModFlags_Ctrl = ImGuiMod_Ctrl, ImGuiModFlags_Shift = ImGuiMod_Shift, ImGuiModFlags_Alt = ImGuiMod_Alt, ImGuiModFlags_Super = ImGuiMod_Super };
3999//typedef ImGuiKeyChord ImGuiKeyModFlags; // == int
4000//enum ImGuiKeyModFlags_ { ImGuiKeyModFlags_None = 0, ImGuiKeyModFlags_Ctrl = ImGuiMod_Ctrl, ImGuiKeyModFlags_Shift = ImGuiMod_Shift, ImGuiKeyModFlags_Alt = ImGuiMod_Alt, ImGuiKeyModFlags_Super = ImGuiMod_Super };
4001
4002#define IM_OFFSETOF(_TYPE,_MEMBER) offsetof(_TYPE, _MEMBER) // OBSOLETED IN 1.90 (now using C++11 standard version)
4003
4004#endif // #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
4005
4006// RENAMED IMGUI_DISABLE_METRICS_WINDOW > IMGUI_DISABLE_DEBUG_TOOLS in 1.88 (from June 2022)
4007#ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_METRICS_WINDOW
4008#error IMGUI_DISABLE_METRICS_WINDOW was renamed to IMGUI_DISABLE_DEBUG_TOOLS, please use new name.
4009#endif

4015#elif defined(__GNUC__)

4022
4023// Include imgui_user.h at the end of imgui.h
4024// May be convenient for some users to only explicitly include vanilla imgui.h and have extra stuff included.
4025#ifdef IMGUI_INCLUDE_IMGUI_USER_H
4026#ifdef IMGUI_USER_H_FILENAME
4027#include IMGUI_USER_H_FILENAME
4028#else
4029#include "imgui_user.h"
4030#endif
4031#endif
4032
4033#endif // #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE
ImColor
Definition imgui.h:2906
ImDrawChannel
